Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnoP
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on a business trip and didnt get to the hotel until 10pm. I asked if the restaurant was still open and they suggested I ordered my food at the bar whilst I took my bags up to the room. When I came down there was a glass of wine on the table and the food followed shortly, marinated salmon, which was delicious. Just what you need at the end of a busy day. Bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. Will definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION and quality!”
Reviews.Author: EZ1TelAviv
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights, and if we will return to Barcelons, this will be our choice. Location is perfect. In the center of the center. In the room (fourth floor) we did not hear the outside noise, it was really quite. Metro is just outside, turist info - 2 minutes, turist bus and other busses - same two minutes. Just walking distance from most of the interesting places in Barcelona. VERY clean, well preserved, well kept. Great service, fast reponsing, cooperative and helpfull. We had a BIG room. BEST value for the money. We did not use - but they give free access to Holm's Place for SPA services.

Reviews.Title: “trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ap80Lincolnshire Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was literally "easy to book" on the website. The Hotel has great service and brilliant location. The only thing I would say we did not have any Tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Also the roof terrace was closed for maintainance during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “good location and brilliant breakfast”
Reviews.Author: guppyLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, superb location and very delicious and reasonably priced breakfast. I was a bit disapointed that the roof garden was closed when I stayed here for it was one of the reasons for choosing this hotel. The shower power is excellent however there is no curtain or way of creating a swamp in the bathroom! Comfortable beds but wish there was somewhere to place suitcases on. Try to book a room higher than the first floor as it can get quite noisy otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “A+ location, very, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: inca186338
Reviews.Content: You will not be unhappy with this hotel. The airline chose this for us as our trip was rearranged at last minute. The location encourages exploration at all times of day and transport links are right outside the hotel. We booked a taxi from the airport but wish instead that we had just booked the bus as much cheaper and just as quick. Cafes, restaurants and great walks await you. The staff are helpful by automatically giving maps and information about the hotel. Brompton bikes are also available to hire. Rooms and breakfast is more than adequate. First class hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Navigatrix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located to explore the many different neighborhoods of Barcelona and has lots of great restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff was friendly, especially the women in the breakfast room as well as Maria and Rafa at the front desk. Breakfast was ample and delicious. The lobby bar and patio were beautiful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatalinRoca
Reviews.Content: Great location, great lobby area, very nice rooms. The hotel is located near Placa Catalunya, very close to Rambla. Free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Pulitzer!”
Reviews.Author: karenwaterloo_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer was the perfect spot for our Barcelona adventure ... great location, lovely room (417), easy access to the subway and all of the interesting neighbourhoods, and wonderful customer service in a city that often lacks good customer service. Many evenings, we would settle into the beautiful lobby bar for a glass of wine and a salad after a long day of poking around town. Wonderful breakfast buffet: Some may think it's expensive, but it was an excellent way to start the day (fresh fruit, great coffee and juice, hot and cold food selections) and allowed us to hold off til late afternoon to eat again. We found it to be excellent value. I would stay here again ... in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Eternity4
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent,20 metres from Placa de Catalunya. The staff are excellent and very polite. Wi-fi was free and available throughout the whole hotel,none of this stupid lobby only and then pay in your room availability.( thanks Pulitzer,really super service). The decor is fantastic and the breakfast was something to look forward to every morning. Room was great, request a double bed or you may get two singles. We got to check in early and this was not an issue like at many other hotels. The Pulitzer hotel's main thing in my opinion is its attention to detail. They just do everything really,really well. You can also get football tickets at the Barcelona FC store which is just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but Quiet and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SabinaLee
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location off the main tourist attraction La Rambra Plaza... The room was rather tight but the wi-fi worked well in the room so my nephew was able to log on and was able to get some home work done during the stay... The service was nice enough at the hotel. Not extra friendly but courteous enough, I guess. They offered a free use of the gym with the swimming facility, which was a bit of walk but it was a nice perk. I took advantage of using it one night. The Hotel has a nice seating / lounge area off the lobby with some nice books for browsing though I did not have much time to do it...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cccccddddd
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - great location on a quiet side street right off the Placa Catalunya, easy walk to most of the sights. Decor is modern, room was adequately sized with a larger bathroom than I expected, also loved the lobby bar for a cocktail before heading out for the evening. I emailed the front desk a few days before we arrived asking for help making a reservation at a restaurant for my husband's birthday, and on the day of his birthday the hotel actually sent up a huge chocolate cake and a happy birthday note to our room which was a really nice touch and totally unexpected. Definitely recommend booking direct on the hotel's website, we got a great discount for early booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rupert C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days mid march '12. The location was brilliant, couldn't have asked for more. Very clean rooms and Comfortable bed. Nice bathroom and robes! Staff were helpful, overall a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KJE_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our pre-cruise stay in the Hotel Pultizer. Pros: It's a modern hotel very close to Las Ramblas/Plaza de Catalunya. We were allowed to check-in when we arrived in the morning, which was very nice. The front desk staff was also very helpful and friendly. We ate dinner one night in the lounge (shared small plates). It was delicious. Bed was very comfortable. Cons: We could sometimes smell smoke in the hallway (but never in the rooms). In the bathroom, there was an open shower, (with just a half door) which made it a little hard to keep water from spraying into the rest of the bathroom. Recommended: Yes, definitely. We will probably stay here the next time we're in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: digifella
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights visiting a trade show in town. While the rooms are not generous in size they are modern, very clean and tastefully furnished. The central location was brilliant giving me easy access to the trade show by metro and to Los Ramblas etc at night. Staff were excellent and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and central”
Reviews.Author: treefrog40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011 and loved it. Room was a little small but quiet and clean which is all you need, especially if you have the dreaded 'man flu', which is just about the worst type of flu you can get I hear. About 1 minute from place de catalunya so perfect if you love shopping and you can walk to the sagrada familia in 20 mins unless the flu goes to your legs. Recommend it and it's in the Mr & Mrs Smith romantic hotel guide. Top tip, book direct via their website as its much cheaper and they offer discounts if you book online and early.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at the Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: jandon771
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on our first visit to Barcelona about 4 years ago. This time, just as then, we loved this hotel. (We found out about it on Tripadvisor.) A wonderful location just off the Plaza Catalonya and Metro close, it is a few short blocks to the top of La Rambla. A very nice multilingual front desk staff, A fun little bar in the lobby. A tasty buffet breakfast in the morning. Because it was a bit cold in February, the rooftop bar was closed, but it is a great place to go on a warm evening after a long day of seeing Gaudi attractions, drinking Sangria on La Rambla , having a pint at an Irish bar, or a fresh fish dinner at one of the many fine nearby restaurants. A guest mix of people from all walks of life. Tourists, businessmen, artists - you name it. Rooms are a bit on the small size, but the decor is delightful. They do have larger rooms if needed. We had to leave to catch a cruise, but we will be back. No complaints - only praise!

Reviews.Title: “Everything in place, in the right place, for a wonderful trip.”
Reviews.Author: dirkdewilde
Reviews.Content: In the city and better than the city: this is especially true for the Pulitzer hotel in Barcelona. - location is unbeatable if you want to be in the centre: right next to Catalunya square, yet still in the better (quieter, less touristy) side street, and in the beginning of the classy Eixample. - style is slick, modern and elegant. all the right details, up to the room and bathroom fittings, are good looking, ergonomically thought of and just work perfectly. the lounge downstairs breathes relaxation and just enough sex appeal to unwind to jazz music with a cocktail before hitting the nightlife, or just for a tea or coffee break with friends (or alone) during the day. - rooms are slightly small but we got a front balcony room with a bathroom on the back side opening up to a patio (perfect for airing the room). - wifi free everywhere, without password: seems so natural you'd think all hotels would have thought of this by now, but most of them want to squeeze your money out of this, this one rightfully doesn't. - breakfast includes all the local basics plus a decent selection of international standards (good cereals, nuts, etc). beautiful, verandah-like breakfast room with lots of light and just the right selection of lounge music , plus great service from the friendly staff put you in a positive mood for the day ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doors11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect for visiting Barcelona, the location, style of hotel was great. We had the 19 euro lunch deal in the restaruant which was delicious and very good value... Didn't have the breakfast or any of the other snacks... Free wi-fi is great, staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were quiet and stylish. The location is near the central part of Barcelona and top of La Rambla. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again, as well as try its hotel in Paris... Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisa l
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last March. We managed to get a really good deal for this hotel and it exceeded my expectations! Firstly, when you come out of the airport, you just need to get a bus into Barcelona which was inexpensive and a short trip. The bus stops in the main area which is only a few minutes walk to the hotel... The hotel is in a great area full of shops and restaurants. The hotel itself has a beautiful, minimalist lobby bar area which we used a couple of evenings before going out and they do great cocktails! The room was very close to the lift although we did not hear any noise. The rooms are decorated in a modern way and had a great bathroom full of tolietries which were replenished every day. We did not eat at the hotel preferring to sample the local cuisine and we asked the hotel to recommend a couple of places we could eat in the evening and we were really delighted with their choice. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again especially as we received such a good deal on the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Style in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Martin H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than once as I like the style and value offered by this hotel. Its right next to Place De Catalunya so in a great location. The boutique style is pleasing and the bedrooms are comfortable with the bonus of free wifi. Lobby bar is elegant and they have live jazz on Thursdays in Feb and March. Nice rooftop bar for the summer as well. Breakfast is a little limited and costs 16 Euros extra, but apart from that Im happy to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ThaisOReilly
Reviews.Content: Really nice boutique hotel. I loved every detail of it, very stylish. Right at Catalunia Square, every public transportation is right there. The lobby, bar and restaurants are beautiful, and so is the room. I wanted to stay there again a few months later but unfortunatelly the price went up a lot! It got to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again- charming, stylish w a touch of luxe, & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TravelisHeaven
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona in part to attend Primavera Sound. When choosing a hotel I considered staying closer to the parc de forum since it would have been less expensive and more of a usual sized room for us spoiled Americans:) I decided against this and chose Pulitzer for its amazing location and modern style. When we arrived it was about 30$ cab fare from the airport. A bus would have worked but we were super exhausted and had a few suitcases. Upon entering the hotel we were both impressed by the decor and as many have said there is definitely a social atmosphere in the lobby. Service was always gracious and even though we tried to speak in Spanish as much as we could, the staff was quick to switch to English when they could see we weren't following them. Breakfast was delicious with fantastic cheeses, meats, and breads. The coffee was exceptional as well. We loved our room for its layout, comfy bed, sleek amd spacoius bathroom and best of all, stellar view. While we were there protestors were camping out in a nearby park. One nights we were walking up the street back to our hotel a line of police with riot gear on began matching toward us and the park at we came from. The doorman to the Pulitzer literally opened the door and swooped us inside. It was exciting to say the least And impressive that ey wer looking out for their guests. This is not to imply that in any way this area is not safe...it is actually quiet. Just know that protestors or futbol can cause the streets anywhere downtown to becomea little crazy. We were able to walk from this spot to the Cathedral, of course Las Ramblas (which a portion of that street is a little sketchy) and Parc de Guell to name a few. We do like to walk a lot though :) If you have a chance to be sure you visit the zoo. Pulitzer Hotel is perfect for a romantic getaway and gets an A+ from us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Rooftop Restaurant, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mccallud
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were disembarking for a cruise leaving from Barcelona, and we needed a hotel for two nights to see the sites and get over jet-lag. Upon arriving we were booked into a single room with a king, and we walked into the room and our suitcases could not get into the room. My mother saw the room and immediately went downstairs to the front desk to try and increase the room size, if only slightly. They were very polite and dealt with her "demanding" ways and immediately moved us into a new and slightly larger room, but we had two twin beds. We were able to wheel our giant suitcases into the hall but could not get by the beds and there was no place to put the suitcases, or drawers or a shelf to get them off the floor. Each suitcase was placed by our beds and for the next two days there was a lot of side stepping and lifting. We are both very laid-back people who were excited about the beginning of an amazing trip, but I know less understanding people would freak out regarding this matter. The beds are very firm but have a nice rainfall shower. There was a slight balcony, about half a foot long, and as wide as the room so we could crawl out there and perch for a cigarette. The hotel decor is very beautiful, minimalistic and modern. Large chairs and sofas encompass the lobby with a very sheik bar. They even managed to find a vase, aka a watch pitcher, for a bouquet of flowers I obtained during dinner. The staff is very nice and my favorite part of the experience was the amazing roof-top terrace and bar. The appetizers are amazing, and they mix a mean cocktail while you gaze out over the shopping district. We were perfectly located to hit up tapa restaurants, bars, and the site-seeing bus tours. My only regret is not being able to spend more time in the city. Bottom Line: If you cannot afford the penthouse, and hate small rooms this is not the hotel for you. If you are passing through and more of a laid-back couple, this place is nice. Very friendly and accommodating staff, great bars and decor.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: neils_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel mid jan 2012. the location is perfect, right next to la ramles and the main square. We went on the open-top tour bus, which stops 100 yards from the hotel. the staff were lovely and couldnt do enough for you. i would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AnnSouthend
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews the night before I left and thought oh no but this hotel was excellent. We decided to get a tax as we were tired and it was only 21 euros so hardly worth the bother of getting on a bus for 5.30 each. The lobby and bar are beautiful and they did great cocktails. We asked about dinner on arrival but they said only room service at night so unsure how someone else had a reasonable dinner. The 3 course lunch menu for 18 euros looked good and we thought breakfast was fine and was included in our rate. Very European bread ham and cheese and pastries and fruit so don't go if you're expecting a fully cooked breakfast. No iron in the room but they did bring up ironing board and iron which has often been a problem in Europe elsewhere. We had a long narrow bath like the room long and narrow but nicely done. Bathroom was nice with an interesting selection of free products in Man and Woman boxes. Hair dryer was one of those wall fitted ones that you have to hold on so take your own if you want a good one. Double bed was 2 singles pushed together so they did move apart. Hotel was a great location and lots of places to eat if you head north up Las Ramblas. We walked everywhere 50 minutes to Park Guell and probably 30 minutes to the coast. Hotel staff were very helpful and stored our luggage all day and shopping we popped back with - all in all very pleased with this hotel. Rooftop bar looked nice but no use in January.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: gorichville
Reviews.Content: Its a hip hotel at the center of the town 5 min to Las Ramblas. Its modern or renovated 5 years ago. The rooms are quite small in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: scobal
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and had a very good experience. Rooms are small (like others in Spain) but clean and perfectly adequate. Hotel staff friendly and helpful although we never saw a bellhop (not a negative for us). The lounge/bar area is a perfect place to wind down-- comfortable, cozy and we ended up eating dinner here the first night since we got in late-- very nice food at a reasonable price. The location is very close to the metro and at the top of the Rambla but on a side street so you avoid the noise. Would definitely recommend this hotel for location, cleanliness, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer worthy of a prize? No, but it's a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: EllieMcMuffin
Reviews.Content: As noted by previous travellers the best thing about this hotel is the location. The room was really pleasant. I'd have preferred a double bed rather than 2 singles, if I'm honest but it wasn't a big deal. There was a very handy lighting system that controlled the ceiling and bedside lights and had various settings giving gadget lovers hours of fun. The bathroom was lovely and on the 5th floor there was no noise issues. I did have the best bloody mary served to me one evening. The bartender took real trouble and it was perfect. Couple of gripes, although the reception staff were helpful in general when I rang down for an additional blanket at 11pm I was told that they could not bring me anything until the night shift turned up at 12pm. Not great. The other issue was the breakfast. It was fine, but expensive and what should have been hot (eggs, bacon) was not remotely warm. There are plenty of other places for breakfast which are better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish boutique hotel where you feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: AdventurJunkie
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, well appointed rooms where the lobby feels for like your living room where you can relax with a coffee or drink. And in the warm months the roof top terrace is a wonderful place to escape bustling Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A decent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kumquattraveller Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think the pictures on Pulitzer's website makes it out to be better than what it actually is. The nicest part of the hotel was the lounge area which seemed cozy and intimate. Every time we walked past, there were always people sitting around either having drinks or just chatting with friends. However, our room was a little disappointing. It did not have the best layout but I guess they did what they could best with the space they had. As you enter, there is a long corridor which then leads to a small space which fits a cupboard and lounge chair. Then it's the bedroom which only fits the bed. I don't like watching TV from bed but you don't have a choice, the lounge chair is in the small square space next to the bedroom. If you have large pieces of luggage, other than the hallway, there is nowhere to put them. But if you put them in the hallway, it's hard to walk around it. I suppose the entrance to the room (a long hall way) makes it feel like it's your home/apartment but the rest of it feels a bit tight. The bathroom was nice though. We weren't facing the main road but could hear traffic and thought this would interrupt our sleep but it did not. It gets quieter at night and we're used to constant traffic passing by. Location-wise it was good. Again, it's another hotel right in the middle of it all. We walked everywhere from this hotel - to the beach, to Sagrada Familia and to Montjuc. However, if you prefer catching public transport, there are stops right near the hotel. There is also a Carrefour supermarket off La Rambla. We kind of expected a little bit more from this boutique hotel based on what we'd seen on their website so if we visited Barcelona again, we'd probably try a different boutique hotel. I guess we didn't find the Pulitzer special, just ordinary. I'm not sure how good the English is at the hotel though, at check-in I asked if there were any Christmas Markets near by and was told they are everywhere, on every street, around every corner. But afterwards, I realised they must have thought I asked if there were any Christmas lights. But in general, we found the English in Barcelona not that great. Almost forgot to mention - they provide free wireless internet, this was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Concertraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay in Barcelona at the Hotel Pulitzer which was recommended to us by friends who stayed there the month before. After flying overnight from the US, we arrived at the hotel around 10:30am. They allowed us to check in early which was great and very helpful. We were able to change clothes, wash up and hit the town. It was nice to have the option to take a nap if we wanted though. Barcelona is very tourist friendly and the Aerobus from the airport to Placa de Catalunya was perfect. It is only 5 Euro and is only short distance to Hotel Pulitzer (maybe 4-5 minutes with luggage). Being so close to the Place de Catalunya also has the added benefit of being close to the hop-on, hop-off bus stop (actually it is the main stop). We bought 2 days passes which were perfect for seeing the city. The hotel is just around the corner from Las Ramblas, which we actually liked a lot. We thought it would be too touristy for our taste but it actually had some good shops and restaurants. It also had a neat vibe as it is crowed day and night. The hotel is clean, staff very friendly, free wi-fi, decent sized room and good sized bathroom (no bath tub in our room), balcony, and very nicely decorated with a nice lounge and bar area. We didn't have breakfast included and it was 15 Euro so we decided to grab it on the go. The restaurant looked very nice but we didn't eat there during our stay. We were able to store our luggage the last day while we did some last minute sightseeing for free. Only downside was the beds were 2 twins pushed together. Not that uncommon in Europe though. All in all, a great hotel, very good value and second to none location for people wanting to see a lot of the city and be centrally located. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mindi B
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location - right by La Rambla. Our first night was tough because we were placed in a smoking room. Fortunately we were able to spend the second two nights in a non-smoking room. We enjoyed cocktails in the large lounge area that is beautifully decorated. The hotel is nice, but needs a little TLC. The paint is worn in many places and the floors are damaged.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel-Good location”
Reviews.Author: latravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for 3 nights. Overall it's a lovely modern hotel, the communal areas are very nice, I liked the bar & lounge area! Staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were smaller than I expected but nicely appointed; very clean and the beds were comfy. Hotel is located on a busy street but we were on the 4th floor and could not here the street noise. It's a good hotel for the price but I also stayed at the Hotel Neri on the 1st leg of my trip and would most likely stay at the Neri again over the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller76
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer was in a great location. We took the bus in from the airport and it was a short walk. The bathroom was awesome! Great shower, great products, even a robe and slippers. The bed was super comfortable. The hotel was very clean. The staff was helpful. We were there in late November, for 4 nights, so the rates were great. I am not sure during high season what the rates would be, but I felt like we got a great deal. In our case, it was an amazing hotel for the price. We were also able to use their sister hotel next door for internet access. The hotel also had free passes to a nearby gym which was nice. We left town via train. It would have been possible to take the metro to the train station. We decided to take a taxi because our traln left early in the morning. I believe it was less than 10 Euros. The rooftop bar was closed due to the season. The lobby bar was cool. The only negative (and it is minor) is that our room was very oddly shaped. It was a decent size, but most of the room was very narrow, so it was hard to find places to put suitcases. Overall, I definitely recommend the hotel. Its location was great.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Per N
Reviews.Content: This is in such a golden spot! Plaza catalunya just around the corner, and close to all shopping. Close to La Rambla too. Best thing is that the hotel is on a small, quiet street. If you get a room higher up the building you're perfectly fine and free from noise from the streets. It's very clean. Has good showers and beds. Nice lobby. Really full, rich, breakfast. Restaurant has good food, although only a bar menu at night. Gym is included (but in another building). This will be my choice of hotel when revisiting Barcelona. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: davidcarol
Reviews.Content: excellent location,very clean,bathroom supplies superb!There "easy food" served in the comfortable bar-lounge was very good.Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Iberia2011
Reviews.Content: Great location and great service. Staff was very nice & helpful with suggestions to restaurants nearby. Clean & Comfy Rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel centraly located”
Reviews.Author: DavidGeneva
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff. well decorate. Nice breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location Modern stay”
Reviews.Author: Sbuerger
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary location , easy access to public transport, close to lots of attractions and tour spots, tons of shops and restaurants at walking distance, small room, comfy matresses,clean , poor toiletry . It will our address in Barcelona from now on

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Uncomfortable Beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNila
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel strictly off of the reviews on Trip Advisor so I had pretty high expectations. I have stayed in several different hotels throughout Europe so I am well aware of the fact that most rooms are small in comparison to American standards. In our particular room, there was a huge column in the middle of the room making it even tinier that it already was! The bed was extremely uncomfortable to the point where neither my husband nor I felt that we had even one good night's sleep during our four night stay. On the other hand, the bar in the main lobby served FABULOUSLY deliciously made drinks. The bartenders really took their time to create perfection (it made the price worth while!). The location of the actual hotel was also great. Shopping galore was within walking distance and a train station was nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Location+ comfortable and chic”
Reviews.Author: NY C
Reviews.Content: This is a very chic hotel in the perfect location for a tourist, yet on a side street so very quiet. Between metro stops Universitat & Catalunya. The front dest very knowledgeable, booked reservations and had a picnic breakfast made for us, for we had a 6am flight. The room had every amenity you needed. The Wi-fi was speedy and no need for passcode. I don't know why others complained it? The breakfast was a huge breakfast buffet, not like others in Spain. Had many employees working and continually replenishing it. I have only 1 complain about this hotel and it was the pillows and comforter, they were a foam , not down! A hotel this nice and with these prices should not have poly-filled pillows and comforters! Got cold in the evening, no blanket in room. I called to get a blanket sent up at 1:30am. I was told I would have to come down and get it. I was no happy about that. Other than that, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: RichWSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Pulitzer Hotel, with nice rooms, comfortable beds and a great location. Ask for a room on Floor 2 or above, due to street and hotel bar noise.

Reviews.Title: “This should be in the top 10 Barcelona hotels!”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: I am very discriminating when selecting hotels and was extremely pleased with our four night stay at the Pulitzer. Others describe the excellent location which was one of the reasons I selected the hotel, as well as a 2010 article from the Los Angeles Times Travel Section recommending it. We chose a standard room with breakfast and were expecting a really small room. We could not have been more delighted with the room and the fantastic breakfast buffet each morning. I loved the modern design of the lobby and the rooms, and especially the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. We always like to stay in a hotel that offers a gym. The Pulitzer does not have one on site but offers a complimentary pass to an upscale health club a few blocks from the hotel. It was such a wonderful extra that we used every late afternoon after a day of touring. We were able to use all the equipment, attend classes and most importantly swim and use the spa. While we were in Barcelona, my husband needed the services of a physician. Within 30 minutes, the excellent Natalia arranged for Dr. Leon to attend to my husband. We had a fantastic 5 days in Barcelona and our stay at the Pulitizer

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: helen2412
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Mr & Mrs Smith - increasingly my bible for finding quirky, individual and stylish places without having to pay a fortune. This didn't disappoint. The location was great. Central, and about 15 minutes walk only to the Gothic Quarter, La Ribera and El Raval only slightly more. The rooms here (we had a standard) were small but stylishly done, with a generous size bathroom and great power shower. The downside for us is that we ended up in a smoking room despite (I thought) having asked for non-smoking. This is really a negative as the smell of smoke was incredibly strong and unpleasant so if you are a non-smoker i'd really really advise making very sure that you have a non-smoking room booked before you go. Having said that it didn't take too much away from the staff. The lobby and hotel bar were very funky and the staff were great, really keen to help and make suggestions. I;d take any restaurant suggestions with a pinch of salt however. There are so many great places out there that if the one you want to go to is booked, you are better just wandering round and settling on somewhere that appeals. the one time the hotel booked for us we ended up in somewhere where the food was good but the ambience was non-existent and it wasn't cheap. We had far better meals in all others restaurants on our stay. To summarise, this hotel is very low-key chic, very central, stylish and reasonable with friendly staff. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in Barceona”
Reviews.Author: Londonmammoth2
Reviews.Content: I've been to Barcelona a few times, and I always make a point of staying near Plaça Catalunya because for me that's the perfect location to explore all that this unrivalled city has to offer. I'm glad that I have found this great gem of a hotel just a few steps from the square. We were a group of 15 people. We had reserved 8 rooms in total, but through 2 different booking systems. So when we arrived at the hotel, I expected confusion, mayhem and arguments. Instead, all reception staff liaised simultaneously, and in a calm, collected and professional manner they had all our room keys ready within 15 minutes. That was a great first impression. Nobody changed rooms, and all were happy. The rooms were modern, ample in size, and very clean and comfortable. The street the hotel is on is surprisingly quiet, with relatively little traffic considering its location; so we had a great night's sleep every night. The lobby is decorated in a contemporary style, but is stll cosy and an oasis of calm in a busy city. The bar in the lobby is very good; but for a special experience one ought to go to the roof-top bar in the evenings both for pre-dinner drinks; and also for post-dinner partying. One weekend night we ventured onto the roof after dinner, and there was a party going on with DJ and a great lounge-type atmosphere. The sound of music was kept at a reasonable level (I guess in consideration for the neighbours) so when I went back to the room, I couldn't hear a thing from the roof. I loved the breakfasts and the quaint little courtyard you could have breakfast on. Ample, delicious and tastefully presented...and served until 12 noon I think! We found all the staff friendly and approachable, ready to offer advice if asked. What a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: LEOFRICK
Reviews.Content: For the price (139E inc. breakfast) it would be difficult to beat this hotel. Situated only one minute's walk from the Placa Catalunya, right at the top end of La Rambla, the Pulitzer is ideally located. From there, we walked to all the major tourist sites, including La Sagrada Familia (approx 20mins). The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet is plentiful and caters for a wide range of tastes. Bacon and egg if you want it, or pastries and fruit if that's your bag. Front desk staff speak several languages and are more than happy to assist in English, Spanish or whatever. They wee all very friendly, whatever the time of day. When (not if!) we go back to Barcelona we will be staying there again I think.

Reviews.Title: “Get the suite with balcony”
Reviews.Author: PeterPostLundsgaard
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Pulitzer in Barcelona. It is fairly priced, great located and all in all the best hotel deal you can make in city of Barcelona. The suite is extra great, it has a huge balcony with outdoor shover and furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Design & Super Central Location”
Reviews.Author: AleExplorer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in Barcelona and an excellent stay at Hotel Pulitzer. Situated just off Plaça de Catalunya and therefore La Rambla, the hotel is an excellent central base for a stay in Barcelona. We took the train from Barcelona airport, using a bargain T-10 ticket to get us there - costs less than 9 Euro and as the name suggests, allows you 10 journeys within a given zone. Two people can use one at the same time, so even if you just used it to get to and from the airport, it's the cheapest way of getting to the city centre. You can use it on the Metro as well. We got off the train at Passeig de Gracia and walked to the hotel. Took approx 10 mins and allowed us to get stuck into Barcelona straight away! Received well at the hotel and although our room wasn't available immediately, this didn't matter. We left our luggage and went for lunch at Can Paixano. A crazy experience but worth finding! Back at the hotel we checked into our room, second floor overlooking the street. A nice room, quite long but not particularly wide. Very spacious with high ceilings and a modern, contemporary design. Bed was very comfortable. Nice touch in the bathroom are the 'Man' and 'Woman' boxes. They contain things like a razor, aftershave balm, toothbrush and toothpaste. Great if you forgot something (although plenty of supermarkets nearby). Room also has things like a safe, minibar, flat screen TV and dimmable lights. Never used any of the other facilities at the hotel so difficult to comment on them. The bar and dining area all looked nice and well-presented though. On check-out we left our bags with reception (who were excellent on every occasion). They were happy to look after them for most of the day. Overall a very good stay and well worth the money paid (you should book well in advance for the best rate). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Hotel with Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: fdparce
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer has an outstanding location, less than s block from Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas - and a Starbucks. Las Ramblas reminds one of a Paris Boulevard and Placa de Catalunya is a transportation hub, including the popular hop-on, hop-off tour busses. The hotel is ultra modern. So modern we had trouble figuring out the high-tech automated lights in the room. The room was very nice and comfortable, with a flat screen TV and internet service. The bathroom was ultra modern. The restaurant has a nice patio and excellent food although we felt the breakfast buffet, although nice and extensive, was overpriced so we ate at Starbucks, which also had free (and better) internet service. On opposite end of the block from Starbuck,s on Las Ramblas is FNAC, a French department store, which has sidewalk tables and a really good self-service cafe for breakfast and lunch. The hotel staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. But, be warned, when getting directions from them, a "ten minute" walk to them can take up to 30 minutes for the rest of us. Overall, the Pulitzer is an excellent hotel which we hope to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagainsoon
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with staying at Hotel Pulitzer. The room was clean, modern and relaxing. The hotel was perfectly located allowing us to walk to most everything. The staff spoke English and were extremely helpful. We would certainly stay there again on a return visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: girlfromlondon
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed hotel. Cozy rooms (one of the cheaper ones but perfectly nice), smart bar for a drink, helpful staff who recommended a restaurant for us. The roof terrace looked lovely although it was raining so closed up when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: SimesD
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this is a perfectly located hotel just across the square from the airport bus stop. The rooms are very nicely styled in contemporary fashion with a very comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. The Reception staff were very welcoming and helpful upon arrival and the maid service excellent. Unfortunately, the service in the lobby bar was poor on the three evenings that we used it and certainly not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. However, as nobody else has commented on this I assume that we were just unlucky and it shouldn't put you off staying at what is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tonyhud
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here in Trip Advisor my wife and I booked this hotel for 2 days prior to our cruise and 2 days after the cruise. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located about one block off the Placa de Catalunya, which is the center of the city. It is also just at the top of Las Ramblas. It is a great location. The room is very spacious, clean and comfortable. Upon our arrival at 10am we were able to check in and a room was available within 15 minutes. This is truly a 4 star hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. If you are coming from the airport there is an airport bus that stops on the far side of Placa de Catalunya (about two short blocks from the hotel) that you can take and I believe the cost is approximately 6 euros each. A taxi from the airport will cost between 40 - 50 euros depending on the traffic and number of bags. A taxi from the hotel to the cruise port is approximately 20 euros. Having been to Europe several times I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Fran K
Reviews.Content: Situated steps from the Placa de Catalunya, the Hotel Pulitzer is a modern multi-story hotel. Our room and bathroom were spacious and comfortable. There is a wonderful lobby as well as bar to sit in. There is a lovely breakfast room if you choose to dine in. Convenient to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to explore central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DandKOntheroadagain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, within easy walking distance of the Plaza Catalunya train station, and the Aerobus stop. It is minutes from The Ramblas, but far enough away to escape the nighttime noise. Staff were very helpful and accommodating, offering travel suggestions and discounts. We were able to check in to our room early, which was most welcome. The room was well sized, although the double bed was actually 2 beds pushed together. A large bathroom made it easy for 2. I liked the availability of slippers and dressing robes, too. There were lots of other thoughtful additions, such as the card that explained the lighting system. We didn't have breakfast there, as it seemed rather pricey, but we enjoyed the terrace bar. Overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: breedlove
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice hotel in a quiet but convenient area and that's exactly what we got. It is just steps from Placa De Catalunya and Las Ramblas. We didn't eat breakfast there but had read other reviews of a McDonald's and Starbucks being close by and utiltzed them. We were so thankful to be able to check in early after an exhausting flight but that won't always be possible. Staff were very courteous and spoke English well. Also, just across the square is the huge store that has anything you may need from clothes to food to wine. As our large suitcases didn't make it to airport with us we used the Aeorport bus with just our carry ons. It's about a block away. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttheusa
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for tapas bars, and las Ramblas. Located on a quiet side street just off Placa De Catalunya, adjoined to a small shopping centre. Very clean, and tastefully decorated rooms. Hotel staff all friendly and speak fluent English. Stayed here for 2 nights and saw much of Barcelona on foot, as it is a very central hotel. About 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas, 5 minutes walk to street of tapas bars, 20 minutes walk from Casa Batillo, and about 40 minutes walk to Sagrada Famillia. Fully disabled/wheelchair accessible hotel and room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in the Heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BuenaGirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is an absolutely wonderful hotel, located right in the heart of Barcelona. Reasonably priced…perfect location just steps from Las Ramblas…newly renovated and gorgeous rooms…warm and friendly staff…fabulous on-site restaurants and bars, including the beautiful rooftop bar. We had a group of 15 people booked at the Pulitzer, and all were extremely pleased! We highly recommend the hotel, and will definitely be using it again when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Barcelona for the price”
Reviews.Author: newgolfr
Reviews.Content: I had researched many of the 4 star hotels in Barcelona and am glad we chose the Pulitzer. It was a 5 minute walk across the plaza from the airport bus stop and knowing the Pultzer was next to it's sister hotel made it easy to find the first time. We enjoyed the bar/lobby at night where we had complimentary glass of wine the first night and sat in the rooftop lounge and listened to live jazz one night. Even though the hardwood floors are a little noisier than carpet, I like the clean feel of them. We slept great each night and had breakfast on the corner at Starbucks on the sidewalk terrace. The public transportation is very close as is the Cortes Ingles (department store where we ate at the top floor with a view of the Catalunya Plaza and bought wine and snacks. I am so happy I booked several months in advance and prepaid, because the price went up closer to our stay and they were sold out the day we arrived. You will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Comfortable, clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Medici58
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of Barcelona, you should consider staying here. The location of this hotel is great--very close to Placa Catalunya but NOT right on it where you'd hear all the street noise. The rooms are kept clean and the bathroom is bigger than a normal European hotel. All the major sites are so close, you can walk to most of it. We went to 3 very good restaurants and we walked to all 3 of them. If you want good shops, Passeig de Gracia is a few steps away from this hotel. We stayed in Barcelona for only 3 nights and to make the most of it, we got on the "Hop On, Hop Off" bus which has a stop right by Catalunya square. Julia Travel which can take you on a half day tour of Montserrat is also just around the corner. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to visit Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stylish Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Bromley
Reviews.Content: I had bookings in Barcelona but had to arrive a day early so needed a room for one night at short notice. The Pulitzer was recommended by someone on my flight and I called from the airport and was lucky enough to get fitted in. Set in a street adjoining Catalunya Square it is ideally placed being about as central as you can get in this vibrant city. I was given a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the street at the front of the hotel. I feared that this might make it noisy but the doors to the small balcony kept it quiet while the air-con kept me cool. A long thin room with modern boutique decor, very stylish in black and white, and a well appointed bathroom. I ate out in the evening - well you do in Barcelona - but the bar did get some of my time and proved to be a cllo and relaxing place to unwind before setting out for the evening. Breakfast was a good example of fresh contiental buffet style and provided a great start to the day. Its a fine hotel with a big reputation to live up to and it does this very well. I would certainly be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wins the Prize!”
Reviews.Author: tasteful_10
Reviews.Content: Smart design throughout compensates for "smallish" room. Proximity to Plaza y Catalunya,location for sightseeing busses, airport bus and other transit links, simplifies sightseeing. Staff was professional. Recommended a nearby tapas bar, Ciudad Central, which had an extensive array of dishes which drew us back for another meal! Have already recommended this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, could use better sound proofing!”
Reviews.Author: jewelz129
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed at the Pulitzer during our first trip to Barcelona for 5 nights. Overall the room was nice, clean, the bed was comfortable (on the firmer side which I prefer), and the shower was Great! Nothing like having a nice hot shower, with good pressure after a long day of walking and sightseeing. Biggest complaint would be lack of sound proofing. We could hear the clacking footsteps of people's shoes upstairs as well as hallway noise. However, the location of the hotel is fantastic. From the airport, hop on the Aerobus and walk a few minutes from Placa Catalunya over to the hotel! Very convenient to the metro, Las Ramblas, Barri Gotic, and all the shopping on Passeig de Gracia! Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, modern rooms. Stay here if planning a trip to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Hotel initally is a bit hard to find since the airport bus drops you off on the opposite side of the plaza Catalunya. Look out for the BBVA bank building with the big circular emblem on its roof and the hotel is in the side street on the left next to it within a minutes walk from the plaza. The hotel is very modern and the staff were excellent. They spoke understandable english and were extremely helpful. The rooms were modern with tasteful decor. The view from our room wasnt anything to shout about but we were there for the city not to look out of our window!! Drinks and food are expensive but we didnt eat here since there were plenty of good restaurants which were reasonably priced within 5 mins walk. Cocktails were expensive but my mojito was good!!! It is slightly expensive but for the location and the amenities it was worthwhile. If you are thinking of a trip to barcelona, i would consider this hotel as an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Baz118
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer offers a little oasis in the bustle of Barcelona. The great location is convenient for all the main attractions and 200 metres from the "Rambla". My theory that Boutique hotel means no kids held up. The rooms were small but well furnished, a desk would have been useful. Free Wifi worked well. The roof top bar was an excellent start to the evening with a round of complementary drinks. During the day the roof top bar is closed however we ordered tea and took to the roof in the early afternoon for a quiet book reading/ battery charge (fast a sleep after 5 mins). The breakfast was comprehensive with a good selection of hot and cold honest food. Self service coffee was a challenge to the special guests !! Parking was close by and the hotel had a discounted rate of euro 25 ,ask at the desk(normally 49). The black and white colour scheme worked well and gave the hotel a chic feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: We checked into The Pulitzer after returning to Barcelona from a Mediterranean cruise. The location is second to none and was a half block from a Starbucks and a half block from La Rambla. The staff greeted us upon arrival and although our rooms were not ready, took our bags and gave us two drink tickets to the rooftop bar. Our room was a good size and was located on the backside of the hotel. The room also included breakfast (and a good breakfast to boot!). Although I am sure there are plenty of good hotels in Barcelona; I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The central location makes this a good find”
Reviews.Author: love2trave09
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is on a small one-way street just off the Placa Catalunya. This quiet location is a good place to base yourself for a trip to Barcelona. If you like to walk, you can get almost anywhere a tourist wants to go in half an hour. If you prefer the clean, efficient, well-marked metro, many lines come through the Placa Catalunya. (There are two other four-star hotels on this block if you want to compare styes and prices, but you can't beat the location.) The Pulitzer style is modern, but not austere. The lobby is a good size with many places to sit, a nice bar, with a small restaurant in the rear. The staff was professional and helpful whenever we spoke to them. We arrived early, so our bags were stored. We tried the buffet breakfast, so we could do some planning and catch our breath before heading out for the day. The food was plentiful, with a nice selection of meats, cheeses, fruits, cereals, and hot dishes, but at 16 euro per person, we opted for other choices the rest of our stay. Our superior room was long and narrow. It had most of the right moving parts: a safe in a small cabinet, chair, couch, large closet, flat-screen TV, good-sized bathroom with robes, but no desk or work area, and wooden floors. The bed was not plush and very soft as in some American hotels; it was a bit on the hard side, which seems more typical here. When the closet and cabinet doors were open, it was a bit hard for two people to maneuver in those areas. (I admit that this is being picky, because you are not here to spend too much time in the room.) The small hallways can be a bit noisy when guests come and go, because the hard surfaces bounce all of the talking and door closings, so ask for a quiet room away from the elevator. The bathroom is typical European. The shower has a hand-held head that sits in an adjustable holder. The tub/shower combo has a half-wall of glass to deflect the spray from going all over the bathroom, but it is not enough. Try as you might, the floor and surrounding area will have a water on it when you are finished showering, so make sure the cover is down on the commode. The hotel did not provide conditioner, but there were "his,her, and both" boxes with interesting items inside, in addition to shampoo, body wash, bar soap and lotion. The hotel has a lovely roof-top bar (not a special view), which is a nice place to stop for a drink before heading out for the evening. Would we stay here again...definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: BButensky
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer Hotel is a small charming hotel with a well-appointed lobby, helpful staff, a lovely breakfast room, and a roof-top terrace bar. The rooms are small. but very clean and comfortable, some with wrought iron balconies. The location is excellent, there is an ATM steps away and the Ramblas, a main shopping promenade with many restaurants, hotels and shops is about two bocks away. The tourist double-decker bus stops on the corner and there is also a tourist office nearby. This is a very clean, comfortable wll located hotel. I can't wait to return to the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: thelma_or_louise_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently situated off Placa Catalunya, in a quiet street. The airport bus drop off is close by, as are the tourist bus stops if you want to use them, although there is plenty to do and see within walking distance. Friendly & helpful staff, great breakfast, and the roof top terrace is a lovely place to enjoy drinks after a days sight seeing. The room had a small balcony was a an added bonus. Would definitely stay here again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pulitzer - Chic Boutique Property in the Heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Rinat G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend in August 2011. We chose the Hotel Pulitzer because of the location - 20 steps from Placa Catalunya can't be beat! The hotel was easy to find, tucked around a corner on a main street. It was a self, well lit area and we never had to take a taxi anywhere as we walked all around the city. There is even a Starbucks (one of many) right down the street. The room was pretty spacious for a European hotel room, with a beautiful and large marble bathroom. There was a generous assortment of bathroom amenities, bathrobes and comfortable beds. No balcony unfortunately, but otherwise the room was well designed with hardwood floors and a nice flatscreen. The lobby is well decorated for a communal atmosphere, with great lounging furniture and books everywhere. But the real gem of the hotel is the rooftop bar. Very spacious, with Buddha Bar - esque music playing, artistic chairs and plants: this was the place to be before/during/after dinner. The drinks were good and its a nice view over the city. They also have great appetizers. Really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Pulitzer -

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda61
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in very central location. Rooms & bathrooms very large. Arrived in Barcelona 10.30am and was able to check into hotel straight away which was great. Given voucher for a free drink each on the rooftop terrrace.......waited 25 mins for drink... ended up leaving without it. Breakfast very good with plenty of choice. Nice coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel providing excellent service with a central location”
Reviews.Author: Cazza1900
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only 5 mins walk from Catalonya Square where the airport bus drops off. The staff speak excellent English We arrived and were checked in promptly. The room was well appointed. We enjoyed drinks on the rooftop terrace that evening. The bed was very comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. We'd stay here again when visiting Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sophia P
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel for a post cruise 3 night stay. It is a botique hotel for sure, and rooms are a bit small, but functional and typical for Europe. The hotel itself was really beautiful!! The roof top bar and lobby area was stunning. The location was also great - right off Les Rambla, so easy to walk to all the good sites.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: kirnat848
Reviews.Content: Check in was great, front desk was so nice. Our room was average size, we weren't expecting it to be huge but it was modern and clean. We had drinks on the roof top which was so nice to look down on everyone walking along the busy streets. Check out was smooth and they called us a cab and we were on our way. We would def. stay here again, great location and nice place.

Reviews.Title: “No security - watch your belongings”
Reviews.Author: hobokendippy
Reviews.Content: Had a laptop and iPads stolen during check-in at the Lobby! Had our bag down for less than a minute when someone came in and snagged our bag while we were talking to the check-in attendant at the lobby. Apparently they reviewed the tape and said "well yes sir the bag was stolen -- sorry". Management washed their hands of it saying "hey its Barcelona you have to watch your things". I had heard about pickpocketing issues but stealing bags from hotel lobbies is different. Management was not even surprised and didn't even seem apologetic. The way that they handled the situation was utterly disrespectful and showed no accountability. Safe to say will never go back and cannot recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel very close to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: m4rcla
Reviews.Content: We really liked the modern style of Hotel Pulitzer. The lobby area was beautiful with stylish furnishing. The rooms were a bit small (understandable since we were in Europe), but the bathroom was pretty good sized. The elevator was really unique which we had not seen before; it was an all glass elevator. The lobby area was very well maintained and looked pretty new. However, some parts of the hotel were a little tired (chipped wood on room floors, hallways could use some fresh carpet). But overall we thought the hotel was still in pretty good condition. Not sure if they have a king/queen bed, but we booked 4 different rooms and all rooms had 2 twin beds pushed together. The location was wonderful! Very close to Las Ramblas and Playa Catalunya. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs more air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkAnn
Reviews.Content: I found this property because it was recommended by Mr. and Mrs. Smith. I was disappointed to find that the pool and the gym were located three blocks away, not on the hotel property at all. The rooftop terrace was nice but not spectacular, as the views were uninspiring. The breakfast room was cheery and pleasant, and the breakfast itself was good. The bar staff were helpful, as were the reception staff, but the fact is that the hotel didn't have enough air conditioning for a summer visit to Barcelona. We changed rooms because our room was too hot for sleeping, only to find that all the rooms were set to go no lower than 24 degrees C (75 degrees F). That may sound cool enough, but we were soaking wet in our bed and unable to sleep properly, so I don't think it was actually that cool.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for a hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jaybird l
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with Hotel Pulitzer in Barcelona. Excellent location near the la Rambla...quiet street...wonderful buffet breakfast...avante garde style room...ask for room 504..quiet street...terrace on the top floor with live music. Very service oriented hotel. Lobby is wonderful for relaxing after a busy day. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksum87
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location in the hub of Barcelona, without the noise! Everything was within easy walking distance and the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Our room was clean and well appointed (enormous bed) with great toiletries and lovely towels. The staff made some excellent recommendations for eating ( La Cuidad Contal for tapas) (9euro delicious rose!!!) The rooftop bar was great but avoid the breakfast (quite expensive and there is a starbucks at the end of the road for quick breakfasts) or go for brunch at Picnic in the Born district which is the same price!! Overall I couldnt recommend this hotel more to couples or a group of friends- great atmosphere and perfect location. LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PC_expat_in_AMS
Reviews.Content: Great place to use a base to explore the city. The hotel has nice rooms, very well situated to explore the city by walking or metro and has a very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled!”
Reviews.Author: Oakville548
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an ideal location on a quiet street just off Placa Catalunya and close enough to Las Ramblas without having the night noise. This is a modern, elegant hotel perfect for design enthusiasts. Staff were all very accommodating and friendly. The lobby bar is a great spot to have drinks before heading out for dinner. Rooms are clean and well appointed. I would definitely recommend to others and return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: adrandlkj
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet street just a few yards off Placa Catalunya, Las Ramblas, El Corte Engles shopping center and the tour bus terminal. We loved the convenience of being in the center of everything. The room was a bit small but adequate, with a sitting area and king size bed. The bathroom was clean and housekeeping was responsive when we requested for more towels and supplies. One problem was the bad internet connection. Another disappointment was when they forgot their promise to do something special for my husband's birthday. A greeting card would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: karenkane_11
Reviews.Content: First night the air conditioning broke and the rooms of the first second and third floor had no air. We had to demand to be moved and got moved to top floor for the night but then had to move back to our old stuffy room the next morning. The rooms were not very clean, and on the last night I came into the room and found a cockroach. The staff we're nice about it, but offered us a discount of 30 Euros for the roach.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location”
Reviews.Author: nurseToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights pre-cruise and were very happy with everything.Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Staff was very friendly and polite.You can use the internet in the sister hotel Regina next door which has a business centre.Location could not be better. Just take the Aerobus from the airport to Placa Catalunya.Look up and see a building with a clock on top,cross the square and voila,there it is.Granted the hotel does not have a big sign,so if you reach Hotel Regina you've gone too far.You can take the double decker tourist bus from the Placa,actually there is 2 choices.We took the red one,did both loops and saw the whole Barcelona. What we did not see was any kind of pickpocket activity,gipsy gangs etc. Of course you cannot be reckless with your belongings but normal everyday precautions should be enough (extra money and passports in the hotel safe!) I would recommend the Pulitzer and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: GEORGIOS A
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 4 days at this hotel..the location is excellent..only a few steps from Playa de Catalunya, the metro station, the bus touristik stations,the local buses stations and the airport buses station and 2mins from la ramblas.The rooms were very clean but too small without any balcony...the service was very good...the breakfast nothing special(average)..it has no parking..

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for three days. The room is not comfortable - no rug, barely furnished - but the location is excellent and the value is good. Common areas are nice although rugs in the hallways are stained.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: cheddyanne
Reviews.Content: Loved the Pulitzer. The hotel is charming, timber floors, high ceilings, white walls, courtyard on the ground floor and on the rooftop. The rooms were lovely and very clean. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the location is excellent, steps away from the Plaza Cataylana and the la Rambles. Get the shuttle bus to and from the airport from the Plaza Cataylana for 5.3euro per person each way, they run every few minutes. The hop on hop off bus also runs from the Plaza. We loved the rooftop bar at night, comfy lounges and plenty of room in the lush garden atmosphere. The hotel next door is a sister hotel with free internet usage. I would say that the Pulitzer has one of the best breakfasts I have ever had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimpep
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location & easly accessible , 50m from starbucks but small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very central location near las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: JimMcC999
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel close to the central square "Place Catalunya". Bus from the airport leaves you 200 metres away from the hotel. The hotel has little signage and can be easily missed as it is quite discrete. Excellent experience save for visiting the roof top bar which was very expensive with little atmosphere. Reception staff were very helpful and deserve to be congratulated - a 100% performance. Many great restaurants and amenities within walking distance. We will be back if visiting Barcelona as the experience was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: helenemeyer
Reviews.Content: Great location.Close enough to La Ramblas,but not in middle of it's chaos. @ min walk from Playa Catalunya.5 MMin walk from aerobus to and from airport. 2 min walk from red hop on and off bus. Clean rooms,modern bathrooms.Helpful front desk staff who speak english and make great recommendations for entertainment,sight seeing and restaurants. Would definately return to same hotel when in Barcelona again. HSM

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: KLA06
Reviews.Content: Great service from the moment we arrived from friendly, helpful staff. Beautifully presented from the flowers and art in the lobby to the candle lit roof terrace. Clean good sized bedroom, bathroom with his / hers amenities (toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, foot rub, razor, slippers) GREAT central location, Starbucks on corner, metro just metres away, easy to get to from airport via train & metro connection. A little noisy at night if you are a light sleeper due to the open plan bar area. Breakfast reasonable, good selection but a little expensive. Would definitely recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: peppie16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pulitzer for 5 nights in August. Having previously stayed at the Atrium Palace, we were pleasantly surprised with the Pulitzer. Nicely decorated, smart, modern rooms. Free wi-fi was a bonus. Perfect location next to Catalunya metro. Also thank you to Marcos at reception who was extremely helpful in choosing our room. We will definitely return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all-around”
Reviews.Author: amazingtrace
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of June, very clean, comfortable, modern hotel. Absolutely loved the location. Central to all the action, but without the noise. It's located about 1/2 block off of La Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. Staff, especially the concierge, were wonderful. They gave really great tips for getting around. Before we arrived, we sent some questions via e-mail, and they were extremely responsive. Had a good impression of the staff before we even came. Although, we did have a minor issue when we checked in. I had requested and was promised a street-view room. When we came up to the room, we realized it was facing the little atrium/terrace where breakfast was served. We called downstairs, and they rectified the problem immediately and we were moved to a street-view room. Rooms were well-appointed. Nice flatscreen, great amenities, and best part was the clean well-stocked bathrooms. Wi-fi worked perfectly as well. We absolutely loved the variety of food served at breakfast, which was included in our rate. If you book well in advance, they have a 15% discounted, nonrefundable rate that includes breakfast. Breakfast was served til 11am on weekdays, and til noon on weekends and holidays. That was a real bonus since we slept in every morning! The room rate also includes use of a *world-class* gym, we're told, but we didn't get a chance to check out the gym. We got our workout just walking all about town. All in all, great experience for us, we loved coming back to such a relaxing and comfortable environment each night. Would definitely stay here again next time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Shanana
Reviews.Content: Such a great location, nice rooms, fantastic bathroom, very clean. We enjoyed our 5 day stay so much! Everything was perfect except we found the drink prices to be very high in the bar, no need for it, all it does is make you go elsewhere, and there are many great restaurants and bars close by so no big deal. The rooftop garden is one of the best I have seen, but again, the drinks, yikes! Would recommend this great hotel to anyone, we would definitely stay here again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location, excelent room.”
Reviews.Author: dr.Franca
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife from 1st to 5th january 2011, we got the superior room. Very nice room, with a balcony facong the street but no noise from it. Very confortable. The lobby its cosy. Didnt have breakfast at the hotel, but we had a glimpse of it and seems good. This hotel Its just a few steps from plaza Catalunia, from wich we could go anywhere by subway. Threee minutes from the Ramblas, walking distance. Polite staff. We had a few things from the bar at the lobby, a little expensive but good.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: maryogdublin
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel great location right in the centre of everything but on a quiet street. Very friendly staff. Breakfast was great and plenty of choice. Rooftop Bar well worth a visit, excellent cocktails. Good size room with dressing gowns slippers and plenty of toiletries in bathroom. Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ubish
Reviews.Content: As mentioned numerous times the Hotel Pulitzer is in a great location. Easy access/walking distance to many attractions, metro and Aerobus Travelled solo and felt very safe walking to and from the hotel at night. Reception personnel were extremely curteous and friendly while providing detailed information or directions. All questions were treated with equal weight regardless of their nature. The lobby, bar and library were welcoming spaces to sit back and relax in. I liked the contract of the crisp white furniture and dark wood. The room was well apointed except for the LCD screen mounted on the wall oppsoite to the head of the bed. It was in a place that made it hard to walk around the bed. The bed was also way too hard. I like a firm bed but this was taking firm to a whole new level. After a day of extensicve walking about something a little more supportive would have been much better. Another item of note is that noise can be heard fairly easily through the door. I heard room doors open and shut around me. I was on the 3rd floor and noise from the bar carried up but not enough to bother me. I enjoyed having a bathrobe and slippers provided. A nice touch. The room itself was not large but had more than enough space for one person. The bathroom however was quite spacious which I enjoyed. Loved the large bathroom sink and mirror. Had room service on a couple of occasions and the food was very good. The breakfast buffet was olso good, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again as long some kind of additional padding could be provided for the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms, lacks polish, good location”
Reviews.Author: LocationIntelligent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Right around the corner from Plaza de Cataluna at the top of Las Ramblas. The airport bus drops you off in the plaza which is good if you are solo or dont have too much luggage. Unfortunatley our stay was unpleasant due to all the noise from neighbors and cleaning staff. The doors slam loudly and there is no sound insulation. Everything is hardwood floors with no rugs which adds to the echo effect. The design i also felt was lacking. The tiny lcd tv sticks out of the wall exactly where there is no room to walk in front of the bed as the room is narrow and deep. Also in the bathroom the shower tiles were lacking a finish or rounded trim piece around the edge. The show is also half open which is not very romantic. Someone is always out in the breeze! The room did have balcony doors that opened up which was a nice touch for some fresh air. Overall the place has potential. I do recommend the buffet breakfast rate. The have a nice dining area and fresh light breakfast to start the day. The hotel serves breakfast until 11 or 12 depending on the day, which is great if you like sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff, location: A++”
Reviews.Author: rachelersr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitzer is a class act -- modern, crisp rooms that are a nice size for a big city (great linens, mattress, toiletries). Their breakfast, which was included in the rate, was delicious and in a pretty atrium setting in the back of the hotel.Walking distance to Las Ramblas, but it's on a quiet side street with plenty of restaurant options nearby. Bus from airport leaves you a block away. The staff could not be nicer -- they really go out of their way to be helpful . . . even after I left: I had forgotton the name of a leather goods store a few blocks away and wanted to order a pocketbook after I returned to the U.S, so I called the hotel, and explained where I thought the store was located and their manager e-mailed me a week later with the name/ address.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, attentive staff, free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Ironleader
Reviews.Content: We (two rooms) stayed two days at the end of our cruise. The hotel is very well kept, clean/ clean/clean. Breakfast, included with our room, Was excellent from fresh squeezed orange juice to eggs and the classic salami's and cheeses of the area, delicious. The front desk staff was right on with wonderful recommendations. We used the the gym, which is three blocks away, twice. Very well equipped and clean and the front office staff there was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, recommend it for a great trip....”
