Reviews.Author: Rucky21
Reviews.Content: This hotel from the beginning of seraching for hotels was the perfect one, especially when you have 15% off the accommodation when booking early. The staff service was extremely professional with all staff speaking more than one language, our welcome was great with local information explained at check-i8n with information on attractions etc. Our room was very spacious with a King bed with double doors which open for a view of the Barcelona streets, nice to relax at the end of an evening with a bottle of Cava. Room was clean on arrival and kept to it's four star standard througout our stay. Defiantley reccommend the roof top terrace bar for great cocktails and live music during the week, this hotel is great for relaxing but also with it's amazing location right in the epicentre of Barcelona only 50 yards from the main square at the top of the La Rambla. GREAT STAY, COMFORTABLE AND WILL BE RETURNING.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: giget1963
Reviews.Content: My 18 yr old daughter and I (mom) stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Absolutely loved it! It was incredibly clean, room was comfortable, the staff was helpful and polite, staff restaurant suggestions were excellent, breakfast was great, location was wonderful -- steps to the Plaza Catalunia but away from the hustle and bustle of the plaza. Convenient to subway, las ramblas, old towne. My daughter is fussy fussy and she loved this hotel. Internet access worked fine in room. Used sister hotel Regina next door for the business office with printers, etc.. I would definitely stay here again! I give this hotel a 4 out of 4 stars. Thank you Hotel Pulitzer for making our stay wonderful in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: smg_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to leaving on our cruise. It is located just off Las Ramblas - easy walking to everywhere. The staff was wonderfully accommodating - fabulous roof top outdoor bar. The rooms were a bit small but clean --- and we stayed in them for a short amount of time as we wanted to see and experience as much of Barcelona as possible prior to our cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great place!”
Reviews.Author: leskanabelka
Reviews.Content: We had excellent room with king size bed with windows on the next street, so hadn't any outside noise from the street. But walls and doors passed noise and sometimes at night I woke up from sound of the caused lift and walking of neighbors. Great location - close to Placa de Catalunya (aerobus from airport, turistic buses), close to supermarket El Corte Ingles and metro. The staff of the hotel were polite and helpful. In days of our arrival the terrace has been always full of people (Sonar festival) - we have spent there only one evening and tried only 2 cocktails. The breakfast was tasty, but monotonous, for 7 days nothing new hasn't increased and hasn't changed. I'd recommend this hotel to other travelers

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, Very Clean, Very Central and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LunikAudion
Reviews.Content: I've seen that some people have had reason to complain about the decor of their room, but our room was fine. Sure, there wasn't much gap between the wall and the bed, but it's a central city hotel and it was a standard room (you can opt for a larger room at a higher rate). The bed itself was extremely comfortable, and I should know as, unfortunately, I was ill with tonsillitis in that bed for most of the holiday. The shower was fantastic, and so too was the free wifi. We found the staff very friendly, and the hotel was very clean. It was so central - supermarket across the road and lots and lots of great restaurants and shops just a few minutes walk away. Also the rooftop bar is really cool, and the strawberry mojitos are lush.

Reviews.Title: “central, groovy and well priced in beautiful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: junde01
Reviews.Content: Lovely fourth floor room, the staff warned me about the fifth floor electronic music show (week long "Sonar" festival in the city in June) finishing at 11pm when I arrived, lovely ground floor bar and tapas area, groovy loft-style feel in the room with large art works on the wall, well appointed bathroom with bath, unfortunately Penelope Cruz was not anywhere to be found!! definitely would return

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, trendy but not snooty, superb staff, quiet!”
Reviews.Author: olliedawg
Reviews.Content: Right off the Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas, close to (my favorite store) the gigantic El Corte Ingles, perched next to a major metro station, walking distance to just about all the sites...and the rooms, while small, are absolutely lovely, spotless, and quiet (we faced the street and heard very little outside noise). It was also a great value in June -- E120/night. We'd go back to this hotel (and Barcelona) in a heartbeat. PS The restaurant serves a wonderful, fairly inexpensive mid-day meal.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and needs some tlc”
Reviews.Author: mizmissfun
Reviews.Content: We expected more out of this hotel. The first two rooms were unacceptable and tired. Issues were scuffed walls, Separated floor boards, shower caulking needed. After addressing these issues with management they then upgraded us to their best class of room which was better then the first two. This boutique, designer hotel needs paint, deep cleaning and a new eye. For over $300 dollars a night any guest should have high standards that are met. I wouldn't recommend it for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: johnb2123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place, fantastic location, comfortablr rooms with great beds. We are just back form an extended weekend break, booked to celebrate my better half's Birthday. We booked the celebration break as an addition extra, and was it worth it! The room door decorated with a huge red ribbon, rose petals on the bed, and in the bath, candles lit, superb for a special occassion I also asked the Hotel if it was possible to bake a "gluten free" Birthday cake, and to supply flowers and chocolates on the day, again, superb service, so good my partner was reduced to tears with everything that had been done for Her. Really, what more can I say? Wonderful Hotel, The best Staff of any Hotel we have stayed in (including many 5* establishments), terrific breakfast. To Andrea, and the rest of the team who helped to make this (in Her own words) my partners "best weekend of my life"! A huge thank you, and we hope to see you all soon. We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Attentive, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonytuna
Reviews.Content: Excellent level of service for a four star hotel. The front desk staff was plentiful and eager to answer questions. The room was stylishly decorated and included a small balcony. The staff brought a nice bottle of cava to our room upon checking in. Excellent location: half a block from Plaza Cataluyna, one block to the Ramblas, and three blocks to Casa Batllo. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcieKathyRyan
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility with great ambiance. Rooms are on the smallish side, but comparable to other 4 star European hotels. Initmate setting, great breakfast, staff exceptionally friendly and helpful with great suggestions on sightseeing, restaurants, shopping, etc. Great location a mere 500 ft to Plaza Catalunia and entering the famous Las Ramblas. Banks, currency stores, cafes, taxis, shops, metro stops and city tour buses all within feet from the Hotel Pulitzer. Would have no reservations returning to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this hotel ; )”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs97
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute before leaving for Barcelona for one night, before we were to leave on a Mediterranean Cruise. We wanted to stay somewhere close to Las Ramblas so we could walk around and just do some sightseeing on our own. We were very happy with this hotel. Upon check in our room was ready. It was small, as most standard European rooms are. However, the bathroom was spacious and the bed was a king, we also had a small veranda to step out on. The room is modern and very clean, as was the bathroom. There was plenty of storage space and a desk with a safe. The bed was pretty hard though, we both woke up with a sore back and we sleep on a firm bed at home. My only small complaint is there wasn't an iron and ironing board in the room. I called for one and all the irons/boards were in use in other rooms. I personally think irons are necessary in rooms, as everyone there has brought there clothes folded up in a suitecase and most likely needs to iron them. However, when one returned, they called us right away and brought it to our room, along with a US plug adaptor so I could charge our cell phone. We had drinks at both the lobby bar and the rooftop bar. Service and drinks were both good. There was live music on the rooftop the night we were there which we enjoyed. Check out time was busy but was efficient and the front desk had a taxi for us in under 10 minutes. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel, the service and location. We paid $230 USD to stay here, which I do feel is a little steep for what we got. In my opinion a standard room here isn't worth over $180 USD/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ResandeMac
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms and good service. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “a real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mememememe317068
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner had spent a fortnight in France camping and we had decided to book this hotel has a treat, prior to returning to the UK. We had looked at the reviews and it seemed great, so we booked one night ,costing over 300 euros, and we were expecting some serious luxury. Anyway, we checked in, straight away it didn't seem that professional, the staff seemed extremely busy 'doing things' behind the reception and we were kind of in the way a bit, the decor seemed pretty worn and tired too. Then we went to go to the room and the staff asked if we would like a hand with the bags (we had 4 monster size backpacks) and my partner agreed, she is only 5ft and about the same size as the bags. The guy behind the reception put the pack on my partners back and handed her the other one!! Unbelievable, i thought he was actually offering to carry it to the room. The room itself, was pretty small and narrow and it had 2 single beds, we had booked a double. The room had no movies or movie channels, so in the end we did not really hang around much. The restaurant was also booked as well, so we had to find somewhere else. On the up-side, the room was very clean and the location is spot on, however i do feel like it was completley over-rated and over-priced, we wished we had stayed in the tent!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BKS27
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Hotel Pulitzer. Having never been to Barcelona, I thought it was great to be so close to Placa Catalunya as it made getting around the city very easy and we felt very close to the heart of the city. The rooms were simple, modern and very comfortable. The staff at the hotel was very helpful, generous and accomodating. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but bar staff need training”
Reviews.Author: montyMidlands
Reviews.Content: Just need to advise the bar and waiting staff that the customer needs to be acknowleged and chats between themselves can wait.. Happened too often to be a one off.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DRinlondon
Reviews.Content: Walking through the doors of the Hotel Pulitzer, you immediately enter a very stylish space that sets the mood for a great stay. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful and checking in was a breeze - I even received a lovely notebook / guide on arrival and when I had forgotten my adaptor, there were plenty available to borrow from the front desk. The rooms are very nicely decorated in clean, modern lines and beds were comfortable. WiFi is also available in the rooms and there were thoughtful touches, such as 'his' and 'hers' toiletries. Continental breakfast options were good with a nice variety of breads, cheese, yoghurts and pastries. It could be improved if eggs were made to order rather than left to go cold on the buffet table, but this was not a problem with the other choices available. The hotel is in an absolutely ideal location, very close to Plaza Catalunya (less than a minute's walk), Las Ramblas, several Metro stops, easy access to taxis and plenty of great shops! I booked online through the hotel's website and got a great deal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel with great service and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MartinFraDK
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay for 4 days in a superior room on the fourth floor. The staff was very helpful and they had a great bar that can provide fancy cocktails as well as light meals of a good standard. The interior was just as we like it - modern and cozy. They also have a GREAT roof terasse - unfortunately it was closed the week we were there. The location is 100 out of a 100. It simply can't better, on a quiet street 50m from Plaza Cataluna.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jgilles51
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be very clean, quiet and the bed was wonderful. Both my wife and I have had back issues so a good bed is a must and this was good. Getting to the hotel I debated about a cab from the airport since we had been traveling many hours. Leaving baggage return you'll immediately see the airport bus for downtown. They leave every 5 minutes so no waiting,cost about 2 euro, 3 stops with the last being Cataluna square. Get off the bus and right at the bus stop is a crosswalk to the square. Take that directly across the square to a crosswalk on the other side. After crossing you will be looking down a side street and Pulitzer is less than a hundred yards down this street on the left. The hotel bar was very nice, reception very helpful, someone could always speak English, and location is close to quite a bit and very close to the Metro

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, refreshing decor, and comfortable rooms ... Epitome of modern style”
Reviews.Author: Dante_the_Florentine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay a week in the Pulitzer at the end of our 2 week Spanish Tour, and loved the style and comfort of this modern Hotel. This is how you should stay while in Barcelona! As a boutique hotel, the hotel staff are extremely well trained, courteous and prompt in check-in...very knowledgeable and provide great recommendations. We even received an artistic Pulitzer 'journal' for our stay, which provided tips and suggestions for exploring the city - most of which was in the tour books - but was a nice touch anyway. The hotels location is perfect next to Pl. Catalunya and great for making as your base for branching out and seeing all the fantastic sights that Barcelona has to reveal. Even though it close to the vibrant bustle of the city center, there was zero effect once inside this sanctuary. The room was very comfortable and spacious, and we had the perfect quiet nights sleep after spending +16 hours of walking and sightseeing. The hotel also has a lovely quiet roof top deck bar, which we took full advantage of for afternoon aperitifs to recharge before long leisurely evenings in El Bjorn. The only minimal drawback to the stay was the price, but we feel that we got exactly what we paid for (and more).... and why not while in Barcelona! With all the positive things we have to say about this fabulous hotel, my wife and I are definitely looking forward to using the other Pulitzer hotel locations in Rome & Paris during our next European vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in an incredible city”
Reviews.Author: mmsull2
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Tripadvisor and were so glad we did! Although we were only in Barcelona for a few short days, this hotel made our stay absolutely perfect. Yes, the rooms are small, but the service and location more than make up for it. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. I, unfortunately, got food poisoning on our last day of our trip, and it turns out that chicken soup, the only thing I could stomach, is hard to find in the city when you don't speak the language. The helpful staff assisted my husband in finding it and heating it up for me - so appreciated! The location is perfect - right in the middle of it all and so convenient for sightseeing. My only suggestion is to ask for extra pillows - the ones on the bed are a bit flat. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone - and will stay here again when I am fortunate enough to return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location”
Reviews.Author: stagman86
Reviews.Content: We booked to go to Barcelona only a few weeks ago so most of the bargains were gone. Having said that it was a great hotel, helpful English speaking staff, clean comfortable rooms with a lovely bathroom. Situated next to Placa de Catalunya its got Metro stations and Bus stops for getting about, bars and restaurants nearby and its on La Ramblas which means there is always lots happening. Most importantly it has very thick double glazing and black out blinds which means you sleep wonderfully!

Reviews.Title: “They did it again”
Reviews.Author: travel_i_adore
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at The Hotel Pulitzer in Barcelona (the first time was in Feb 2009). Needless to say, we were as pleased with our second stay as we were on our first, 2 years ago. The hotel is very modern and chic, the rooms have all the amenities a traveler require for a relaxing holiday or a business trip. Plus points for free wifi service and excellent breakfast selection! It's very, very central - located on a tiny street off Placa Catalunya and a skip, hop and jump away to Las Ramblas and all the shopping and restaurants. The staff seem nice and attentive especially Natalia who assisted us on check-in and offered "solution" to our issue regarding the room (we wanted a room with a view and were upgraded to a deluxe room). The restaurant staff during breakfast were as great. We intend to make Hotel Pulitzer Barcelona our home should our travels take us to Barcelona again. Kudos to the new manager (Merixtell) for running a great property!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickeyT78
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our son who is spending a semester in Barcelona. He helped pick out this hotel and actually couldn't believe such a nice hotel in a perfect location was so reasonable. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW- GREAT MODERN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mercurymarc
Reviews.Content: WOW- this was our favorite hotel in Spain- close to the main drag and very clean/modern inside. Just a few steps from the subway and many stores. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected”
Reviews.Author: MarcusNYC
Reviews.Content: Recommended by Lufthansa homepage due its perfect location, we booked a city vacation for 3 nights in Barcelona at the Pulitzer Hotel. A month before we asked for (really) separated beds (via email and via phone), which was confirmed via phone by the hotel. When arrived we had a double bed (space less than 5cm) and after asked for a change the offer was to take a different hotel. The room was quite dark and quite small and quit noisy. Otherwise acceptable, especially a nice desk combination (with a safe) and a clean marble bathroom. Since we were on the 1 floor with windows to the inner courtyard we had a good view to the hotel restaurant and therefore had to keep the curtains closed! Positive to point out is the free and almost fast wireless LAN. Staff at reception, besides the crew from the first day, was friendly and spoke English. Very nice was the bar & lounge area. Reception was dark. Breakfast was ok (lower end of standard for a 4 Star Hotel), concerning the coffee you have to wait for hotel staff and they sometimes disappeared for more than a few minutes! Mostly you had the feeling you disturb them and better not order anything because they had to do more important work than serving YOU. Otherwise the breakfast area was bright and with a nice atmosphere. In summary: to low for a 4star Hotel and for 170€ (including breakfast and taxes) per night.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not special”
Reviews.Author: buttons74
Reviews.Content: I've regularly used Tripadvisor for 5 years now and unfortunately this is my first negative post. I emailed the hotel several weeks in advance asking for a room with a view for our belated honeymoon. I appreciate this is not always possible but we were giving them 5 nights of business and the hotel did not appear too busy. Anyway, with the view we were given I almost feel as though we were punished for asking! (see attached photos). The finishings in the room were very poor, again see pics. The noise from neighbouring doors banging and cleaners sounded like they were going to break through the room walls. I also agree with the previous post, some of the bar staff could be more attentive and friendly towards guests, not always the kind of service I'd expect from a 4 star hotel. No tea/coffee making facilities, complimentary water, no bar in our room either. I'll try to be fair so on a positive we were given a bottle of complimentary cava, the furnishings & bar area were nice and the location central, but overall I would not recommend this hotel for a special occasion, lots of little things let it down, so overall I'd say I left it feeling underwhelmed and disappointed. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all this hotel has going for it...”
Reviews.Author: NChant
Reviews.Content: Arrived last Friday at 12pm with my boyfriend and was relieved to be able to check in early however we were told there were no double rooms available?! Trying to get over the fact we were going to sleep in single beds for the weekend we then contended with a room so narrow it felt like we were sleeping in a corridor!. There were no tea and coffee facilities in the room so we ordered room service which took ages and then they had to come back again with milk and sugar. The amenities and towels were not re-stocked on the second day which was annoying as damp towels are never a good option!. On the first night we attempted to have drinks in the bar but were served by the rudest bar man I have ever come across - serious attitude problem! The saving grace of this hotel is the location, it is a great place to explore Barcelona from with everything on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “TICKED EVERY BOX for fussy, seasoned travellers”
Reviews.Author: Vix002
Reviews.Content: Having visited Barcelona before and aware that a lot of hotels close to La Ramblas, and particularly around the Gothic quarter, could be very noisy throughout the night, we wanted a hotel that was located conveniently, of a high standard, not massively expensive and QUIET at bedtime. This hotel ticked all our boxes; it is perfectly located off Placa de la Catalunya in an elegant, central street; it is stylishly contemporary, understated, elegant monochromatic ivories and black, with a Asian influences. Reception staff were polite, welcoming and helpful, providing us with maps and fliers on things to see /do. The trip was to celebrate our recent engagement and I had mentioned this when I emailed to reserve a room because I wanted to ensure we were given a double bed, not twin beds, and a quiet room. We were initially anxious about the size of our room as it appeared to be at the end of a corridor with a lot of other doors very close together. We were delighted however to discover that the room within was very spacious, tastefully but simply decorated with dark wood floor and doors, soft lighting, white walls with abstract art, and, Asian-themed room accessories. Both pillows, and double bed - emporer-sized - were extremely comfortable with crisp, white cotton linens (felt Egyptian). The bathroom was large, with contemporary fittings and most importantly, masses of endless hot water. As always, it would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilties, or at least a kettle, but room service was efficient and prompt. The mini-bar was well stocked, and we were proviided with chocolates on arrival and departure, as well as a complimentary bottle of Cava (presumably to celebrate our engagement). Breakfast was simple Continental fare but met our requirements; we're not talking "Full English Breakfast" but what was available was fresh and there was lots of it. Word of caution to tea-guzzelling, UK travellers - ask for 'leche fredo' with 'English Breakfast tea'. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening but sampled the bar menu during the day, which was excellent; my fiance had delicious tapas, and I had a foccacia tuna sandwich -ununsual but extremely tasty. We stayed for 3 nights/4 days and had a wonderful time; we were extremely well rested each night in preparation for lots of walking each day, and the hotel in our view was absolutely perfect for the occasion - I'm a bit 'high maintenance' if I'm honest and demand high standards when I travel, but would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Form follows function”
Reviews.Author: enlightenedtraveler1
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly helpful staff. Poor reading lights, a wacky room light system,narrow room. Excellent complimentary health club nearby, star bucks on one corner and a FNAC on the other for morning coffee, tea and croissants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RachaelBee
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel located close to the Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla, it's a brilliant hub for exploring Barcelona and we found that we were able to walk to all the places of interest. It's about a 10 minute walk from Passeig De Gracia station which has trains running to and from the airport so we were able to avoid paying the extortionate taxi fares in Barcelona. The fact that it was in such a busy spot was a bit of a concern as we didn't want too much noise in the room but our worries were unfounded as it was very quiet. The hotel as a whole is very nicely decorated, clean and well laid out. There is a bar downstairs and lots of comfy seating, and a roof terrace with another bar, tables and plenty of chairs and sofas. Unfortunately my partner was taken ill on our way from the airport and when we got to the hotel he fell asleep due to the effects of his medication but I was able to make myself at home on the roof and avoided disturbing him. The room itself was fairly large and the queen sized bed was perfect in my opinion! The bathroom looked amazing and everything was clean. Toiletries were supplied and replaced on a daily basis by the housekeepers, there were also 'man' and 'woman' kits containing essentials such as toothbrushes, razors, combs etc. The room was air conditioned and also had a balconette which was good because it was hot while we were there, especially for a February. The food at the hotel is delicious, I ordered room service a couple of times and on our last morning we ordered breakfast in bed. Admittedly the food isn't cheap but it's worth it, it's clearly fresh food, not reheated and not out of a packet. It was brought up to the room quickly and was nice and hot! Finally I would like to say that the staff were excellent! There was a 24hr reception desk which was essential for us as my partner was there to play a gig and the Spanish don't believe in early nights! The staff spoke English and seemed to genuinely care that you had a pleasant stay. Javier in particular seemed as though he couldn't do enough to help and was friendly, also Marcos made checking in and out easy and clear. All in all I would say this hotel is great value for money and it's a shame there aren't more out there like it.

Reviews.Title: “Stressful experience”
Reviews.Author: Yihahn
Reviews.Content: We hired a car from Milan and drove all the way down to Barcelona. There wasn't any parking within the hotel. We were advised to park at an underground parking garage opp. the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at about 7pm. As there was no door man at the entrance of the hotel, I decided to get help from the bell boy to help us with our luggage while my hubby waited in the car. I was greeted by a really friendly "tourist" (he had a map in one hand and a camera in the other) at the entrance of the hotel. He greeted me with a megawatt smile and held the door for me. while waiting at the check-in counter, I was observing the people around the lobby. I was kinda paranoid because prior to my arrival I have heard lots of horror stories of how Asian tourists were robbed and stuff. I saw the guy who opened the door for me loitering around the hotel lobby with another tourist like guy. They looked kinda sneaky and my gut feel told me that they were up to no good. Every now and then I would look out of the glass door to ensure that my hubby was still around. However moments later, when I looked out, I saw 4 men standing around our car and trying to open the doors. I hurried to front desk and seek help from the hotel staff. One of them was nice enough to follow me out. When the four of them saw us coming out, they made a dash across the road. My hubby told me that someone came up and told him that the stretch of road outside the hotel was meant for locals and when he drove up to the front, the guy told him that there is something under his car and if he moves his car further he will crush it. My hubby then got out of his car to see and the moment he opened his door, 3 other men came up and opened all other doors hoping to snatch something at the front or back seat. One of then men was the one who held the door for me. They were so swift and agile that my hubby did not realize their existence until i told him what I saw. It was really freaky. After the bell boy helped me off-load the luggage from the car, my hubby drove down to the underground garage. The men were there waiting for him. Somehow he managed to escape through one of the exits. It was rather stressful that night. We were also worried about whether our tires would be punctured on our way out of Barcelona as we read about how they would attack foreign cars. The petty thieves are all dressed like tourists with maps and cameras in their hands so do not be deceived by their outlook. The location of the hotel was excellent. Size of the room was good. Breakfast was mediocre. We checked out at 8am in the morning and was relieved that nothing bad happened.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sup3rgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in Placa Catalunya, both for walking around and for taking the metro. we arrived in the evening, but there was no problem at check-in, they even gave us a full map of Barcelona which proved to be very useful - there is a tourist infor spot and bureau right in Placa Catalunya. The room was very nice, although small, with nice wooden floors and furniture. The only complaint is that from time to time the room seemed full of dust, which was very visible in the artificial light. Other than that, everything was great, the entire hotel was vrey clean and comfortable, including the lounge bar. We didn't have breakfast included so we chose to eat at the cafes on La Rambla, but for more consistent meals we went to Port Vell, the Barceloneta area which is full of excellent seafood restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel which made our stay in Barcelona very enjoyable. It was a great value for money for its amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, stylish hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anush
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Pulitzer for my 30th birthday and we had a lovely time. Location is perfect we found it easy to locate the hotel by a massive Habitat shop sign on the corner of the street a few meters from the hotel. We stayed in the room 110, it didn't have much of a view but then at least it was on a quiet side of the hotel. The negative thing about this hotel is the noise at night and early morning inside the building. The walls must be pretty thin as you can hear everything that goes on all around your room: the cleaning, the lift etc. We had a very uneasy sleep due to this. The staff on the other hand were very polite and helpful, we had a few cocktails at the bar one evening and they were lovely but very expensive at 10 euros each!It was a shame they were so expensive otherwise we would have stayed there for the night but alas had to go out in search of cheaper booze.The rest of the time we were out and about enjoying the city and the surrounding areas. Highly recommend to go and climb Montserrat for the spectacular views, we spent an entire day there! All in all we loved Barcelona and if we ever get to go back I think I wouldn't mind trying another hotel in the same area just because there are so many to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, very helpful staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: SHANDREW
Reviews.Content: The location is just off Rambla de Catalunya . All the staff were extremely helpful, good choice for breakfast ! Perfect atmosphere and quality for a 4 star hotel!! Our room was spacious and clean and had windows which opened which was a nice break from the a/c.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: clmswallow
Reviews.Content: We flew into Barcelona airport, jumped on the RENFE train, changed at Passeig de Gracia, jumped on the metro, jumped off at Catalunya metro stop and the hotel is a 1 min walk max. Buy a T10 ticket which allows you 10 journeys on the RENFE overground and metro underground. You can purchase 1 ticket and share it between your group for €8.25. This hotel is ideally located for exploring the city, just off La Rambla, no more than a 10 min walk to the Barri Gotic quarter and in the opposite direction famous land marks such as Casa Batllo and La Pedrara. We also walked to La Sagrada Familiar but that probably took us around 45 mins (stopping at various shops on the way). On Placa Cataluyna, 150 metres from the hotel you can catch the hop on/ hop off tourist bus, which will take you to all the major sights in the city. There are a couple of different routes, we did the red one and it took us most of the day. Highly recommended and if you ask hotel reception you can buy a discount book for €6. I think the usual price for a one day bus tour is €22 per person and we paid €17pp. THE STAFF: All reception staff spoke excellent English and couldn't have been more helpful. I had found a couple of restaurants on TripAdvisor that I wanted to try while in the city, gave them the name and number and they were happy to make a reservation for us. THE ROOMS: We stayed in a deluxe double and paid €150 a night which I thought was reasonable. The rooms were very clean with a comfortable bed and nice modern bathroom. We stayed on the 5th floor and we were worried that there may be some noise disruption as we were so close to La Rambla but there was peace and quiet all night and we didn't hear a thing. We were in Barcelona for my boyfriends 30th birthday weekend and we wanted to go and watch a Barcelona match, I ordered the football tickets through www.SimplyBarcelonaTickets.com (recommended to me by a friend) and they were delivered to the hotel for us and presented to us when we checked in. There is a lovely lobby area in the hotel where you can take time out to enjoy a drink and an afternoon snack. Let the bar staff mix you a cocktail or chose from a nice selection of spirits and beers. The hotel had promised to arrange a cake/champagne for my boyfriends birthday and this never materialised which was disappointing but this is the only criticism I have of the hotel. I e-mailed the hotel on my return, and they apologised and have offered me a special rate if we wish to return (which we will).

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay at Pulitzer!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDominatrix
Reviews.Content: Just spent the Xmas in Barcelona and what a great hotel Pulitzer was: a very good location just off the Plaza Catalunya, two minute walk to Ramblas and Passeig de Gracia. A very nice, large room with a wooden floor, great spacious bathroom with good toiletries - they even provide footbalm which is a fabulous treat after a day of walking. The breakfast has a wide selection of Spanish tapas, fruit, the usual eggs & bacon & serial & pastry and even special juices and biscuits for those having a diet. A very quick and friendly check-in and check-out. Would definetely stay at the Pulitzer again!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location is the best bit!”
Reviews.Author: agm81
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are the fabulous location, friendly staff, nice bar area, and gorgeous mojitos!! unfortunatly, our double room was two singlebeds pushed together and there was a cockroach in the bath!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but in need for a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: CooperSJCW
Reviews.Content: For siteseeing/tourism, the location of the hotel is perfect. Right in the heart of Barcelona, and walking distance to many places. If something is a bit far to walk, you have a subway station 50 meters away from the hotel. Also, in Pza. Catalunya, buses from the airport stop there (aerobus) leaving you a 3 min walk to the hotel. Rooms are OK; clean, comfortable bed, OK bathroom, etc... The only thing is that the hotel looks very used up, and the rooms do also look very dated and are in a need for a full refurbishment. You can also hear a lot of noise from other rooms, and the windows do not close very well, so you hear the street traffic and it can get a bit annoying. If you get a good price, then it would be OK, but I would not pay more than 120-140EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable hotel, perfectly situated.”
Reviews.Author: Browntortoise
Reviews.Content: Very clean and tidy hotel in what is a fantastic location with attenive staff. Bathroom was very well appointed with robes and slippers a bonus. Rooftop area was amazing, we were there in Dec but already thinking of another trip to witness in the summer. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, well appointed, helpful staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: marsdc
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Pulitzer over Thanksgiving, and would absolutely go back. My only complaint would be what most of us Americans complain about when we travel to Europe -- small rooms. But for the price (I paid under $200/night), I really have no business complaining. The room itself was clean, well appointed and had a nice mini balcony overlooking the street in front of the hotel. The hotel is in an absolutely perfect location for exploring Barcelona -- yet it is tucked away on a side street so it is perfectly quiet at night. The hotel staff were all helpful and generally friendly. One of the things I really appreciated about the hotel is the bar/lounge -- it's large with comfortable chairs and tables, and is great atmosphere for relaxing with a drink or having a bite. And free wifi in both the rooms and the lounge makes the hotel and even better value. This was my only stay in Barcelona, so I can't compare to other places -- but I can't imagine finding a hotel with a better combination of value/location/quality/amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location- shame about the dark room!”
Reviews.Author: sbacon1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my boyfriends 30th birthday. I informed the hotel on booking that it would be his birthday whilst we were staying. It was still a lovely suprise to receive a birthday cake from them even though it was the night before!! The hotel location is fantastic. It's close to the metro and bus tour stops and within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and the shops. Our room was spacious and cleaned to an excellent standard. My only grumble would be that the room is quite dark even with all the lights on their maximum setting! Hotel staff were very friendly and recommended an excellent Tapas bar for us to visit. Breakfast in the morning was delightful and cocktails in the evening were competitvely priced for Barcelona. I booked the hotel through their website and got 15% discount off of our room which meant we could choose a better package!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: l-globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a few nights on the weekend trip to Barcelona as a solo traveller, and couldn't have been happier. It is brilliantly located, close to everything few steps to Placa Catalunya and you have Las Ramblas and Barri Gottic with its cathedral, La Boqueria market and other exciting places on one side, and pleasant contrast on the opposite side with La Pedrera and the like (not to mention most fab department crossed with homewares store behind it in Vincon (get to the terrace of the shop on upper level and see the back of Casa Mila/La Pedrera, absolutely splendid), or the gourmandise heaven that is Colmado at Rambla Catalunya, 63 - an absolute must. I had a double for sole use, it was very spacious, very quiet with fab views. If you want to have a bath, please make sure you ask for that when you book, otherwise you will be disappointed as many rooms are showers only. I loved their bathrooms, true 4 star quality amenities, bath robes, slippers etc, fab shower, comfortable bed, fancy multi-choice lighting system, excellent housekeeping service with a smile, and nice decor. I heard some rooms are getting a little worne, but mine was just fine. There is a cosy bar downstairs, and a nice looking restaurant though I have not tried it. Similarly, I opted for breakfast out. At €150 per night, I found the quality and value for money of this hotel excellent. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel at great location in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: twyss
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed my 3rd visit to this lovely hotel, for a long weekend in November (3 nights). What I really like here is the cozy and beautifully decorated rooms (a bit small I admit), the fantastic location and good breakfast. In addition staff are friendly and helpful. I think it's perfect except in summer, when I would choose a hotel with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: samandbon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pulitzer for seven nights and had a wonderful time. The Pulitzer hotel is in a great location and is close to everything including the Metro. The staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean and the lobby is a great place to relax with a cocktail at the end of the day after walking and touring Barcelona. The room is a little small but had everything you could possible need in it. The bathroom was well appointed and included a nice deep tub which helped our aching bodies. We had asked for a queen size bed when we made our reservation as a lot of hotels in Spain only offer single beds. The hotel did accommodate this request and the bed, pillows and sheets were wonderful, in fact one day we slept for 17 hours, might have been the jet lag :-) The only negative is that if you want to open the door to the balcony there can be some noise, Barcelona is a 24 hour city so there is always noise on the street, even in the middle of the night. I would stay at the Pulitzer again which for me says a lot as I always want to look for a new experience. This place is worthy of a second time. I hope you have as wonderful a time as we did. Adieu.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and best location! Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: faithc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a trip at the Hotel Pulitzer for our two year anniversary. Here are our comments: -This hotel is beautiful, clean, and modern, and truly felt like a 5-star hotel. It is located right off the Plaza de Catalunya, the best place in town! -Take the Aerobus in from the airport. Very convenient, and you can buy a round-trip ticket for 8.75 euros, and it literally drops you off at the other side of the Plaza de Catalunya. Less than a five minute walk to the hotel. -We stayed in room 503, and while the room was immaculate, the carpeting on the 5th floor overall could have used a cleaning. There is no clock in the room, so have your cell phone handy or bring your own. We stayed in a balcony room (there are only five on each floor) and while it was nice, it wasn't a "must." If you have a room with a balcony, you can only open the window by using a handle that is located in the armoire next to the window. -The shower is a little odd, with only half a door (you have to see it to understand,) but the rest of the bathroom was beautiful, with great amenities, bathrobes, and slippers! -The TV only has one English channel, and the rest of the channels were fuzzy. -The hotel was a bit noisy due to the location and thinner walls. -There is an open rooftop on this hotel, but unfortunately, we didn't discover it until the last day we were there at night, and it is only open until 8pm. -There is free Internet access at their sister hotel next door, Hotel Regina. We would stay here again...we loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The photographer has done a good job..”
Reviews.Author: Joali
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that the staff was very helpfull and the service saved our stay here. I had great expectations after seeing the photos, but ended up dissapointed.. It looks so cosy and stylish, but it's old, dark and small. The door to the bathroom was a wooden slide-door, and it was difficult to open and close. Wood and water=not a good combination! Also the wooden floor had several loose planks. But the worst was one night when we were about to open our door in the 2 floor, a cockroach came running out!! Not good!! But it was the only one we saw during the 3 days. The place needs a renovation..

Reviews.Title: “Average. Well located, nice cleaning staff but all others with attitude”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: There are good things about the Pulitzer hotel: 1. Its location 2. Its bathroom 3. The lobby and bar decoration 4. the room staff (South American or Asian, and very nice) Now, what we were not impressed with: 1. The special requests from the booking were lost 2. The rooms are small 3. The wifi is on and off (weak) 4. The reception staff has a bad attitude (we even ended up in a restaurant where they said they had made a reservation for us and guess what? no reservation) 5. The breakfast is sad (poor choice of healthy food...) 6. The gym that is advertised is "5 minutes away". Actually, it consists of a pass to go to a gym that is 15 minutes walk from the hotel... The gym is nice there but if you don't have time, you can't go...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea070876
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Barcelona and we have always stayed in 4* hotels. This hotel did not dissappoint. It is round the corner from Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The staff are very friendly and we had a bottle of Cava in the room courtesy of the hotel for our honeymoon. The hotel bar has fabulous 'chill out' sofas and is great for lounging about on drinking a bottle of cava!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant modern hotel in the heart of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: johnbarrot
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 night stay at Hotel Pulitzer. Hotel has a carefully put together modern motif. Nicely sized rooms with bespoke touches and some great lounge areas in the lobby to grab a coffee and relax. Staff were helpful but not overbearing. Close to Las Ramblas and metro/subway. Not near beach if that's what youre in Barcelona for. Happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, small, small”
Reviews.Author: MirageLady
Reviews.Content: Booked this through an American Airlines promotion. It was well located for walking in Barcelona, near La Rambla. Ended up with what is probably the smallest room in the hotel. A big pillar in the middle of the room, next to bed was one thing to dodge. On the other side, you had to sidle in carefully to avoid stubbing your toes on the wall. The room had a desk chair but was too small for a desk. I guess the chair was supposed to serve as a luggage rack since there wasn't any rack. The hotel offers a very overpriced breakfast buffet, but Starbucks and Cafe Zurich around the corner were better and cheaper. Hotel staff was helpful, marginally.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Live_t0_h0liday
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in September and found the hotel to be a great location from which to explore Barcelona. Located right next to Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla, it had good access to restaurants, metro and the "hop-on, hop-off" sightseeing bus which we used on 2 days. Also walking distance (20-30mins) to the marina and the beach where you could do activities like roller-blading. The hotel is quite modern with clean rooms, although depending on the room you get (we were in room 102), it could be a little noisy with the sound of garbage trucks in the morning. The one unpleasant thing about the room was that the towels in the room had a funny odour - it smelt like vinegar which we found strange and off-putting. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't provide any comment on the food. However, there are plenty of places to eat nearby. For breakfast, try the nearby markets where they sell lots of different types of fruits and juices which were just delicious!! There was a good tapas restaurant about 5-10 min walk away which was very nice! Ask the hotel for recommendation / directions. Overall, we found Barcelona to be a good place to chill out and take in some amazing sights - nothing tops experiencing the Sagrada Familia! Amazing! Also a day trip to Montserrat was fun too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller175England
Reviews.Content: We arrived of a cruise at 10am on Sunday morning as expected the room was not ready but check in and baggage handling was quick and easy. Our room was large by Continental City Centre standards, we did not like the black tile finish in the bathroom, it made it dark and looked dirty even if it wasn't, otherwise the room was very nice. Opening French windows to a small stand on balcony were a nice feature allowing fresh air in. The Hotel is in a fantastic location only 250 yards from the top end of Les Ramblas even less to either of the open top bus tours. The brteakfast was OK but poor value at 15 Euros a head. We were due to leave on Wednesday 29th September but due to a general strike on that day the earliest we could fly was Saturday 2nd October. The Hotel staff could not have been more helpful in getting us a telephone number for Easy Jet on the Tuesday to shuffling things around to allow us to stay the extra three nights in the same room and at the same rate as originally booked on-line. For a City Centre stay or at a 10 minutes walk from a railway station taking you South to the coast this hotel would be hard to beat. The roof terrace is small but is a nice place to relax in the sun especially when the bar is closed and they are not playing too loud awful jazzy music.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see Barcelona, great staff, lovely appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: coveswimmer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitzer is located perfectly to see the sites of Barcelona. Our stay lasted 4 nights. Located just off the Plaza de Catalunya, we walked most everywhere in the Old City. Metro, taxis, city sightseeing buses, bus to airport (Aerobus) are all within a block. Even though it is near a hub of activity and La Ramblas, the room was quiet and felt very private. Rooms were perfectly appointed, spacious with a comfortable bed. The staff was extremely helpful and all spoke english. The hotel also has a roof top lounge. While the bar at this lounge was closed for the season, we had a very nice picnic lunch on the roof. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Pulitzer was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GraciellaNewYork
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Hotel Pulitzer and were immediately pleased upon entering the lobby. The hotel was clean, modern and the staff was very pleasant. When we got to our room, it was a nice size and the balcony was a nice addition. The doors were soundproofed so that was a plus because there was a parade that night to honor the city's patron saint and it was right down the block so, we would have been upset if we heard the noise all night. The hotel was within walking distance of several restaurants and shops and it wasn't that far from the cruise port for us to leave the next day. The buffet breakfast was great the next morning also. I would recommend The Hotel Pulitzer if you are visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pulitzer for two nights before joining our cruise boat, and we were really happy with our room, and the hotel in general. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and the staff in the breakfast area were efficient and welcoming. Our bed was very comfortable and the room was big enough - apart from the end of the bed being too close to the TV. We didn't have any trouble with noise as other reviewers have, and the location was perfect. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super little place - very central - Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spagsone
Reviews.Content: Great find - thank you Trip Advisor... Central - very clean, nice rooms and lovely bathrooms. Restaurant fine for breakfast and bar / room service food quality excellent. Lovely friendly staff, and great bar for a drink before heading out or when you get back from a day of exploring Barcelona. Recommended to lots of friends since my visit

Reviews.Title: “Not everything you hoped for...........”
Reviews.Author: alkram
Reviews.Content: The Hotel, is right on the edge of Ramblas, which is great, but the rooms were undersized, greatly undersized. The front desk staff are poorly trained to say the least. Some even surly. I thought it was language issue, but it was not. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, but when they give you soap the size you get at the worst Holiday Inn, you know the choice was not good. The hotel needs to be freshened up, floors polished, carpeting replaced, etc. The cleaning staff however did a very good job

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy, Not flexible with extending stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerABQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly rated from TripAdvisor and frankly we expected more. It was right in the heart of the Ramblas which really translated to a very noisy area and expensive restaurants. Two weeks before our trip, we tried to extend our stay by one night and the rate went through the roof so we had to stay one night here and the next night at Hotel Constanza (which we enjoyed so much more) as they would not extend the same rate nor would they allow us to cancel. We won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money better then some 5 star Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Alex2010Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer for a week in early June this year - I will be back. The staff are amazing, Andrea and other concierge staff couldn't be more helpful & friendly - providing advice about best local tapas bars, traditional & modern. My room was large and very comfortable.Originally I requested a deluxe but they had run out when I booked...when I arrived I was thrilled I had the very reasonably priced normal room which was large and had a balcony. The upstairs bar is great. Also location fantastic for exploring Gaudi and central Barcelona. They even helped me find supplies at the supermarket- Pultizer rocks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: Sunrise55
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - right around the corner of Passeig de Gracia - the street with the best shopping in Barcelona. The room and beds were very clean and the service at the hotel was very good too. Great artwork throughout the hotel and room, and the restaurant/bar was chic as well. For less than 300 euro, this hotel exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends :)

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in hotel lobby”
Reviews.Author: voyage_en_france
Reviews.Content: My purse was stolen while in the hotel lobby on my first night at Hotel Pulitzer. WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS at this hotel! If you turn your head in the lobby for a minute, your belongings will not be safe. There is no security here except for video cameras. No one watches the front door, which should be standard practice in a hotel of this size in a busy area of the city like this. Thief was able to leave the hotel with my purse in full view of desk staff -- -- If there had been security at the door, he would have been caught! Had to replace passport and had no credit cards for rest of my vacation; not to mention my camera, reading glasses, etc. Hotel still charged us for our stay and I have yet to receive any sort of letter from the management. The hotel would have been nice if I could have enjoyed it; pretty decor & seemed clean. Still love Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Alex188644
Reviews.Content: I did not have a very good experience at all. The room was in dire need of refurbishment.. scratches on all furniture, walls. As you took the lift on different floors you could see holes in the carpets, areas where wood work was needed. I ordered a tea to my room and was brought a dirty cup.. clearly the kitchen had forgoteen to wipe of the coffee stains. My night was not much better as I had chemical smells coming through the room. I discoverd the next morning a mop left in the corrider -- smelling the same. I had a terrible migraine for the latter part of the day. Breakfast was sloppy at best. Surprised to find in a four star category hotel - jams in plastic containers. The only bright point was that the front desk was quite helpfull when in need of car service and information. Someone needs to let management know that they are going to lose customers fast if they continue to keep the hotel in this state.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - narrow rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Zoom123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stylish, with very nice public rooms, good breakfast and excellent location. We took 2 rooms in this hotel, one for me and my wife, and another for my parents. Although both rooms were of the same category and price, the room on the 5th floor (for smokers) was bigger, with bigger TV and better view than the other room on the 3rd floor. Both rooms were very narrow however, and it was difficult to pass from the front of the bed without bumping on the wall mounted TV. Apart from the fact that the rooms were small and narrow this hotel was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Staff Stole from my Room”
Reviews.Author: NYCBizGuy
Reviews.Content: Great location and good design, but I had a terrible experience with items being stolen from my room. Management treated my complaint about stolen items coldly, and promised to follow-up with phone calls (which I never received). Also, the telephone and internet did not work, and weren't repaired until the next day. I travel to Barcelona for business often, and knowing the wealth of options in the area, would not recommend this hotel until they resolve their staff and technology issues.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Central Location with Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: MatthewandIan
Reviews.Content: After a great review in UK magazine, we booked. Had the 'wow' factor with all the white furniture in the lounge & lobby on arrival. We checked in at a very busy time, as we (along with other guests) had just come off a cruise ship. The staff were busy, but still very courteous & helpful. Our room was of a great spec, with a very comfortable bed & room. Location is great, which means you are pretty central to all in barcelona. Although you were city centre, you do not hear a sound in your room. As for the roof to terrace. Great space, great cocktails & a great place to chill after a busy sight seeing day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room kinda small and overprice”
Reviews.Author: TexasWiseTravel
Reviews.Content: Great location right on Plaza Catalunya, plenty of buses and subway lines. The Aerobus from BCN stops right at Plaza Catalunya and 5 minutes walk to the hotel. Room is on the small side and the tv is really small (19 in flat screen wall mount). We had a room facing the street and the street noise is very minimal. Free wifi connectivity in the room is fine. Breakfast in good, enough selection of breakfast meat, juices, fruits, and rolls. Plenty of artwork everywhere in the hotel but personally I dont care much for it. The hotel is a little overprice. There are plenty of small boutique hotels around that area and in Barcelona and will check them out in the future such as the sister hotel Regina right next door, Hotel Jazz, and H10 Universitat.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Kitten01
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is awesome, just off placa catalunya. We had a great room the lounging area in the hotel is set up as a 'library' but with comfy sofas. For breakfast one had a variety of things to choose from and one could also sit outside on the terras. They also feature a great rooftop cocktail bar which one can also access if you are not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - you should try it!!”
Reviews.Author: Liz W
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is much commented on and it is absolutely perfectly placed. The Aerobus from the airport leaves you minutes away and it is a stone's throw from Las Ramblas. The interior is chic and cool. The room we had wasn't massive but more than adequate. It was very clean, bathroom was a good size and bed was comfy. Staff were polite and helpful esp Andrea on reception. The rooftop bar was pricey but definitely worth a visit. I would highly recommend you try this hotel - it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of hotel in a perfect location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ASawyer
Reviews.Content: I am a skeptical traveller and am usually always disappointed with hotels - they are almost always overpriced and are never as nice as their website photography suggests. However, on this occasion I was very pleasantly surprised. Hotel Pulitzer exceeded my expectations. It is a lovely, intimate, classic yet modern design hotel that could not be better located. Naturally, with wear-and-tear there are a few nicks here and a couple of marks on a wall there but it is in very good condition. The lovely wood floors in the bedrooms could probably do with a little more TLC but that's about it. The only things that slightly annoyed me was firstly that the frame of the mirror in the bathroom that sits above the sink had not been thoroughly cleaned and I had to wipe off a previous guest's toothpaste splatter (but that's not permanent) and secondly that, as another reviewer has noted, the wooden floors in the hallways do mean that when the cleaning staff start work promptly at 8am, you can be awoken by the clatter of the trolley. These are trivial cons through in comparison to pros. What really impressed me about this hotel, bar its chic design, it's fabulous rooftop bar, it's excellent cocktails and it's unbeatable location, was the service we received both when booking the hotel from home and whilst there. I needed to book three standard rooms - two for individuals who both wanted queen beds rather than twin and a couple who also wanted a queen bed - that were close to each other only a week or so before we planned to travel. I contacted the hotel with these requests and they responded very positively almost immediately. We exchanged a few emails and they were very helpful. Sure enough, when we checked in we had exactly what we had asked for. The reception staff were welcoming, friendly, efficient and always able to help with providing directions, restaurant recommendations, travel advice and the lugging of bags! The only thing to note is that the hotel restaurant is closed in August and the rooftop bar on Mondays. All-in-all we had a wonderful experience in Barcelona, in no small part due to this hotel, and though I very rarely say this, I certainly believe Hotel Pulitzer is value for money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlemissneve
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel very centrally located off the Plaza de Cataluna, which is the last stop for the bus from the airport (€5 per person) plus there is a metro station right on the plaza which is useful for getting to the train station if you are moving on from Barcelona. The hotel along with its sister hotel right next door (Hotel Regina) takes up most of the block just off the Plaza. We booked on the hotels website and were able to get a 10% discount as we stayed 2 nights, there were other discounts available. The room was very luxurious in décor with dark wood and big mirrors. Our room overlooked the street with doors that opened out into a very small balcony, just big enough to stand in. The street below was busy but the doors blocked out the sound when they were closed so we were able to sleep confortably. The bed was 2 beds pushed together, which seems to be common, but they were very comfortable. A minibar was also provided in the room, I was also able to connect to wifi on my phone in the room easily enought The bathroom was a good size with a large shower (no bath) and toiletries were provided as well as dressing gowns and disposable slippers. Hairdryer was in the bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful speaking very good English. The hotel was booked up so we had to move to another hotel for our last night in Barcelona and later we discovered that we had left a shirt in the wardrobe of our room in the Hotel Pulitzer. We went back and the person at the desk was very helpful, she took the details and then checked the room herself, when it wasn’t there she went and checked with housekeeping and it was returned to us within 10 mins. I felt that this was fantastic service as other staff members I’ve encountered previously would check the room and not bother doing anything else. Breakfast wasn’t included in our room rate so I can’t comment on that as we went to the café on the corner for breakfast. We were at the hotel as friends were getting married and the wedding couple booked the restaurant for a large ‘rehearsal’ dinner. The food was lovely with nice sized portions. The restaurants looked to do good deals for set lunches but we didn’t try them. The Hotel doesn’t have a gym on site but you are able to get a free pass for one a block or two away but I didn’t personally attend it. The main bar area in the hotel is just off the lobby and is very open with high ceiling. There is also a roof terrace bar which I loved as it was very relaxing and you are able to sit back in the sun with a cocktail listening to music playing Overall I loved the Hotel Pulitzer, it does have a very trendy boutique hotel feel but without the coldness that some trendy places have. It was a very luxurious hotel for less that I’ve paid for other hotels. I found the service to be fantastic and I would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrmondFazzas
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Pulitzer based on the many great tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We were travelling on our honeymoon and the Pultizer was just perfect for us. Room was rather small compared to the large bathroom. The room was clean and nicely furnished. Location was superb, close enough to Las Ramblas but not too close. Only minor issue was the noise travelling up from the bar area late at night. A nice touch was the free tea and coffee in the lounge after returning from a rather long boozy dinner.

Reviews.Title: “** Simply Fantastic! **”
Reviews.Author: Dovoro
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed her during the last week of July 2010. We booked a Superior Double room and from the moment we stepped into reception until the moment we left, everything was outstandingly well attended to. Knowing that the hotel was associated with the 'Mr & Mrs Smith' brand, well known for only accepting top class hotels for their listings, we expected excellent quality and we weren't disappointed. The room was elegantly chic, with modern and stylish features. Warm inviting tones gave a real chic feeling to the surroundings and the balcony overlooking the bustling street was a welcoming place to spend time watching the world go by. Situated at the top of Las Ramblas, the hotel was set in a perfect location for all local amenities. with the aerobus a 30 second walk away and all attractions a short hop on the metro which was 1 minute away. Cosmopolitan doesn't do the rooftop terrace justice. A feeling of style and 'coolness' was present as we sat sipping lime dacharies while the sun set and the warm glow of the lamps set the perfect scene for total relaxation. The live band on the Wednesday night had a brilliant and vibrant atmosphere to the night - really great! All the delicious breakfast you could eat, although we didn't include the breakfast rate in our booking and so paid full price, which put us off having breakfast in the hotel for more than one day as we could get it for half the price on Las Ramblas, minus the convenience of course. Overall, this hotel has now raised the bar very high and we will find it hard I think to equal or beat this quality anytime soon. With the friendly staff who went out of their way to take care of our needs, we had a lovely time and really felt special. Thank you to all of the staff for such a fab stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel 0 Needs Updating in Areas”
Reviews.Author: bluesky_w80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 days during the height of summer. I found the hotel lovely and charming. Positive Feedback: - It's in a great area. You have Las Ramblas around the corner and all the shops on your doorstep - Hotel is clean and tidy - Great service and helpful - Food is lovely if you eat there - Decor is modern and Great. I loved the artwork on all of the walls Negatives: - I thought the standard rooms were small, but they are modern - The artwork around the hotel needs some love and care. The painting in my room had a large rip - I had a late flight and asked if there was a room i could shower in at the end of the day before leaving. There wasn't. I found that a downside. If i wanted to have a quick shower, i needed to pay a half day rate. Having said that, i woudl stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What they said”
Reviews.Author: schvitzNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Superb location, nicely priced, comfortable [if a bit smallish] rooms, competent staff. My sole complaint -- the lighting. The lumens were more than adequate, but the switches were beyond confusing. Sometimes the lights went on, and sometimes they didn't. A user manual would have helped, or simple on/off switches.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Designer Boutique Hotel with minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: traveller255106
Reviews.Content: Pulitzer is a gorgeous boutique hotel with decor to die for. Everywhere you look there are gorgeous modern prints and interesting artworks, cosy seating areas and interesting design details like the glass elevator, quirky wooden benches and so on. That being said the hotel is looking a bit tired from a wear and tear point of view and some maintenance is in order eg there are nicks out of picture frames and polished floors that could do with a re-polish, however the contemporary fit-out made up for it to a large extent. Rooms are definately on the smaller side even by European standards so if you can afford to pay a little more and upgrade from the standard I'd recommend doing so. Breakfast was lovely in the enclosed courtyard. Being in our 40s and 50s we preferred the lobby bar for a drink to the terrace which would be heaven to the younger set. with pumping music and lots of beautiful people. If I was choosing to stay in Barcelona again I would be very tempted to return to the Pulitzer however would probably choose to stay in the old town 'Born' area - a bit quieter with more history and a more authentic Spanish feel. We tried to avoid Las Ramblas which was very noisy with a lot of young English tourists. Perhaps this is not the norm though as we were there during the world cup so it was crowded with very merry soccor fans cheering and hugging each other in droves. That being said the noise factor at the Pulitzer wasn't bad at all, being on a sidestreet. All in all we had a great stay here. I'd thoroughly recommend it for younger people who love to party and who appreciate quality decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, friendly staff... a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Arshavin23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in April 2010 as part of our honeymoon. The first thing to say is location is excellent. Very close to the action with most attractions easily walkable (Las Ramblas literally a stumble away), but still on a very quiet street. The rooms are beautifully furnished - very trendy and cool without being overly pretentious or clinical. The staff were friendly and helpful also. All in all, very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, boutique and chic.”
Reviews.Author: coyd
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the 4 night stay at the Pulitzer. Fab location just off Placa de Catalunya. Friendly and helpful reception staff...gorgeous display of lilies in the reception area. Nice room although a little tight at the end of the bed...having to squeeze past the flat screen tv on the wall. Also a little dark in the room, but comfy and clean. Had a superior room which I think was just a little larger along with a settee. This had a mini balcony which you could just step onto, overlooking the street. Spacious enough bathroom with nice smelling shower gel/body lotion...shower hot enough etc. Standard hotel hairdryer in bathroom...no iron...room safe in cupboard. Minibar is sort of camouflaged into the wall. Had no trouble with hotel noise, slept soundly, was woken up just after 9am on 1 morning but this was by the person next door slamming their door. Stayed on floor 5 tucked away into the corner so I guess noise levels vary dependent on where you are situated in the hotel.Communal areas of the hotel are contemporary and chic. Terrace bar and hotel bar area v nice. Breakfast room very clean and light with a terrace area outside... breaky was sufficient but not outstanding, bit repetitive. Would stay here again as the location is great...rates quite expensive though, perhaps it is worth shopping around a little. We have stayed in other hotels perhaps only a few hundred yards further away from the square whose rates have been a little more reasonable. Having said this, I would recommend this hotel and would not have a problem staying here again. For 1st time visitors to barcelona...areobus is a cheap and easy method of transport from the airport. Costs 5 Euros 5 cents, takes approx 30 mins (traffic dependent). Outside Terminal 2 turn left and look for the large 'A'...this is the bus stop. Has 3 stops...last 1 placa de catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for everything”
Reviews.Author: sunnylooker
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitizer is a nice hotel close to everything to do n Barcelona. The Hop on and off bus is right up the street and I highly recommend it if you have only a day or two there. The rooms are small, with wood floors (which could be cleaner). The hotel has a modern flare to it. The service is good and on a quiet street. Close to Las Rambus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing servise”
Reviews.Author: niazof
Reviews.Content: I've booked for this hotel via the internet only a day before the arriving day, and by mistake instead of booking for July I've booked for September. I found out about it only at the hotel and of course I've got nervous, but the staff was so helpful, specially Amanda. They explained that because the hotel is full for the first night I can stay in Hotel Regina, the next door hotel ( they have the same owner), for the first night and than to came back to Pulitzer hotel. I preferred to stay in Hotel Regina for the all the period because of convenient reasons and I wont regret that . In my next trip to barcelona I certainty will stay at one of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Danish_Globetrotters
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days in the Pulitzer during our stay in Barcelona. And what a wonderful time we had! The check-in was fast, and we had our room immediately, altough we arrived early. We had a superior room, which was very clean and nice. The bathroom was lovely and the amenities was great. (His and hers - now thats stylish!) Rooms were not big, but they were stylish and had a nice decor. There was no iron og ironing board in the room, but a quick phone call to the front desk, and it was brougth up to our room. (Really fast) The hotel has a lovely roof-top terrace, where we enjoyed wonderful drinks every night in the great Spanish weather. We have really high standards, but The Pulitzer blew us away. IT WAS PERFECT! We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, modern but warm and friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: srwilfong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights at the Hotel Pulitzer last month. I LOVE the decor... it is modern without being cold. Fun top floor outdoor bar area. Fun bottom floor restaurant and bar / living area. The front desk staff was helpful and spoke English well. We were on the 4th floor and didn't hear any street noise. The only problem we encountered was one night about 10 steps from the hotel we encountered a man urinating on the street near the dumpster. I don't think he was the first one to do so - that area smelled bad each time we walked by! But this is a big city and that is a typical big city problem. Also I thought that the rate I pre-paid included breakfast, but upon check-in I found out that it did not. We are breakfast at the hotel one day but then found other options. If / when we return, we will definitely stay at Hotel Pulitzer again!

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful Gem of a Hotel in Touristy Area”
Reviews.Author: JamesVarick
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived, my partner and I could tell we made the right choice. The rooftop bar offers a great intro to the city with stunning views and good vibes. The rooms were very chic and the bathroom was state of the art. The staff were helpful and even made dinner reservations for us. If you're in Barcelona this is a great choice."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: BradJanine
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location, very central - close to La Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya and all major attractions. A very stylish boutique hotel, however, it is showing signs of wear and will need some maintenance work. The room was very spacious by European standards.
