However, we found that the bed was very hard and quite uncomfortable. We also found the hotel housekeeping staff to be very noisy, which made it quite difficult to have a restful sleep. Reception staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. We also had lunch in the restaurant, which was beautiful and very reasonable. The food was beutiful and fresh, beautiful wines to match and exceptional service. We had an unfortunate experience where a member of the house keeping staff went through my handbag, with some small change taken. We reported it to the hotel reception. They were very apologetic and vowed to investigate and follow up on the matter, however, we have not heard from them since. Naturally, this put a bit of a dampner on our great experience staying in this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL! BEST PLACE TO STAY IN BARCELONA”
Reviews.Author: ackloots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the ideal location! It is close to every district but literally steps to the main plaza where you can walk down La Rambla or catch a tourist bus to start seeing the city. Our room was great size with a wonderful bathroom. It was very clean and quiet as well! The hotel lounge and bar are also really cool so it's a wonderful place to grab a drink before dinner or even breakfast or lunch. STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: grayray1
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Pulitzer based on the Tripadvisor reviews. We had a fairly small room at the back of the hotel, but it was quiet, clean and functional. Most important , the location was very convenient for us--first time vistors to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Would be 5 star if noise within hotel blocked better”
Reviews.Author: cgs11
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location that is central to many attractions, beds comfortable, rooms aren't large but are well laid out with lots of storage, spacious bathroom, front desk staff very helpful. Cons: hotel design is open concept so noise travels more freely throughout the hotel. Guests should be OK as long as there is not a large group gathering in the bar or lobby. There are uncarpeted wooden stairs on each floor - 3 rooms on each floor are near these stairs which can be disruptive if people are wearing heels or moving luggage. Breakfast at 15 euros/person seemed expensive given the selection.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be better!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendyclear
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We spent 3 nights here and they where perfect. The hotel is in the heart of the city, about a 1 minute walk away from the middle of Placa Catalunya. I loved the vibe of the Pulitzer. It's clean, friendly, fancy but also very accessible for everyone. Great staff! We even got to choose our room (in the front or in the back of the hotel). We choose in the front (room 417). It was spacious, good beds, super bathroom and the airconditioning also worked perfect! And... it has a nice balcony from which you can look over Placa Catalunya. When we go back to Barcelona (and we definitively will), we are sure to be staying at Hotel Pulitzer again. Thanks Pulitzer-staff for a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Doc555
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Highly recommended. Central location yet on a relatively quiet street. Easy access to Metro, taxis, and La Rambla. Elegant, comfortable, relatively large room. Very clean. Very quiet. Beautiful lobby. Excellent breakfast. Very nice terrace bar on the roof. First-rate staff. Very friendly and helpful. English widely spoken. Hope to come again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JohnDanburyCT
Reviews.Content: The good; The location is excellent, within walking distance of many of the major attractions of this lovely city and very close to shopping and transportation including public transportation to any part of the city as well as the airport. Also very close to the start point of the hop-on-hop-off bus. The staff is helpful in providing restaurant suggestions and for gereral inquries. The restaurant is very good and offers an excellent fixed cost mid-day meal. The bad : We found a large ring of hair stuck to the wall of the shower when we arrived and there was a clump of dirt onone of the fresh towels delivered during our stay. The rooms ar very narrow--less than 10 feet wide and not very well lit. Doors are slammed every time people enter or leave their room because the doors don't lock unless slammed. Overall it is a reasonably good hotel which I would recommend to others but only with the caution that it is not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlemissmillie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. I selected the hotel on the basis of previous Tripadvisor reviews, and I also emailed the Manager in advance of booking. I could not believe the service I received, he emailed me back within minutes and we sent a few emails back and forth about our requirements. I was so impressed. The hotel itself is literally 2 minutes from Plaza Catalunya - right where the airport bus arrives and departs. It was such a pleasure getting off the bus and being in our hotel 5 minutes later - without actually feeling like you were in the middle of town. The street it is on feels much quieter than the Plaza, and we had no problems with noise. The hotel is modern, stylish and beautifully designed without being pretentious or overdone which I hate and can't relax in. When we arrived in our room we found a bottle of champagne in an ice bucket with two glasses which was such a lovely touch for our anniversary. The breakfast is fine, we ate there on all three mornings. It is not spectacular but it is more than adequate. We had a drink in the fabulous bar area before dinner one night which was lovely. You get free use of a nearby gym and pool which my husband availed of. There is no hotel computer to access the internet but you can use the facilities in the hotel next door for free. My only small small gripe was that the room was very narrow, ie there was a very small space between the end of the bed and the wall. There is also a flat screen TV on the wall at the end of the bed and I managed to hit my shoulders on it twice despite being aware of it, sometimes you forget. Other than that it was a perfect stay, and I would most definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again if we returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAG710
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitzer is great! The rooms are super clean with high-end finishes. Hotel staff is really helpful and they speak English very well. The lobby is great for before or after dinner drinks with lots of lounging areas and a good bar menu with speciality drinks. The decor is a perfect blend of casual and modern. It's a one minute walk west of Plaza Catalunya which is the perfect place to be located in Barcelona. The Plaza has the main Metro line, buses to/from the airport (direct), and the plaza sits at the end of La Rambla so it's easy to walk to all tourist areas. Free WiFi, walking distance to great food too. I loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish accommodations, friendly staff and ideal location in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: JBodine
Reviews.Content: Spent a week exploring Barcelona with this hotel as our home base - it was terrific. Central location with much to see and do within walking distance and main metro station just around the corner. Comfortable and stylish accommodations, including within guest rooms as well as bar/lounge and restaurant plus a gem of a roof deck for lounging by day and cocktails/entertainment with scenic city view by night. Very friendly staff in all areas. Well-priced including varied rates by day of week. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice one night stay”
Reviews.Author: leobigs
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Hotel Pulitzer. We arrived at 10am and they had our room ready 30 minutes later. Since we had just flew on an overnight flight from Oklahoma, we were tired and took about 5 hour nap, We then went out sight-seeing until midnight. We checked out next morning and they graciously held our bags so we could do more touring until our cruise ship was supposed to leave that afternoon. The room was great and we like the all the toiletries they provided. The bed was very comfortable and they had free wi-fi in the room so I got to use my laptop. The decor in the room and lobby was neat and clean, modern and nice. Did not use the gym (down the street), restaurant, or any other amenities that they provided. Just not enough time. We will definitlely stay here again if we get back to Barcelona in future. Only thing that might bother some: could hear person above us walking around and moving stuff....drawback of the beautiful wooden floors, but didn't keep us from sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: jlukea
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and were very happy, the rooms are very nice and the location of the hotel on the main square (placa Catalunya) and right next to a metro stop and where the buses for the airport leave. The rooms aren't as big maybe as other four star stays but the location and style of the room was great!. The staff were friendly and spoke English well. The bathroom was clean and large enough, and the beds were comfortable, although we got a twin room instead of a double.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: I chose the Pulitzer for my visit to the F1 in Barcelona. Travelling alone, one of the reasons was the VISIT Restaurant for dinner. However, the restaurant is only open for lunch despite what is stated on the web site. Snacks at the bar were not really what I was seeking. Having said that, the hotel location is perfect for the city centre, car parking is available almost directly under the hotel and the staff were helpful and friendly. The (superior) room was, shall we say, compact. Nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the city center.”
Reviews.Author: ahinsch
Reviews.Content: Awesome staff, good breakfast. Modern and fun. Really nice gym a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Character - Great for the Experience”
Reviews.Author: kalikidd05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cute. It has a glass corridor that separates the front desk and the front side of the hotel from the back side. From the corridor you see two small and beautiful gardens with tulips and tables and chairs. The rooms are also very nice - unlike some other European hotels where the interior may look a bit dated and tired. There were several small glitches in terms of service but nothing big. One interesting thing about the hotel is that it has lots of elevators serving different areas of the hotel and even if you take the right elevator, it's a maze to find your room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, ambience and above all service are outstanding. This is a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover047
Reviews.Content: We booked a group of 11 of us for a business/team building event. All of the staff were attentive, very helpful and eager to please. The Pulitzer is in an outstanding location and I cannot recommend it highly enough. It hits that perfect pitch of being really smart without being too posh. I last stayed three years ago and the hotel still looks as good, so it has been very well maintained. I cannot beleive that anyone would be unhappy with this hotel choice. PS US citizens would probably say the rooms are too small, but this is the centre of one of Europes' most beautiful and historic cities. Well done to th team at Puiltzer.

Reviews.Title: “look no further”
Reviews.Author: panch
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. The Aerobuses stop in Plaza Catalunya and you walk right across to the hotel. The metro to everywhere in the city is also around the corner. Then La Rambla is around the corner. Breakfast was excellent. The hotel staff is very helpful with trip advice. The room is comfortable and the bathroom is modern. The walls are a bit thin so if you have a loud neighbor, you can hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer (and Barcelona) bona !”
Reviews.Author: masha2010
Reviews.Content: Returning to Barcelona after 40 years - was looking for a central comfortable hotel and found it in the Pulitzer. Hotel feels welcoming right away - lobby, small bar area and living room style reception area. Room and bathroom had modern minimalist features. All staff friendly and helpful. Great location. Barcelona is an even more beautiful, interesting, open and fun city than when I first visited. Would definitely go again and stay at the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “I'm writing my review from my room at the...”
Reviews.Author: Downtick1121
Reviews.Content: I'm writing my review from my room at the pulitzer on my cell phone using their free wifi. This place could not be better! Rooms are a good size, location is great and the staff is awesome (Derek & Andrea). They are very helpful and go out of their way for you. We are having a great time eventhough it is kind of cold and rainy. You will not go wrong with choosing the pulitzer! Larry

Reviews.Title: “Great style and central location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLovestotravel
Reviews.Content: I really loved the location of this hotel, having never been to barcelona we wanted to be central but not in the middle of tourist mayhem (i.e. las ramblas). Being right of plaza catalunya its easy to walk everywhere but the hotel is on a side street making it a quiet place to stay. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff could not be any nicer! We opted for the breakfast, which was really nice and in a beautiful space. We hit the breakfast rush on Sunday morning around 930 and had to wait about 15 minutes for a table because the staff was overwhelmed (even though there were a few empty table) which is my only complaint if that even is one.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, stylish, but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BaraXan
Reviews.Content: This extremely well-located hotel emphasizes style over comfort. The small rooms are attractive but thoughtlessly designed. A double is really only comfortable for one of the people staying in it; the other has no place to put clothes, no useful bedside light, and risks injury trying to get to and from his side of the bed. The light are on a baffling computerized system and there is no lighting at all by the large sofa that takes up much of the room. On the plus side, the staff was helpful in an emergency and the first-floor bar is quite fun.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: MedicalDroid
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during a congress in Barcelona: The location near Plaza Catalunya is perfect - even on foot you can get to many restaurants and places. The staff is really, really nice, for not to say charming! A staff member on the desk spent almost 1 hour to make a reservation in a restaurant for me! The hotel lobby, tha bar and the rooms are furnished in a modern way and the room was cosy. Good restaurant! Perfect. Would book there again any time!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lisatini1013
Reviews.Content: I just booked a 6 night stay here for late August. I booked it based on location and all the positive comments from other traveler's. After all the great review's I've read...I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Location, style, service -- this place has it all”
Reviews.Author: Thincaboutit
Reviews.Content: Really could not have asked for more. It's hard to imagine a better location in Barcelona. Just down the block from the Plaza Catalunya. Close enough, but far enough. Less than a 5 min walk to the super convenient ( and cheap - 5EUR) airport shuttle. Around the corner from La Rambla. Metro stops everywhere. Ideally situated to go wherever you need to go. And the super friendly staff is more than eager to help you get there. As far as design, the hotel is very cool. Great lobby and bar. Rooms are trendy/modern (but who spends a lot of time in the room anyway?) I would stay here again on a future trip to Barcelona without question.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: julesv72
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 4 night stay at the Pulitzer which I booked as my boyfriend's 40th birthday present. The hotel had been recommended to me by a friend and I was so pleased to have taken her advice. On reading previous reviews where comments had been made about couples being given twin rooms and double beds being singles pushed together, I emailed ahead to the hotel to ask for a nice double room due to the special occasion. On arrival at the hotel, we received an extremely warm welcome from Derek on Reception who spoke perfect english and attended to all our needs. Room 302 was allocated to us and I was overjoyed to see we had a great room at the front, with super kingsize bed and a balcony. The bathroom was exquisite with the best power shower both of us have ever used. 2 small bottles of cava were on ice for us, along with a chocolate cake - neither of which I had asked for. We both thought this was a lovely touch. I made the booking without meals therefore cannot comment on the food or drinks at the hotel however can say that the bar and lounge area were very nice with lovely big leather sofas. We nipped up to the roof terrace once to have a drink however it was a bit chilly and breezy (early evening) therefore didn't hang around long although I can see how this would be a lovely retreat in summer. The location of the hotel was perfect, on a road just off Plaza Catalunya, at the top of Las Ramblas. A 20 minute walk straight down to the waterfront with a fabulous harbour area, boat trips, aquarium and shopping mall. Hundreds of bars and restaurants to choose from and the expected hustle and bustle of market stalls and street artists. I'd highly recommend the food market for fresh fruit and juices at very cheap prices. I wouldn't hesitate to return to the Pulitzer and would recommend it to anyone. Feel free to contact me if you need any further info or advice.

Reviews.Title: “They really care about you!”
Reviews.Author: monkeychi105
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at this hotel yet, but i'm here to tell you my booking process. I started planning my trip to Spain a few months ago, and I was reading through all the reviews on the hotels I was interested in. I will be going to Spain in June (in 2 months!!) What made me choose to book Pulitzer was that the general manager of the hotel replied to all the reviews of the hotel posted on Tripadvisor. I was thoroughly impressed by this, so I wrote an email to the general manager months ago to let him know that I really appreciated a hotel that really cares for the customers and listens to their comments. When the time came for me to book this hotel (which was last night), I could not find a regular room. They only had a suite available for 290 Euros, which was a bit too pricey for me, so I contacted the general manager again since he really seemed to be willing to help. I woke up this morning with an email from him, telling me that he has a room for me at 109 Euros. Isn't that wonderful? I'm really looking forward to staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelforfunNy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Pultizer with friends and it was great. It is located at the top of Las Ramblas ( the main touristy street) so it's easy to walk to everything. The subway is also right down the street so you can get to the other tourist spots easily. It's a clean modern hotel with a bar/restaurant on the main floor. We stayed in one of the superior rooms which is worth the extra money so you have more space for luggage but it's still not big compared to US standards. We arrived early and were able to check into our room. The only reason I wouldn't stay here is if I wanted to be closer to the gothic quarter or el born area but it really was only a 5 minute walk. Barcelona was amazing and I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: headfortheborder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer and 4 other hotels in Barcleona last year while buying our apartment in the city (only just got round to writing the reviews). We got a tremendous deal - it was just over 90 euros per night for the room for the two of us (think it must have been an off-season special) plus about 10 e for breakfast (which was fine but not much to it). Undoubtedly this is fantastic value for the superb central location by Plaza Catalunya. The room was not large but it was fine, bed was comfortable, good flatscreen TV with CNN, BBC news 24 etc. Bathroom was small and poorly lit, unfortunately. Terrific bar with excellent bar staff, really good buzzy feel. Also our friends and we went for drinks next door at the sister hotel Regina (I think) one night, which was very nice. I think I might have preferred to stay there possibly but both hotels very nice and very good staff. Certainly spectacular value (unless this was a one-off).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo Shirokuma
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer was very comfortable and in a good location. Check-in was fast and efficient. The lobby décor, bar and restaurant were all very nicely designed, the elevator up to the rooms impressive. The room itself was well designed, and comfortable, though I didn’t like the fact the square, stone sink in the bathroom didn’t drain well, or the fact the button over the toilet didn’t always flush properly. The bed was comfortable, but nothing spectacular. The furniture and overall design had a very nice balance between leathers and wood and white walls. I liked the electric shade that closed the outer window off to the intense sun on my side of the building. The hallways were a bit noisy, and I think the doors could be better sound proofed. The morning breakfast was decent, but I don't know if it was worth 15 Euro. Overall, I had a nice stay at The Pulitzer and would consider it again in the future, especially for the price I booked in (breakfast, room, taxes and service charges equaled around 135 Euro).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Abdn-Kel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pulitzer for 4 nights in March 2010 and cannot fault it. We travelled with another couple. We got a really good deal booking through the actual hotel (409 Euros for 4 nights for 2 adults, excluding VAT for the basic room). I searched around and the hotels website definately gave the best deal. We opted not to include breakfast as we had read there was so much choice outside the hotel. We are quite glad we didn't. We did pay 20 euros for the romantic package which included a bottle of cava and breakfast in your room on the 1st day. The breakfast should have cost 30 euros, it was only a continental and not worth 30 euros. We took the eurobus from the airport to the hotel, 5 euros per person and I think the best way to get there, if you get off at the right stop that is. The bus takes you direct to Cataluyna square which is 2 minutes from the hotel, however we got off at the wrong stop, so stay on the bus until it reaches its destination. The hotel isn't very well advertised outside as we walked past is twice, just look out for the Visit signs. Check in was perfect from one of the staff, Derek, really friendly and helpful. I had emailed the hotel prior to arriving asking for some room requests one was to be next to our friends and we had a room directly next door to them. The room was lovely. As other reviews have said, slightly narrow but it's amazing how you get used to it. We had a room at the back of the hotel, so no balcony, but the doors did open so you could stand and get fresh air. Huge lovely bed, air con, full stocked mini bar (not too expensive, 3 euros for a beer, 11 for champagne..), lovely bathroom and ace shower. Bathrobes and slippers were provided to. There is free wifi which was perfect, no issues with it. We never ate in the hotel which I am a bit disappointed about as the food sounded lovely and the setting looked really nice. We did have cocktails in the bar (10 euros each) but they were worth it, lovely!!! The rooftop bar was closed as still winter season however you were able to take up your own drinks. We took up some champagen and sat outside and it was lovely, I can imagine it would be cracking in summer. The hotels location is perfect walking distance to Las Ramblas. I am glad we picked this hotel rather than one actually on Las Ramblas, it is very busy and bustly. Las Ramblas is amazing to walk down and see all the mime artists, but be warned, it is expensive to eat/drink on the street. We had lunch one day at a tapas restaurant and was over 100 euros for the 4 of us for not much food. But it was worth it to soak up the atmosphere of the street. We did the open top bus tour which is well worth it, you can get on the bus from Catalyuna square. There are 2 different tour operators, we opted for the Turisitic tour. It took us to Sagrada Familia which is worth seeing, but it also has multi language commentating during it by listening through the supplied free headphones. We also did the Nou Camp tour - it was amazing. Well worth doing. We also got a game while we were there which was just out of this world. We went to the Ice Bar which was good fun, 15 euros for 45 minutes including a cocktail, something different. We went to the zoo, nothing special about it but good fun, we hired a golf buggy to drive us round. The Majic fountains are worth a visit to. We took the tube and used taxi's and both were very reasonable. We definately want to go back to Barcelona and would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Luka_luka22
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Barcelona with my wife, as a present on her birthday. As this is our 6th time in Barcelona, I can say that we have some previous experience regarding the location of the hotel and some other hotels to compare it with. I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and booked for 3 nights, finding a very good offer for the hotel and for the location itself. Speaking about that, the Pulitzer hotel is perfectly located right in the center of Barcelona, in Placa Catalunya. Of course, it's very easy to locate, as it stands in the back of Fnac (a large electronics store). The staff was very welcoming, speaking English and of course Spanish. The hotel is very elegant, I guess renovated, cause the building is quite old. When you enter the hotel, you have the reception on your left, the open bar and a lot of couches on the right and the restaurant and a patio in front. I read about a patio on the roof, didn't use it. The bar is nice, had a cocktail and some wine there. Rather expensive comparing to a bar in Barcelona, but it was ok. The room is very nice, the size is ok comparing it to some other hotel rooms in Barcelona and even in Europe. I don't know USA, but for Europe is ok. The furniture looks good, some of it gives me the impression that is just renovated, not new (can be only an impression though). You have TV, wifi internet, minibar, some snacks, safe box, heating, air conditioning. The bathroom is very clean and they provided all that one need (towels, shower gel, shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrush, shaving set, slippers and so on). Everything is very clean and the thing that they clean the room a little bit later than in other hotels was not a problem to me. The only problem we had was with the heating. First night the air conditioning (that provided heating also) worked, but there was no heat, only ventilation. We spoke with the reception staff in the morning and they sent someone to take care of the problem. When we returned in the afternoon, everything was ok so that's nice of them. Well, let's say almost ok, cause there still was a weird noise sometimes, during the air conditioning functioning. It sounded like a crack and I guess it was something like the plastic in the pipes heating/cooling. But I guess it has to do with the law of physics and it didn't occur so often so we were able to get a good sleep. Another thing in the category of heating are the windows, rather weak-insulating, but this is a common aspect in Spanish windows. And talking about the good night sleep, I appreciate the fact that they provide 2 kind of pillows, different sizes, which is good for those like me that prefer sleeping on a non-fluffy one. The fact that double bed means 2 beds placed one next to the other is not good. Double bed should be a big one which fits 2 persons, without the dividing line that 2 beds give. Either you have 2 beds with just one king size mattress, either one king size bed. All that being said, I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and I would definitely return here. We ranked this one as the second best that we ever stayed in Spain (visited a lot of cities there) and the third overall. PS: In choosing this hotel, the fact that the hotel's management is bothering replying to reviews was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Why use a sentence to describe this Hotel when one word will do - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: glasgowskyeblue
Reviews.Content: I do not think I can recommend this Hotel highly enough. The Staff are extremely helpful - nothing but nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are beatifully decorated and well furnished with a wonderful bathroom. There is a relaxed feeling throughout and the ambience is so relaxing. It serves as excellent value for money. It is perfectly located for exploring the city and from within you are not aware of the hustle and bustle outside. We did not eat any meals in the Hotel so we cannot place comment on that service. If we go again we will stay in the Hotel Pulitzer - take the stress out of chosing a hotel in Barcelona and chose this one!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: dubaiite
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitzer is a modern hotel which has young and yuppy staff. The hotel is very well placed and a stone throw from Placa Catalunya and La Ramblas ( Scam capital)! It started snowing the minute we got into the cab from the airport, a phenomenon that last occured in Barcelona in 1984. The residents of the city were ill prepared for this and the hotel staff too was in awe of the rapidly falling snow. Of course, there was no electrical kettle available but the bartendar would kindly give us a hot water flask with tea cups etc at no charge. Breakfast was not included in the rate so cant comment on that. Rooms and bathrooms were on the smaller side but the balcony was a welcome extra space. For the price and location, it is your best bet!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Franbrasilia
Reviews.Content: This is a very central hotel, right next to subway station and it's the best location someone could ever hope when in Barcelona. The staff was ok - an unusual thing in catalunia. The room was small, but nothing else to complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for its price range”
Reviews.Author: davidtinney
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from three nights at the Pulitzer and agree with all the positive comments here. In addition, it should be noted that the staff speak English very well, the breakfast is excellent, and problems are sorted out with intelligence as opposed to eager incompetence. There are many slick, designer hotels to consider in Barcelona and given this hotel's affordable position among them I'd say it's a very good bargain. Just one piece of advice for staff who might read this. The rooms have a few bumps and scratches in them (from luggage, wear and tear, etc) that needs to be addressed if you want to stay competitive in the 'sleek and fashionable' stakes of Barcelona. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Clean facility w/nice rooms but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: sharontoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 17 year old son. We booked a lower rate online and felt as though the room they gave us was probably held aside for those cheaper rates. The room was always adequately clean by staff and we got a smile at how careful the housekeeper was with the items we left on our bathrrom vanity every day - placing them neatly on a towel. However, the room (105) was right across from storage cabinets and the elevators. At night we heard the slamming of these doors, people talking and the bar area just below being cleaned up. being on the street we were woken up several times during the night by the nightly garage pick-ups and al the businesses tossing out their glass recyclables. We were at the end of an exhausting 2 week trip and every time we talked about requesting a room change, we were too tired to act on it, so I fault myself there. Amanda at the desk was very, very helpful with recommending fine dining and making reservations. The location is wonderful and just a few minutes from the Aerobus (euro 5 to/from the airport). I would just recommend that if people make reservations they request it not face the street.

Reviews.Title: “All sizzle, no steak”
Reviews.Author: MarkP_9
Reviews.Content: Let's get one thing out of the way: great, GREAT location. So I give it more than one star. But when you step inside, the beautiful looks hide a hotel in which many, many things simply do not work. * In my room, the sink was stopped for all 4 nights * In my colleague's room, the thermostat was broken and he was boiling * In my boss' room, the TV didn't work * In the bar, the staff was rude and a pipe burst and they got flooded * In the business center, they don't have Office, only a free version of Open Office, so none of us could print our presentations for business meetings * And when we checked out, they couldn't provide a bill with the full amount on it, ostensibly because we'd paid part of the rate up-front when we reserved the room

Reviews.Title: “You can book this hotel with complete confidence....”
Reviews.Author: bsm9034
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid cruiser and spend a good deal of time researching out hotels online for my pre- and post-cruise stays. I was looking for a hotel back in the fall of 2008 for myself and my parents. After spending several days comparing reviews, candid photos, and locations, I decided to book rooms at the Hotel Pulitzer. I COULD NOT HAVE BEEN HAPPIER! WHY? 1) LOCATION: I wanted a Hotel that was in the center of the City so myself and my parents could walk around easily. I also wanted to be near Las Ramblas. This hotel was perfect, as it is on a quieter side street - Bergera Street - and one block from Plaza Catalunya. You walk out the door and walk one block to the right and it opens up to the beautiful Plaza Catalunya. From there, you just walk south to La Rambla where you find the crowds, excitement, and things to keep you entertained. 2) DECOR: Beauftiful! Lobby has plenty of comfortabl couches and chairs where you can grab a cup of coffee or a drink from the bar and just relax with friends and family. The glass elevator provides views of the open centrum in the middle of the hotel as you ride upwards. The rooms were very clean; beds comfortable and bathroom was newly updated with great smelling products. 3) SERVICE: Though I did not really request anything, the staff was always very helpful and easy to speak with. They were very warm and friendly at check-in and always said hello each time I either left or entered the hotel. 3) VALUE: This hotel offers a great product and an outstanding price. The pricing on their website is straight forward and I feel is a good value based on what they offer. This is not all hype. I stayed here with my parents in October 2008 and then recommended a close friend of mine stay in here August 2009. He throughly enjoyed it, as well. And guess what? My friend and just booked a cruise out of Barcelona in November 2010 and guess where we are looking to stay, again? Yup....here! Trust me...you'll be happy with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean hotel, non-smoking”
Reviews.Author: mdcwa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for one night in early February before boarding a cruise ship. We took the airport bus (5 euros) to Placa de Catalunya - the hotel is just across the square and a short walk up a side street. We were greeted by the friendly hotel staff. Since we had made a reservation over the internet, we were given a free Barcelona city guide (the guide also includes Rome, Paris, and Buenos Aires). The decor of the room was mod design. The room had a comfortable bed, chair, stocked refrigerator (pay for drinks), TV with various language channels, closet, and storage chest. Floors were plank hardwood and may have been some of the original floors in the building. The bathroom had tile on the floor. Bathroom had a tub shower combination. Amenities included bathrobes, slippers and a "man" and a "woman" kit that included such items as comb, razor, toothbrushes, toothpaste, shaving cream, after shave balm, etc. The room is narrow, about the width of a cruise ship cabin, but longer. Doors opened out to a French balcony. The room did show some signs of wear, but was certainly clean. In a fire, I would certainly feel safe getting out of the building as the staircase was completely enclosed in concrete. Breakfast was available, but we considered the price too much and bought food at El Corte Ingles which is across the square near the airport bus stop, and brought it back to the room and put it in the refrigerator. The Hop on Hop off bus also stops at the square-very convenient. The is an ATM outside the hotel (not associated with the hotel) and to the right, although I found the exchange rate to be quite high. We would stay at the hotel again when we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: autumnrose14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pulitzer for our honeymoon. Great location, easily walkable to all the "big attractions" of Barcelona. Beautiful roof deck that we used for lunch every day -- dining on items purchased at the market, friendly and knowledgeable staff, beautiful, clean rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: TinyLittleFeet
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is in a fantastic location - just one minute from Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas (apparently the most happening street of Barcelona!), but yet not too noisy. Incredibly trendy and arty common areas and bar, beautiful outdoor terrace at rear, fantastic cocktails (and lovely waiter, Ale!!), good bar food.... absolutely no complaints at all! Rooms have everything you want, with very stylish bathroom and lots of little packages of things you might need. Am going there again next week, and can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazingly Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShinChengMu
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel we were stunned by its design. It has a beautiful lobby, integrated with a bar with nice atmosphere. The designer daringly chose high-contrast white and black as the theme colors of the room. The room is furbished with cleverly designed furniture, including a hidden closet, hidden sliding door to a beautiful bathroom, wide, square bed. This is a hotel you will not forget once you see it. The hotel is located right next to one of the most beautiful plaza in Barcelona, with easy access to metro and buses. It was pleasant walking in the neighborhood. We were traveling with a baby and the hotel considerately placed a baby bed in the room, with a stuffed bear. Our baby loved the bear, so I asked the staff how much it costs if I'd like to take it home. To my surprise the bear was offered to us for free. This kind of detail does matter for customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Minnie-Madcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for a few nights. Decor is very modern - a lot of white and 'form over function'. Not for you if you don't like very modern hotels with not a lot of character (but if you do the sister hotel Regina next door would be a better choice - on the face of it had a warmer, somewhat more traditional feel, having siad that the Pulitzer is what it is - it is a modern design botique hotel - so nothing is on a grand scale). Staff friendly and helpful, hotel very clean, beds very comfy, rooms well stocked. Best feature is location right beside Placa Catalunya - centre point for tourist office, bus operators, metro, airport shuttles etc. Have access to hotel next door for internet use etc. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location - Excellent Staff - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Anjani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Pulitzer in January 2010. It wasn't the cheapest hotel, but after a lot of debate and research, this is the one I decided to go with -- many thanks to the members of Trip Advisor! Location: It was a wonderful choice. The hotel is so centrally located - in the heart of Placa Catalunya that you can walk to just about anywhere without an issue! La Rambla is right across Placa Catalunya -- so you're super close but not actually on it. The hop on & off bus stops are right across the hotel. Plenty of places to eat -- though they tell you to avoid eating on la rambla. If you walk about 10-15 mins, you're at Columbus Monument/the sea!! I loved staying here. Metro was conveniently located though I never once had to use it. Service: The service was excellent. The staff is kind, helpful and always cheery. Was able to answer any and all questions promptly. The room was always cleaned and tidy and replenished as needed on a daily basis. Room: I had a room on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking the main street Pulitzer is located on. If I looked to my right, I could see Placa Catalunya. The bed was super comfortable; the room size is perfect for one person. There is a flat screen TV in the room, free Wi-Fi, a safe that was perfect to hold my passport and netbook. There was a huge closet with drawers, in addition, a separate armoire/chest. It was more for documents and such. A mini fridge fully stocked, robes and slippers - which are always a nice touch. The bathroom had sliding doors, which I loved, it also had a "man" and "woman" container, which included essentials from tooth brush, razor, combs, and personal items - I thought that was new and nice; haven't seen it in the states anywhere. The lights had three different modes in the room so you could dim it, keep only one light on or turn it all off right from your bed. Overall: I just loved the hotel, was made to feel very comfortable. The hotel did have a bar/restaurant but never ate there so can't comment on it. I think if you are looking to stay in a great location without the noise and are willing to pay approximately $120 USD a night (I went low season), then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: bee_tattoo
Reviews.Content: Chose the Hotel Pulitzer after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. We got in at 9am and the hotel had a room ready! The location was perfect. At first we thought the room was rather small, but after settling in, we found the accommodations were great (hardwood floors were great....but wished the lady upstairs could have removed her heels in the morning!). The bed & pillows were comfy...the shower was super (no tub to climb over...a plus)...and it was nice having a desk area to use the laptop. The hotel was super close to EVERYTHING...and there was a small market across the street to get aqua con gas! We loved the breakfast in the morning (and the wonderful service from the morning staff!) and the hotel sitting area & bar were very relaxing. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful! They were great and we will return!! WONDERFUL vacation!! (although I have now had my fill of CNN!!)

Reviews.Title: “Moderate prices in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Ex_camper
Reviews.Content: The staff of this small, botique hotel are extremely helpful. The rooms are well appointed and come with many amenities. The rooms are comfortable and quiet, although some may wish for a bit more space. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 for The Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Digsi
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a weekend break in Barcelona. The Pulitzer made our stay very special. The taxi driver from the airport had many positive comments when he heard where we were staying (taxi was e30 and took 30mins from airport). He wasn't mistaken. All of the previous complementary reviews were correct. The following points outline why I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel... 1. Location. As said numerous times before, very central. Just off Placa de Catalunya where there are plenty of shops, restaurants, bus tours start here etc. Close to Las Ramblas also. The street is very quiet and safe. 2. Staff. The staff from receptionists to waiters etc were all very accommodating and helpful. Not 'in your face' but couldn't fault them. Efficient calling taxis, advising restaurants, giving directions etc. 3. Decor. Found the hotel to be very tastefully decorated- chic, low lighting, candles, big pictures and mirrors etc. Rooms are long and narrow- probably bigger than I had expected from the photos. Extremely comfortable 6ft bed with lovely Egyptian cotton bed clothes. We enjoyed relaxing in the evenings in the lobby after dinner. Great chilled out contemporary atmosphere while still maintaining a cosy feel. 4. Food. I had booked the 'Romantic Package' which was great value- for an extra e20 we had breakfast on one morning included as well as a bottle of cava on arrival. Breakfast was very good- fresh fruit, cereals, juices, cheese, omlettes etc. We paid an additional e60 for a late check out- 6pm, worth the extra expense due to a late flight. Overall I was delighted with my hotel choice. Would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate in recommending to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Verrazano
Reviews.Content: Just spent four very enjoyable nights at the Hotel Pulitzer. The hotel has nice rooms with a very helpful staff and an excellent location. We arrived early in the morning (8:30am)and instead of simply allowing us to store our bags, the staff remarkably had our room waiting for us (January is off season). I had requested a quiet room and sure enough we were given a location in the back of the hotel (in retrospect the request was probably unnecessary as the hotel is located on a quiet side street). The room had attractive comtemporary decor. Robes and slippers were provided and daily the maid left a bevy of toiletries. Free internet access was also available. The lobby, lounge, and bar were all attractive. The hotel is excellently located in the L'Eixample neighborhood steps from the Placa Catalunya. We were able to take the Autobus (5 euros) from the airport to the plaza and walk across the plaza to the hotel. One block away is what we thought was the 5th Avenue of Barcelona, Passeig de Gracia. The northen tip of La Rambla is literally steps away as is the Barri Gothic, La Ribera, Ciutat Vella and the metro. Bus #24 can be taken to Parc Guell right from the plaza. The funicular to Montjuic was a free transfer and a few minutes away on the metro. We did not opt for the hotel breakfast but instead walked to the Mercat de La Boqueria and breakfasted among the locals at the Bar Pintxo. We would eagerly stay at the Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Pleasant1
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a 5 night stay at the Hotel Pulitzer. The location, right off the Placa Catalunya was perfect, close to transportation hubs, restaurants, and shopping, as well as many of the city's sights. We arrived early at 8:30 AM, the staff stored our luggage and we went out to explore Las Ramblas. We came back at check-in time and were helped to our room by Derreck who would prove to be extremely personable and helpful throughout our stay. Several evenings we had a drink at the bar or some small plate - the Ham Iberico and Manchego cheese was excellent. The bar staff was friendly, especially Javi. Our room was nice. quiet at night, plenty of storage space, and was cleaned every day. The balcony opened out onto the street which could be noisy at night if the doors were left open. We had breakfast one morning and it was very good - fresh OJ, and delicious Cafe con Leche, and a serious variety of breakfast food from yogurt , fresh fruit, eggs, meat ,cheese , and wonderful pastries. Overall a wonderful stay. The location was perfect, the staff always helpful, and a cozy and comfortable room. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “In the hearth of the city”
Reviews.Author: AlessandroB10
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel 20 mt far from Placa the Catalona Y la Rambla. Very suggested for the position, the rooms are confortable so as the bath. nice bar dowstairs.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: mtat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona. Stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer - loveley hotel. Good rooms, Quiet, no street noise (our room was on floor 5) very friendly staff. Fabulous location. Excellent choice for breakfast. No food in the eveining - dining room closed - maybe it would have been better to have been notified of this prior to our arrival. Would stay here again and would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back...”
Reviews.Author: Westy2405
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this hotel everytime we visit Barcelona and sadly will be our last. We have noticed that the level of service and quality of the room is going downhill. 1. We requested for a non-smoking room and we were given a smoking room. There were cigarette butts in the shower/toilet room. 2. The room is not clean. Scuff and black marks all over the wall plust the cigarette butts in the shower/toilet room. A so called 4 star hotel would be like this. 3. Checking out service was very rude. We checked out early at 7am and the receptionist was very rude for some reason. Just the attitude was unbelievable. Anyway what goes around comes around. As I said at the beginning this is not our first stay here but our third however after the attitude and the quality of the room they've provided us we will go and spend our money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in barcelona!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jantien1
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is in my opinion the best hotel in Barcelona. The lobby and roofterrace are great places to lounge about, the rooms are a bit small but very well appointed, and the location superb! The friendly staff speak fluent english. I stayed here on several times and will book this hotel everytime I am in Barcelona. My only worry is that booking them may become difficult if they keep this up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BootsN
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in early September 2009 and were so satisfied that I booked my son and his wife here in December 2009. They had the same reaction as we had. The rooms are lovely with a great bathroom. The people at the desk are friendly and helpful. Since I booked my children's stay, I had some questions that were answered immediately. The hotel staff is very friendly. Superb location! I'll be there again. Boots Newstrom

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaliCourtney
Reviews.Content: My stay here could not have been better. The hotel is modern and stylish, but warm at the same time. Very classy. The room was small, but comfortable and very well decorated. The shower was great and the wireless internet access worked well. I really enjoyed sitting in the lobby bar area and having a coffee or beer in the evening. The staff was friendly and very helpful on the rare occasion that I needed something. I did not try the restaurant, but it looked very nice (and popular), though a bit expensive at 15 Euro per person for breakfast. I got a great rate by booking and paying in full in advance. For just over 90 Euro per night, it was an excellent value. The location was as central as one could want (I would actually have preferred to be a bit further away from Placa Catalunya & Las Ramblas). The chinese restaurant across the street, Dim Sum House Restaurant Asiatico, was excellent and very reasonably priced. There is also a supermarket just across the street, which is convenient for buying water or snacks. I would not hesitate to stay at the Pulitzer again next time I'm in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jem813
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location within easy walking distance of La Rambla. The rooms were average in size but very clean and crisp! I stayed with my best friend and we had a great city break. The staff were lovely also and we got to use the fitness centre/swimming pool which was just down the road. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great location and service”
Reviews.Author: nursely
Reviews.Content: This little gem, located 1/2 block from Plaza Catalunya, was a wonderful surprise and I would recommend it to anyone touring in Barcelona unlesss ou are looking for the most grand accomodation.. Very nice amenities, bathrooms, breakfast and a cozy bar complete with a Christmas Tree. Great bed, nice linens, robes and toiletries. Free internet. Most important, fantastic, helpful staff at the desk ,the dining room and in the bar. They offer help, even before you ask, and could not have been any nicer. Make sure to ask about the bedlamps as they are a little tricky with off/on/dim switches combined in same mechanism ( they were new to us)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with all access to a great city.”
Reviews.Author: Djox106
Reviews.Content: I loved the atmosphere at the Pulitzer. They make great use of their atrium over their ground floor bar. My partner and I were facinated at the 5 story open architecture what a great space! Our rooms was equally charming if a bit rough around the edges. We're not quite used to the split matress but understand that that is sometimes how beds are in other places. We diceded that a full Kin matress might not have fit through the narrow corridor leading to our room. In any case we slept soundly and were quite comfortible watching Spanish MTV on the flat screen TV infront of our bed. One thing that we had fun figuring out was the light switches. Again I chalk this up to my ignorance of other places and was charmed by the various moodlighting one had to cycle through to get the lights to actually turn off completly. Let's just say that it added charm to the room. :) The front desk staff were very accomodating as we were quite unprepared with our spanish. Directions and suggestions were offered easily and someone was always there to help. One of the great things about this hotel is the location. You are in the middle of this amazing city. Each day we chose a different compas point to explore and were never disappointed. I love Barcelona. I highly recommend the various esspresso drinks the city's cafés have to offer. I also recommend ordering everthing in Spanish, or Catalan, if you are lucky enough to know it. Most are very helpful if they know a spot of English, or are adept with hand gesture. In anycase, we were very happy to stay at the Pulizer as the charm of the city was definatly present at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dms422
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat! It's not directly on Las Ramblas, which was great since I was not at all impressed with that area, but it is right at the top of it so it's easy to just stroll across the street to get there. If you're planning on exploring the city by foot, this hotel is at the perfect central location. The metro is also right at your doorstep if your feet need a break! The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are small by American standards, but not uncomfortable. I loved how they were done, very simple, yet warm. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: DinaC1
Reviews.Content: Great location, breakfast included, pretty room....couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: barbco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Las Ramblas,a block from all major transportation and all the hop on hop off routes. Great decor, very nice and helpful staff, great breakfast. Staying there made a wonderful trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and perfect locacion”
Reviews.Author: Fito
Reviews.Content: One block from Plaza Cataluña , El Corte Inglés, the Ramblas. Very modern decoration, nice room,( confortable, not huge), bathtube, shower, amenities. Attentive staff, willing to recommend and give tips on restaurants, etc. Have not tried breakfast there, sounded too expensive. There is a bar-restaurante across the street where you can have coffee and milk, croissants, butter and ham for two persons for 10 euros (they also serve eggs and fresh orange juice). The price was 115 euros which is great for a 4 stars hotel in such location. There is a nice and lively bar. The hotel next door, the Regina, is owned by the same chain and enables you to use internet FREE at their lobby!!! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel that does it right! Service, Location and Comfort are Tops!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawop
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Pulitzer Barcelona. Wished I could have stayed more. Got a good "advance booking" rate on hotel website 120 Euros + VAT. At that price, this hotel is a steal!! Location is just metres from Placa Catalunya, smack in the center of Barcelona. Great if you want to walk to sights and restaurants in both the old city and Eixample. Standard rooms are indeed fairly narrow as most on here have attested, however they are much longer than I expected and bathrooms are very spacious. Everything is ultra modern and very comfortable. All amenities to pamper you have been thought of. This is definitely a top-of-the-line hotel. Unlike many of these 'hip'/'boutique' hotels, this one has no attitude, but rather a great service orientation. We were leaving Barcelona for 5 days before coming back to Barcelona for a lengthier stay. Even though we were not staying at the Pulitzer upon our return to Barcelona. They gladly held our large luggage while we did a short jaunt to Menorca with carry-ons only. Beds, linens, towels, A/C, furniture, flooring, fixtures, pillows and toilettries are top-of-the-line. Lobby is super as well, with white leather couches everywhere. In the heat of Barcelona, it's great to enter a hotel lobby that isn't afraid to crank the A/C down low. If you're looking for a very modern yet comfortable hotel in central Barcelona at a good price, look no further. You've found it.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service in all of Spain”
Reviews.Author: Sofoula13
Reviews.Content: I will have to start out by saying we got a tremendous deal on our room. It was 106 Euros a night, which isn't cheap, but it's a steal for the location (right off Plaza Catalunya) and quality of Hotel Pulitzer. We spent weeks scouring Trip Advisor comparing reviews, to photos we saw against # rank, versus the cost, and settled on Hotel Pulitzer, a boutique hotel that ultimately lived up to all the positive reviews we read. The staff were simply AMAZING. I can’t say enough good things about them. For starters, we do speak a little Spanish, which will definitely be necessary in Spain, BUT the hotel staff all spoke fluent English. It was a VERY nice surprise since that was not the overall impression we got from Spaniards. At the end of our 3 night stay, their English came in handy when we lost our rental car reservation (entirely our own fault, we were late to pick it up) and the staff went above and beyond what was necessary to help us. They directed us next door to a sister hotel (also a beautiful hotel, Hotel Regina I think it was) of theirs whose amenities they share, and told us that we can use the business center there (as well as the gym), they held our luggage for us downstairs, helped us track down train schedules (interpret them, give us details that are not otherwise provided online – like that tickets go on sale in person only, an hour before the train departs – no online same-day booking, on the RENFE trains), called other car rental companies for us to locate alternate car rental and most of all, letting us use the hotel phone for free and call all over Spain (literally, all over Spain) since we were heading out of Barcelona. We had requested a room on the highest floor possible (to avoid street noise) and we got a room on the 5th Floor (there is a 6th floor, where the rooftop bar is, I wouldn't recommend staying there, the music from the bar might be an issue...but I can't speak on that for certain). Though our roof was one floor beneath the rooftop bar, we were never disrupted by noise. Our room balcony had a view of the street below, and the room, though small, was adequate for two 20 something girls to fit in, and move about to get dressed. The bed was amazingly comfortable (a MUST after a long day of walking around Barca) and the decor was wonderfully modern and minimalistic, yet vibrant and warm. There were only two real negatives that we encountered. First, bathroom lighting was dim in general, but especially terrible when trying to apply make-up (an issue for young ladies ). Also, though the rooftop bar is really quaint and lovely, they served us our champagne (14 Euro’s a pop) in cheap PLASTIC flutes (really unacceptable considering Barcelona is known for its ‘cava’ [which I frankly didn’t care for]) and you would think they would take a little more pride in the presentation of the drink. Overall, Hotel Pulitzer met and exceeded my expectations. We did not dine in their restaurant, nor did we ever get a chance to have a drink at their lobby bar, but everything looked lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KNaughton
Reviews.Content: You can't get more central for Barcelona. Spitting distance to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas yet on a smaller side street off the Plaza that was quiet when you wanted it to be. Nicely decorated rooms, on the small side but that's par for European cities. Nice bath room, very clean, and friendly staff. Definitely recommended. This was our first stop on our honeymoon which I mentioned when booking and they suprised us with a bottle of Cava (Spanish sparkling wine) in our room the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: t-y-shirt
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in the heart of everything! It is the perfect location for first time visitors. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great desk staff”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, modern, firm mattress, in-room safe, refrig in room, good breakfast and good service. Desk staff we dealt with were excellent, as were their recommendations. Hotel is one block from Plaza Catalunya, Metro, 2 blocks from major department store. Grocery across the street. Many nearby restaurants. Bank and ATM next door. Coffee shop 1/2 block one way, Starbucks 1/2 block the other. Good 1-day dry cleaning, in as late as noon, back by 8. Staff directed us to an electronics store at the corner where we added some digital storage cards. We bought 10-trip Metro tickets and went everywhere that way, very fast and easy, less than a 2-minute wait for trains. When using credit cards, most places asked to see drivers license, so keep that handy. We took taxi from the airport, and had the hotel call a cab for return. It was waiting when we got downstairs. Around 40 Euro trip with bags to catch Saturday morning flight for two of us. Very much enjoyed everything Gaudi. Casa Batllo was within walking distance of the hotel, or two metro stops. Only disappointment in the trip was the Contemporary Art Museum, which had miniscule exhibits, and for very narrow art taste. Enjoyed all the tapas but did not find a great restaurant this visit. The people were so friendly and we enjoyed the city so much, we want to return. As usual, we found Paris great for art, but much too crowded, expensive and poor cafe food, a surprise. We enjoyed Barcelona more and Hotel Pulitizer is in a great location at Plaza Catalunya to explore.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: austin_TexasLkd
Reviews.Content: very nice,hip,and helpful staff,made great recommendations.loved the location in Plaza catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, trendy, chic, great location, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: The_Real_Mr_T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very pretty, modern, trendy and very quiet even though it was just off Placa Catalunya. Close to all sorts of shops, restaurants and transport. The rooms are quite small and narrow but very cozy, lovely comfortable bed. and with lovely well stocked bathrooms. The staff were very friendly and I would definitely go back here. The only thing stopping it getting 5 stars was the price, stayed there twice in 1 week and it was €171 and €225

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: nsrosie
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. It is on a relatively quiet side street right off of the main square which gives access to any type of transportation you might need. We walked right over from the airport shuttle and the hotel graciously let us check in early. It is also convenient to both the Ramblas and the Eixample area, which I greatly preferred to the Ramblas. The hotel is decorated in a very modern and simple way but it manages to be very warm. The lobby has several nice areas to sit and there is a bar that serves coffee and drinks. The staff was very helpful and the room nice and clean. The room had wood floors and a small flat screen TV. The rooftop was also another nice place to sit for a while. Breakfast was good. Guests were permitted to use the computers and the hotel right next door. This was not an inconvenience at all. Our last night in Barcelona we were at a different hotel and I was very sad to not be back at the Pulitzer. I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy with great location”
Reviews.Author: travelover063
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Pulitzer because of its great location right off the Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya. The hotel staff was very accomodating and helped with all our sightseeing queries. The rooms were small but quite modern with all the necessary amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanWife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 days at this lovely boutique hotel, and would not hesitate to recommend it to visitors to Barcelona. We plan on staying there again next year, without hesitation. The location is superb: close to the sights, the bus system and metro, restaurants, and shopping. You are in the Placa Catalunya in mere seconds after walking out the lobby door! This is the heart of the city. Staff is excellent! They are friendly and not stuffy, casual yet professional. Front desk staff are quite helpful, bar staff mix some great drinks in the lobby and at the gorgeous rooftop bar, restaurant servers are warm and welcoming. Everyone is of high caliber. The breakfast buffet is wonderful, and I regret that we did not get to enjoy dinner at the restaurant due to the many family gatherings we were invited to. The appetizers in the bar are excellent, though! Guest rooms are quite roomy and good size for European standards. All the amenities are there, including wireless internet. The bathrooms are large and well done. The closet is generous, there is great lighting and large windows for natural light. I can't wait to visit Barcelona again next year, and I know that we will enjoy The Pulitzer again. This is a gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: funfunfuntravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Interior is very chic and well done. The staff was VERY friendly and accomodating and helped us store our luggage when we checked in too early and let us store our luggage after we checked out. They let us check in about an hour early after our cruise let us out. The room is somewhat small but the bathroom is very nice. If you're not spending too much time in the room then it doesn't matter. Location was perfect with easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Anken_ak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just great. I may be considered a demanding traveller as comfort means a lot for me. Pulitzer is a fantastic choice: simply the best location in Barcelona (right on Placa Catalunya but facing a side street), very modern and stylish design, a fashionable terrace on its roof with live music and cocktails in the evening, nice breakfast, wi-fi Internet in rooms... They don't have their own fitness center in the hotel but they give you a voucher for a free visit to the nearby Holmes Fitness which may be rated as one of the best in the city - with a swimming pool, turkish bath, sauna, pilates and gym. I used the opportunity almost every day! So, to sum it all up, I'd like to thank the staff for their great service and fully recommend the place! I'll definitely come back and also plan to visit Pulitzer in Rome and Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool, great position...but”
Reviews.Author: JTravels075
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong this is a great hotel, however it is almost too cool. The bar down stairs is a fantastic, relaxed space wonderful for afternoon rests, has free wifi and drinks at reasonable prices. However the rooms are poky and hard to move around, when the cupboards are open you can not walk around the bed, plus when walking from one side of the room to the other past the bed, one needs to duck to miss the TV which is mounted on the wall. Apart from that the bed is ok but the pillows leave a lot to desire. The bathroom looks great as does the room, however due to the extreme amount of black used in the bathroom is is hard to see what you are doing and therefore hard for the cleaners to give the bathroom a real good clean, although the daily services are of a high standard. The reception staff are a mixed bag, some are fantastic however a few come across as extremely arrogant and make fun of the travellers ignorance on their surrounding. All in all this hotel looks great, tries hard and is in a fabulous position however is probably only good for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kimb27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Hotel Pulitzer in the heart of Barcelona. It was a wonderful ecperience from beginning to end! Out room weas standard, and just perfect for the little amount of time we spent in there! The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was very cool. Lobby was just gorgeous, we enjoyed having a drink in the afternoon, coffee after dinner, or just reading and relaxing. The staff was very helpful, the design elements very chic. And the price was extremely reasonable. Once you walk out the door, you turn right and head to the top of La Rambla. Tour buses can be picked up a block away. Everything is in walking distance, lots of fun and local color, great restaurants and shopping. Our 2 favorite things about theis hotel were the rooftop bar, Up. Just so beautuiful, we went up to read before it openend and back up to have a drink and catch the sunset. The hotel also has a relationship with the Holmes Gym/Spa. About a 5 minute walk and it is a huge, state of the art gym, spa, pool. Pilates, yoga, aerobics, all the equipment you could want, a little cafe and it's free for hotel guests! We worked off all the food and drink!! I would highly recommend this hotel and we will surely return and also try their hotels in Rome and Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb, great rooms, good value, CENTRAL!”
Reviews.Author: Cat_DocMelbourne
Reviews.Content: What a way to end our holiday in Spain. We arrived as La Mecre holiday celebrations were kicking off in the square next to the hotel. Our immediate concerns were the noise, but the rooms were perfectly quiet. Their appointment and attention to detail were spot on for the price. The little guide book was invaluable and a great touch. Barcelona is a vibrant and pulsating city, which the hotel truly represents. The roof top bar was a great way to end the day and get ready for a night of sensational food experience and Barcelona nightlife. We will be back to Pulitzer in Barcelona or their other around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay. It was perfect from the beginning, during our stay and even down to the time we checked out. Great staff, fabulous decor, smart design and comfort sums up our experience. We were there to celebrate my partner's 30th birthday and they were very gracious in hosting us. Our first night, they prepared a birthday message and a cake upon our arrival into the room. It wasn't her birthday yet. The night of her actual birthday, they repeated the gesture, which was more than welcomed as we enjoyed the cake from the previous night. We loved the room. Although it was narrow in design, everything was perfectly positioned to give the illusion of space and comfort. We didn't feel claustrophobic at all. The bathroom was even bigger than most other hotels in Spain. Our bed was a true king size bed, rather than being 2 single beds pushed together. Robes and slippers and great amenities gave us all the little things we needed to feel right at home. Even the free wifi was handy, as we used it quite often. There is even a turn-down service in the afternoon, which a lot of 4 star hotels don't do these days. So it was good that this hotel didn't skimp on detail. The hotel has a great terrace bar with friendly bar staff, so make sure you make a visit when there during the Summer. The location of the hotel is also ideal, being almost at the steps of Plaza Catalunya. You won't be disappointed with this true 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a short trip !”
Reviews.Author: Holmenkollen
Reviews.Content: Very central ,near to nearly everything ! Good helpfull staff near to parking garage, middle range price ,nice lounge and bar .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good facilities, excellent Mohitos!”
Reviews.Author: Hugh53
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Pulitzer after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. Room was clean and spacious and communal areas eg bar etc were welcoming. Quite a modern, stylish hotel- not one to chose if you like traditional style and furniture. Staff were professional and courteous and gave us some good recommenations for local restaurants. We didn't try the breakfasts at the Pulitzer as 15 Euros each seemed a bit expensive and instead went to Starbucks round the corner which is basic but fine. Rooftop bar is great. On Wednesday night they were offering all hotel guests 1 free Mohito. These were excelent and we had 3 more! LIvely crowd and great atmosphere-good even if you don't normally hang out all evening in bars (and I don't) All told, a nice hotel and a good place to stay for a first trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The pulitzer ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: AzzyJerseyCI
Reviews.Content: My sister in law booked this as a birthday present for me and we had a fabulous time. The hotel even made me a birthday cake complete with card ! The hotel's situation couldn't have been better as it is so central - about 5 minutes walk from La Rambla- and once you're back in your room you can't hear any noise, due to the sound proofing. In amongst the complimentary toiletries there's even a foot massage cream which is bliss when you've been walking around this beautiful city. The roof terrace bar is lovely place to chill out in the evening, again with friendly staff but it's closed on Monday which was a shame as we arrived Sunday and left Tuesday. We found an excellent tapas bar called Taller de Tapas which is next to the cathedral and well worth a visit again. All in all we had a great time and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona gem”
Reviews.Author: harryohk
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Pulitzer in early August 2009. We had done a lot of research before choosing the hotel, and were not disappointed. As others have mentioned, the hotel staff are very efficient and friendly, and we went through the check-in process in less than 5 minutes. Our room was long and narrow, and at first sight, looked small. However it proves to be a very well-designed space, which packs a lot into the space. Furnishings are excellent, the bed extremely comfortable, and we did not have any problems with street noise, despite being at the front of the hotel on a low floor. Free wi-fi was fast, and a nice touch. I HATE paying $30 per day for wi-fi - the Pulitzer takes a smart approach on this. Location is fantastic, just off the Plaza Catalunya, and as another reviewer has mentioned, there's a small grocer across the street which is great for bottled water & snacks. Small personal foible here, the most popular local sparkling water, Vichy Catalan is very salty to my taste. The store opposite sells Fontera which is not! Overall, we had a great experience at the Pulitzer, with great value for money, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and bar, rooms excellent”
Reviews.Author: classyluxury
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer with a friend, got an excellent rate. Room was modern, well air-conditioned, very clean. No noise from the bar as some have said - we asked to stay on the second floor just incase. Got free robes and slippers and nice his'n'hers toiletry pack, which were nice touches. It couldn't be better located, really central but no street noise. Staff are very helpful and friendly and speak good english. Rooftop bar is great for coktails before a night out. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again if I returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Take heed of comments, Hotel Pulitzer!!”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned28
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night stay at the Pulitzer. I have to say that I was a little apprehensive because reviews had been so mixed - and there were many that mentioned a noise problem. Because of this (I had already booked!) I emailed ahead and voiced my concerns about noise, and had a lovely polite email back saying that a quiet room would be assigned to us. We arrived at the hotel very early (10.30) and were allowed to check in, which I thought was very nice of them. Service was always very friendly but efficient. The hotel looked very smart and stylish, and this extended into the room that we had which was on the fifth floor. The room was very quiet (wait for it!) at that time, and throughout the day whenever we popped back. Bathroom was lovely but had a silly sliding door that kept coming off the hinges.
