We were brought champagne on arrival (I think that was a perk for booking through Mr and Mrs Smith) and were very pleased with all room amenities - comfy bed, good air con, bathrobes, slippers etc. The room was very narrow as others have mentioned, but I thought that this was actually quite cool! I could see how it would be possible to bang your head on the TV though...... Rooftop bar was lovely, drinks weren't too outrageously priced considering that it seemed to be a bit of a 'destination'. We didn't try any food so I can't comment on that. Everything was pretty much a pleasant surprise - so many city hotels are bland and run-of-the-mill. HOWEVER!! The noise problem in the mornings that has been mentioned in quite a few other reviews is so true!! The doors bang (this started at around 8am and we had gone to bed quite late) over and over again because people (I assume that they must be cleaning staff?) come in and out and instead of propping the door open, they just let it slam. I am assuming that it must have been staff because I could hear the same thing happening all the way down the corridor! And when two of them were chatting it was literally as though they were in the room. Usually this would drive me insane, but I was awake anyway and we wanted to get an early start, so it wasn't too bad. But if I had been in my usual morning mood or if it had been a romantic city break where we wanted to lounge around in the room then this would seriously have disappointed us. I found it slightly amusing because it was exactly how others had described it. And here is my point, hotel Pulitzer management: It is admirable that you read, and respond to, all of the comments posted on tripadvisor, but what is the point of thanking people for their feedback and saying that you will act on it if you then DON'T act on it? It is such a lovely hotel, and I cannot fault it except for that one thing! There must be something that you can do with the doors to stop them slamming, and tell the staff not to slam them in the first place! If you are lucky enough to have feedback, then I think you should act on it. It's a shame to have this problem when you have such great staff and such a stylish place. Even though the noise was only in the morning (soundproofing from road and bar noise was excellent!) it is still not really acceptable. Otherwise it's a brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value and central”
Reviews.Author: Weasel12
Reviews.Content: We have visited Barcelona a number of times before and stayed at the tope of the Paseo de Gracia area, so we were a little apprehensive about moving 'south'. We needn't have worried, as the hotel was really central, yet quiet and atmospheric. We loved the chic/ethnic decor both in the room and in the public areas. We arrived on a Monday, so the rooftop terrace was closed but we enjoyed a cocktail ther later in the week. It's a shame you can't get a drink there during the day- perhaps a phone to the main bar could be provided so that you could get service on request? We took the bus from the airport which couldn't be more handy, stopping in the Plaza de Catalunya round the corner. We will be recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: dingdongyvonne
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at the hotel. From arriving to leaving the entire hotel staff couldn't do enough for you.The location was excellent,about a minute from Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya! The bedrooms were lovely,a large double bed, balcony and lots of thoughtful touches! The reception staff recommended three evenings entertainment/restaurants and each evening was lovely. In a large city we could have easily have had a bad experience and when I asked about a restaurant I had been recommended the receptionist was not happy about us going and said it was for 'tourists'!! We did not eat in the hotel as the restaurant was closed on 2 of the evenings due to a Bank Holiday and closed on a Sunday.We ate breakfast elsewhere as preferred only a small amount first thing and didn't think it worthwhile spending 15euros each for tea and toast! Parking was very convenient although if on a city break would be unnecesary as it cost 25euros per 24hr period, this was discounted from the usual price of 42euros!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FFsFromNY
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I are on vacation in Barcelona. We are staying in a hotel next door to Hotel Pulitzer (which is quite central to everything it seems) and so cannot review the hotel itself. However, coming back from a walk in the evening, we decided to drop by the restaurant in the Hotel, called Visit, i think. We were greeted by a very unfriendly waiter, Simone, who was not sure if we could sit and order just dessert and drinks. He had us waiting for his decision for a while all through making facial expressions. Not sure what it was about us that made him cringe so much, but it was the rudest i have been treated in all my trips abroad and FAR worse than anything I have encountered in the most exquisite restaurants in my home town in New York. When he finally decided we are "welcome", the sarcasm continued and really set an unpleasant tone for an otherwise fun evening. As I said, cannot judge hotel, but service in restaurant was definitely sub par.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kittik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location just off of Plaza Catalunya, so it is central to Las Ramblas and Eixample and close to the Metro. The side street is still busy, but the windows had great sound proofing. There is also a little grocery across the street, which is great for picking up snacks for the room. Another reviewer mentioned the noise on the 5th floor from the rooftop bar, but we never heard anything. I think, though, that it closes at midnight. We were told the 5th is the only smoking floor. The hotel, room and bathroom were all modern and very attractive. The bed and bathroom (shower only), furnishings and linens, all lived up to a very nice 4 star hotel, which we got for a good price with early booking for high season in Barcelona. We requested, and were given, early check-in. The wi-fi worked just fine for us in the room. There is no transport to or from the airport through the hotel but the Aerobus is across the Plaza and is 5 Euros per person. We were told a taxi would be 30 Euros. Be sure you check that you are taking the correct Aerobus for your terminal--we didn’t and had to transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, but I was a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Quovadis09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights. I had great expectations of Pulitzer after reading about it on several websites, through social networking sites, as well as personal recommendations. However, I was a bit disappointed for several reasons. (1) I was assigned what may have been the most run down room in the hotel. It was alright, except every socket in the wall was loose, the paint and wood were chipping off places, there were stains on the panel above the bed, and the window in the bathroom (which did not have an exhaust fan to my knowledge) was coming off one of its hinges. This seemed to have later been fixed. (2) The wireless internet had a very weak signal in my room. The technician did come in and give me an ethernet cable which I used. But it is incorrect to say there is functioning wireless in every room. (3) I asked reception for an iron and board: they said they did not provide that service and I would have to give my shirts to laundry for pressing which ended up going on my bill. That's fine, but the next day I saw one of the staff taking an ironing board and iron back downstairs from what must have been one of the rooms. I decided not to raise the issue. I think they were short staffed this week. The receptionist came to collect my laundry, the bar-manager to deliver the food . This really wasn't a problem though because it did not affect service delivery . You may ask why I recommend the hotel. (1) Well, it has an outstanding location just off Catalunya. (2) There is something charming about the hotel; it's small size makes you feel at home (3) The room, sheets and premises, lobby, etc, are all very clean and well kept and the lobby and lounge area is tastefully done. I did not visit the restaurant. I think Pulitzer Barcelona has great potential. In fact I think I may have just got a bad room . it's great value for money, and I would probably stay there and hope I have a different room and better internet and other services.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and great rates”
Reviews.Author: loveluxury1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Pulitzer, booked through easytobook and got a great rate. The hotel is situated off placa catalunya and two minutes walk from the start of La Rambla. You cannot get a better central location in Barcelona. Hotel is 4 star and the reception, restaurant and rooftop bar are all pleasant areas. The room we had was spacious enough, if a little narrow but the beds were comfortable and quiet. The staff were excellent and always eager to help... especially the nightshift front desk chap who helped us out late Saturday night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool design and roof bar, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: trueblueUSA
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, esp the roof top bar, the interior modern design and a great continental breakfast. Close to the center of the action and well managed. Expensive, but worth paying for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cafeturco
Reviews.Content: Location is outstanding, amazingly quiet, friendly staff, super rooms, well-designed common areas. Rates are very reasonable. There is a public garage with hotel-discounted rates right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clovejoy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer was great. The rooms were simple and clean and it had a great location. The hotel has a rooftop bar which looks really cool, but is very loud. We were given a 5th floor room (bar is on the 6th) and it was way to loud. We requested a room change and the hotel staff was great and happily changed us to a room on the 3rd floor where you couldn't hear the bar at all. I would defentily recommend this hotel, just don't stay on the top floor is you want a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kmnm
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Attentive and personal service. Gave excellent restaurant recommendations! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Hotel was just like pictured on Tripadvisor. Food at Visit was delicious! Outside bar on 6th floor was great! Overall a wonderful time! Special thanks to Amanda and Augustine for all your help and recommendations! We will be back! Loved Barcelona!!! I do have to agree with the door slamming comments though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, cleanliness, service”
Reviews.Author: cpan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect -- it is right across the street from the entrance to the metro/rail station at Placa Catalunya, so it was easy to get to and from the airport via the Renfe (train), and to get places on the metro. If you didn't want to use that, you could just walk everywhere, too -- this is right at Placa Catalunya, the northern end of Las Ramblas (very busy, lots of vendors, the marketplace, shops, restaurants, mimes, tourists). Nearby, La Boqueria, lots of little narrow streets with shops, and in walking distance north are Casa Battlo and La Pedrera (Gaudi creations), which I wandered to at night to get some neat lit-up night shots (lots of people out at the cafes, felt safe on my own even at 2am). The staff was fabulous, spoke several languages (including English of course), could point me in the direction of whatever I wanted, including a neat little shop in La Boqueria that made Spanish shawls (my mother wanted one -- a "manton"). The room was wonderful, clean, comfortable, and they made up the room so well, neatly cleaning and even lining up on a towel all my toiletries that I had strewn about the sink counter. It's also one of the biggest rooms I've had in a hotel in Europe, comfortable and quiet as well as pleasing to the eye. I love the style/look of the room and hotel, the robes, the slippers in the bathroom, even the Woman/Man boxes in the bathroom providing you with shower cap, toothbrush, foot massage cream, shaving cream and razor, etc. Wonderful room to have at the end of a tiring day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - this was the first of 3 stays there now.”
Reviews.Author: CS01
Reviews.Content: I just realized I had never reviewed this hotel. So, I'm going to back track a little. This was our first stay, Sept of '07. It was our first time to Barcelona. And, this ended up being the first of what will now be 3 stays, on 3 successive trips, at the Hotel Pulitzer; it's that good. On this particular trip, our first, we arrived after flying overnight from New York City. We arrived at about 9 in the morning. To our surprise, since our room was ready, they went ahead and let us check in, a testament to their service. This was genius b/c my wife and I were able to catch a quick nap, take showers, and feel rested/revitalized to head out around noon. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant the next day. Really good. But, I must admit, we then shifted gears and had OJ and cafe con leche each morning at Cafe Zurich which is right around the corner from Pulitzer. We ended each night by having a cocktail or two on the rooftop bar, which is amazing. The location of the Pulitzer couldn't be any better. The moment you walk out the door, you're right at Placa de Catalunya, which puts you right in the middle of walking Passeig de Gracia, or heading towards the water down the famed La Rambla. Amazing hotel. So much so that our 3rd trip to Barcelona is coming up in just over a month, and it will be our 3rd stay at Hotel Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort, great bar and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: SarahParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Pulitzer. It is perfectly located near the top of La Rambla where you have quick access to buses, the Metro, shopping and the market. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. We really enjoyed the bar and the terrace on the 6th floor. Excellent drinks and good service. Breakfast offers a good selection of quality breads, croissants, meats, fruit and cheeses. The hotel is very quiet except the doors seem to slam really loudly. We were really pleased with this hotel and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant - I have found a place to return to”
Reviews.Author: chiaia85
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend Hotel Pulitzer; for me, it was love at first sight since the moment I entered the lobby. What I liked most was the contemporary and stylish décor, the inviting lounge, and the stylish simplicity of the room. The dark stone of the bathroom was stunning! The personnel was kind and helpful, the room was small but very nice, and I didn't miss anything. the central location of the hotel makes it an excellent choice both for tourism and business trips. The only two negative points in my opinion were a) the freezing temperature in the lobby: it was like going into a refrigerator, but luckily it was possible to regulate the room temperature, and b) breakfast price too high for what was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandTiggy
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at The Pulitzer. The location was great, off Playa Catalunya and close to the metro. We did not experience any noise at all, it was so quiet that you'd think the hotel was empty!. The staff were all friendly, pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. This may be due in part to the manager who was extremely helpful and understanding even prior to our arrival when our booking agent went bankrupt at short notice. This level of customer care should be aspired to by all hotels! The hotel was very clean and the room size was adequate. The air conditioning was quiet and easily regulated and the rooms have a free valuables safe. The Pulitzer also has a sister hotel nearby which is worth considering, they share the same manger. Definately a hotel to be recommended!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: k_p_ontheroad
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Pulitzer hotel was absolutely perfect. We spend 4 days in Barcelona in the hotel and enjoyed every minute. The location was excellent, the room was very nice and dining area too. in the evening we enjoying the roof terrace (very strong cocktails;-). The front desk staff and the wait staff were extremely helpful.i would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “The Purr-fect choice for us”
Reviews.Author: AylithUK
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying before we even arrived Patricia was very helpful when I requested that she book some restaurants for us and this was done very promptly. Great Service in my view and was delighted when she confirmed all my bookings and give us an appointment card for 1 of them. We got the bus from the airport and the hotel itself is across the Place de Catalunya (look for the big Habit store and it down that street) Check in was painless and the hotel room we were given was on the 4th floor at the back. The room wasn't as 'small' as people make out but then again if you stayed in a Las Vegas room it might appear that way but for Europe it's a good size. The room was lovely and the bed wonderful but I can understand some people not liking it if they are used to ultra soft beds. The main bar and roof top bar were a pleasure to sit in and have a few drinks. The bar staff were nice and very friendly and knew how to pour drinks if you understand me. My only 2 little niggles were A, the rooms are quite noise at night if your a light sleeper due to everything being wood so if you have noisy neigbours you've had it. B, no english TV channels apart from SKY NEWS. I'd return here without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but some noise issues”
Reviews.Author: texgirl4103
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location, just steps from the Catalunya Metro stop. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and our room was in the back of the hotel which is very quiet...with one exception. The hotel housekeeping staff are door slammers so don't even try to sleep in the morning. They start at about 8 a.m. and it's nonstop door slamming all morning. We even alerted the front desk with no remedy of the noise during our stay. In fact, everyone in the hotel slam the doors, all day and all hours of the night. This could be remedied by the hotel if they'd install catches on the doors to prevent this. I can honestly say that this is a near perfect hotel with this exception.

Reviews.Title: “A cool oasis in a beautiful city, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: gothicwanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very sophisticated, chic and comfortable. We had no complaints. It was very hot weather during our stay, but it was always cool and relaxing inside our room, which was also quiet. I loved the decor. Dark wood with contemporary art. The bar, restaurant and lounge area are lovely. The desk staff very helpful with suggestions for restaurants. The location is ideal, we walked to nearly every site. The metro is close at hand for more distant sites. I loved my visit to Barcelona, and will be back. I will definitely stay here again. My only wish is that there was a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Valleygirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer before and it was nice that the receptionist commented on that when I checked in. It is a nice clean hotel, very close to the Placa Catalunya and handy for nipping back to cool off during the day! The staff were all very friendly and helpful except for when we asked for a recommendation for a chinese restaurant - we were told that there weren't any good ones and were we sure that was what we wanted - well, yes we were, and we managed to find an excellent restaurant on our own. Only a minor quibble though and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hotel Pulitzer again, or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mafresch
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Pulitzer. The front desk staff was outstanding and very helpful. Our breakfast was delicious and the atmosphere was very relaxing. The room was trendy and very clean. We also had an issue with the noise - not from the street but from the interior of the hotel. We could hear footsteps on the hardwood floors all night and what sounded like dishes clanking... we also had a room with a decorative balcony. Unfortunately, the balcony had a small spotlight which up-lit the front of the building. Closing the room darkening drapery helped a lot but there was always a "glow' in the room..no need for a nighlight. We had champagne in a bucket but did not get a chance to drink it the first night we were there. The ice bucket was not filled the next day so we had a bucket of warm water with a bottle of champagne in it .. which we left for housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in a perfect city...almost perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JSKChandler_AZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pulitzer for 5 days during the beginning of June 2009. The hotel is very easy to find, down a small side street right off of Placa Catalunya. This location is perfect and is in close proximity to the Aerobus stop, the metro, Las Ramblas and was within walking distance to Barcelona's main attractions. The hotel is clean, modern and comfortable. The lobby and lounge were very welcoming. Our room was spacious and clean and the bathroom was incredible. We ate dinner at the restaurant one evening. Great food, great prices and even better service. We had a drink on the terrace each night. You could not ask for a more relaxing atmosphere and spectacular view. The staff at the hotel were friendly and quite helpful. The only slight drawback to the hotel was the moderate noise. While we heard no street noise we were right off the lobby and over the restaurant. This made for a bit of a noisy experience. Despite this small problem, we would definitely say at Hotel Pulitzer again! Barcelona is a perfect city! Wonderful scenery, amazing architecture, pretty parks, and tasty restaurants! If you are a looking for a day trip out of Barcelona you must visit Montserrat! It is an easy trip and absolutely breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay , Amazing Stuff”
Reviews.Author: DvirIsrael
Reviews.Content: We have travel to barcelona from 14-18/06 , me my wife and another couple. We found this hotel via trip adviosr and found that it was the right choice for us. The hotel location is not so great , its just PEFECT !! 1 Min from Catalonia square , near Metro , bus turistic and all the other barcelona trasportation. The room is very nice , not so small as other describe here and was just perfect for our needs.The bathroom and all other accessories (Safe,TV,Minibar) was very accessible and easy to use. The staff : Well , we've being all over europe and I have to say that the Staff was G-R-E-A-T and very assistant in any problem , question we had. I would like to thanks all the staff (Amada , Sergio (I think that was his name) and espically Raju (Again ... not surelly this the right spelling) about taking me by hand out side the hotel to show me where i can find the police dep. About the noise : There is no noise from the street (and I'm talking from both point of view : room 202 (ours) - located to front , and room 214 (our freinds) located to the back). Finally, Surelly can recommend this hotel. Dvir Cohen Israel c-keren@013.net.il

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely ambiance, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week. The hotel is located near the busy Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, yet is tucked away on a side street away from the noise. The hotel is easy walking distance from many of the major sites. Our room was small, but clean and attractive. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom roomy. We appreciated the free WiFi. The staff members were helpful. We had dinner one night in the hotel restaurant, drinks in the lounge, and drinks up on the lovely rooftop deck. Service was helpful and friendly (unlike the snarly service we encountered at several Barcelona restaurants). We got a great room rate that included the daily breakfast through hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Just Off Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: gjb6774
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Terrific, modern decor throughout the hotel. The room was a decent size and we actually had a small balcony. The staff was amazing and couldn't be more helpful. We had drinks on the rooftop just about every night. It was a very intimate, cozy setting with some great views. We were there when Barcelona beat Manchester United....what a scene in the Plaza Catalunya. Just far enough off Las Ramblas to avoid the huge crowds and noise but virtually just around the corner. A definte "stay again"!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: JimArkansas
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Super clean with great maid service. The bathroom was huge by European city hotel standards, the room size was typical, but nicely appointed and comfortable. Great shower. The staff was really nice and fluent in English. The best thing is the location. It is on a short quiet street but right next to everything. The Rambla, the subways, the old gothic parts of town... they were all right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Service-so disappointed”
Reviews.Author: love2travel3400
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently staying here (Rm 413)- the hotel is great in terms of location, style, cleanliness. But...we are so incredibly disappointed on two fronts. One- it is our tenth anniversary and we travelled here from Canada- we have only today left so it is a very special stop on our anniversary trip. I had requested that they try to do something to help make our anniversary more specila- supposed to be a surprise for hubby- absolutley nothing. And while I can get over that, what I am truly disappointed in is the lack of front desk service. They are not at all helpful. And as new to Barcelona, we expected and need their help.

Reviews.Title: “great location, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: thealiceline
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Barcelona, we were quite overwhelmed in deciding where to stay (Eixample, El Born, Las Ramblas, etc). We are happy to report we were thrilled with our choice. After getting lost several times trying to find our hotel in Madrid, this was a welcome change. I believe the Pulitzer (around the corner from Habitat and FNAC in Plaza Catalunya) is considered to be on the edge of Eixample. The location was perfect for us to visit Casa Batllo, Casa Mila, and also Las Ramblas and the Boqueria (all 10-15 min walks depending on how fast you walk). It was also very convenient for the restaurants we dined: 10-15 min walks to Cinc Sentits, Paco Meralgo, Cerveseria Catalunya, Boqueria; metro for Senyor Paradella and Cal Pep. The hotel itself has a modern interior style and our room was very clean, sleek and comfortable. I also liked the fact that we had a real queen bed and not two doubles next to each other. Lastly, the staff were always helpful in helping us find our way. Amanda was especially great. We definitely plan on returning to Barcelona and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Location, Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: ariete415
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night after a tour we were on. We paid 120 Euros and 20 Euros extra for the romantic package which was a bottle of Cava and breakfast for two in room. The hotel was right off Placa Catalunya and it was literally near everything. Metros, Las Ramblas, restaurants, shopping, beach. We picked this hotel because of the reviews and location and I'm so glad we did. When we arrived, I had used the ATM right next to the hotel and it didn't give me any money so I tried again and it said I used my maximum allowance. I checked my account online and saw that the money had been taken out of my account already. So we went into the bank to talk to someone and not one person spoke English which we found a little odd since every other country we were in, at least one person spoke a little. I went into the hotel and asked the girl at the front desk (Amanda) for some help. I was thinking maybe she could write something out for me to bring to the teller. She went above and beyond. She came with me into the bank to translate. One of the guys told her that it would take a half hour to come back into my account. So after an hour I went back to Amanda and said it's been an hour and still the money isn't back into my account. I told her that it wasn't a big deal if it took a few days, I just wanted to make sure I eventually got the money back. So she went back to the bank with me and we spoke to a manager who said that she would check the ATM at 2pm when the bank closes and to come back and she'll let us know what happened. My boyfriend and I wanted to do some sightseeing so we said we would be back around 2pm. When we got back, Amanda had gone to the bank for us and got all the information from the manager. She was amazing. I was told that in Europe, you shouldn't expect as high of level customer service as in the states but I don't think any person in the states would've done the same. As for the room, it was small but modern. Definitely the nicest place we had stayed our whole trip. The bathroom was bigger than other places too. The bed was comfortable. The air conditioning was great. They knew we were leaving for the airport the next morning so before I had a chance to ask, they asked me what time I wanted a wake up call and if I needed a taxi to be there. Room service started at 8am and we planned on leaving around 8-8:30 so we went down to the restaurant for breakfast instead. The most delicious breakfast too. Every other hotel offered croissants, maybe some cold cuts, bread and coffee. This place had bacon, eggs, croissants, breads, jams, delicious coffee, fresh juices, fresh fruit. I had a little bit of everything and was so full!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This time great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Naskali
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Pulitzer and now I really had excellent service. There is not much to add for almost everyone who is reviewing this hotel. Interior of the hotel is great and so is the location, right next to Plaza de Catalunya. One of the greatest things of the hotel is the large roof terrace! It is such a nice place to get out of the hassle of the streets. I surely can recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClareCollins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May after reading excellent reviews on trip advisor. The room was pretty much as I expected - not massive but very clean and furnished to a high standard, with a lovely bathroom. The breakfast was great and so was the location (only 3 mins walk to La Rambla). The only negatives were that we could hear the TV from the room next door and people walking about (the wooden floors probably don't help!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent design, uncomfortable furniture”
Reviews.Author: vagabondwoman
Reviews.Content: This is a really good location to me to see Barcelona. I was able to stop back at the room during the day and head right back to see more of this fun, beautiful city. I really liked the layout of the room. It was small, but well thought out, was able to unpack fully. But, as much as I liked the design, after 5 days, the bed and pillows left a lot to be desired. The lobby is similar. Striking, but uncomfortable. I would have enjoyed lingering downstairs more, have more than one glass of wine, my back could not take any more. I'm not that old, but I did feel it by the end of this week. With a bed cushion, and some comfy pillows, I would be singing it's praises. I did order room service, which was fine, but after they left, I realized they had forgotten my drink. Had a terrific dinner on my last evening in the restaurant, and a lovely breakfast my last morning. Internet was free and very good.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ALNJEAN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pulitzer for a week this month and found it to be an outstanding place to stay while in Barcelona. The service was fantastic. The location was excellent and all sites could be reached by walking (Ramba, Gothic, Old City, Port etc) and the rest by metro, bus and/or suburban railroad. The front desk was great. The hotel is all that is stated for it in the press. Quiet, clean, comfortable and friendly. Barcelona is a beautiful city and is well worth seeing multiple times. We certainly will stay here again and we recommend it unequivovally. Mr. and Mrs. Albert Cevasco New Jersey,USA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJS2005
Reviews.Content: Can't praise this hotel enough. Staff were friendly and professional. Rooms clean and beds very comfortable. Bar very comfortable and relaxing. The hotel was ideally centrally placed for exploring the city either on foot or by tourist bus. The Pulitzer is one of the best European hotels we have stayed in. The one problem we had, was (as a previous post mentioned) our room was situated on the second floor above the bar and early morning and late evening the sound of bar work could be heard in the room. However this is only a minor gripe as a good pair of earplugs drowned out the noise. Would highly recommend and wouldn't hesistate to return if in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: nikkitta21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night after coming back from a cruise, and if we were ever to spend more time in Barcelona, we would definitely come back to this hotel. The location is great, just off a side street of the Plaza Catalunya, the main plaza of the city and at the top of Las Ramblas. The noise level from the streets was not too bad. The room itself was very spacious and clean and attractively decorated. The bathroom was big. We stayed in their "standard room" and were pleasantly surprised at how big it was for European standards. The front desk staff is very pleasant, helpful, and can speak English very well. The lobby is pretty neat and they have a glass elevator that takes you up to you rooms. Everything seemed clean and well maintained. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALP1021
Reviews.Content: Great location--just off the Pla. Catalunya. Beautiful decor--modern, yet elegant. The room and the bathroom were spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. The staff was very polite and helpful. Even though it is right in the the hub of the city, the room was very quiet (we had a window facing the street). There is a business center in the hotel next door if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treats”
Reviews.Author: Tonto itha
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Hotel because it was so handy for Las Ramblas but on Saturday night when FC Barcelona beat Madrid 6 - 2 it was very noisy too. The rooms were very trendy and well appointed but on the small side. The bar was lovely and the food hot and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “April 2009 visit”
Reviews.Author: maddyChicago
Reviews.Content: We had requested a few things from the hotel in advance of our stay because my husband and I are light sleepers. After travelling for 15 hours, our room was perfect and ready (even though it was in the morning). We got exactly what we asked for, which was so important and very appreciated because we slept for about 6 hours straight after our arrival. Pluses: Location on quiet street. Only half a block from the touristy area. It was convenient for sightseeing and grabbing the Touristica hop on/hop off. The front desk has discounted tickets. Make sure you ask them about it. The front desk and porters were quite nice and seemed sincere. We also got a great recommendation from the staff for the same tapas restaurant already mentioned, Ciudad Condal. Crowd there was friendly, they had a menu in English and there were a lot of locals there. Best meal we had in 16 days of travelling. As already reported, the rooms are small..... but the bathrooms are suprisingly large and luxurious. My only criticism is that the furniture is showing some wear and tear.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: PattyandPhil
Reviews.Content: Convenient to everything! Guillermo and Marcos were especially friendly and helpful-- appreciated since we had only had a few words and relied upon them to speak English. On the last day we were there, we discovered the top flour outdoor lounge--do not miss it if you are there during fair weather. The hotel could add a few small amenities, such as electrical adapters and hair conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FKY
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location with only less than 5 mins walk from La Rambla and Passeig de Gràcia and very close to metro, bus and aerobus!! The wonderful staff and nice decor are impressrive too!! Most of the staff are friendly and helpful, and a bartender there recommended us to try his favourite tapas bar Ciudad Condal which I think is a local hangout place serving very tasty tapas, I love it so much!!!! I'd love to stay there again and would definately recommend this hotel to my fds!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Gurney1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights shortly after easter. Found the hotel to be exactly what I expected after ready numerous glowing reports on here prior to going (if Im being honest the reviews on here and the location were the main reasons I chose the Pulitzer). The Location is great, right at the top of La Rambla and just by the Placa De Catalunya, really close to the metro and renfe stations. I found the room of good size, very clean with everything you should need (including safe which you dont always find). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was excellent, loved the granite basin :) Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definately stay again without hesitation, hopefully the Pound would have recovered against the Euro by then and I will be even happier.

Reviews.Title: “we loved Barca and the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: jeffinbloomington
Reviews.Content: we stayed 7, yes, seven nights here from March 28 to April 5. We reserved three rooms since we had 5 in our group and were visiting my daughter who was studying in the city for the semester. The rooms were very clean, the beds comfortable, and the location fabulous. We spent a lot of time in the lounge/bar/waiting room. The help was top drawer. We are wine lovers. Spain is the biggest producer in Europe, so we wanted something close to Sauvignon Blanc or Fume Blanc or Chenin Blanc for our drinks. The Rudejo at the bar was perfect. We had drinks many nights, ordered off the light menu after a soccer game and spent time writing postcards and enjoying the wines during the week which added to the relaxing atmosphere in this hotel. The service was great. We had Germans, Austrians, English, and we Americans at the hotel and the service was impecciile. The location is perfect. You are at the cross roads of the Ramblas and the Gracias to the north. The large department store which has foodstuffs is five miniutes away and worth a trek (like Harrods). We never took a taxi as my daughter who was living in the city knew all the metro lines by memory. We always felt safe and we never had to wait more than three minutes for a train. The market off the Ramblas is worth a long stay. The Olymplic Park in the distance of the City is a fun day trip. Walking the beach on the Mediterraneon is a great time, too. We spent a lot of time in the Gothic Quarter and enjoyed the shops and restaurants there. Below, I will list some great food places. Suffice it to say, the Pulitzer is a great location. The Bar/Lounge/Reading area is perfect. We looked at more expensive places and could have stayed elsewhere. I'd return here in a flash. Eat dinner at Agut in Barri Gotic...our favorite. Local specialties and the best olives we've ever tasted. Casa Calvet for a fine and unique dining experience. For lunch, try Ciudad Condal only a block from the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent upscale hotel in the city center.”
Reviews.Author: Trailman
Reviews.Content: Located right at the Placa de Catalunya at the head of The Ramblas on a quiet side street. Accessible by taxi/car which matters as some hotels in the tourist area in the old sections are not. Nice lobby bar and upscale seating area to read etc. Wi-Fi throughout the hotel that is free, works well and no connection hassles. Rooms and all spaces are new er modern decor and well kept. Bathroom was very clean; hot water is very hot; shower worked great. Heat and AC both worked fine. Remember, no tipping expected or needed in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ddh76
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with my wife and absolutely loved it. Location is great as it is situated right at the top of Las Ramblas (heading South) but also a 10-15 minute walk to Gaudi's Casas also (heading North). Hotel is very clean, staff are attentive when required to be and nothing is too much trouble. Taxi ride from airport is about 20-25 Euros depending on traffic/time etc. Rooms are a little small but they are designed well and there is enough space for 2!! Shower was really powerful and I particularly liked the electric blinds (!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EBHLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from four nights at Hotel Pulitzer and can honestly say it was a wonderful stay. The hotel was fantastic - whilst it feels stylish and boutique, it doesn't have an ounce of pretention and the friendly and relaxed staff make you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. The location is a minute's walk from Les Rambles, so it's in a great spot for getting around too. The rooms, albeit not overly large, are lovely - very clean, welcoming with great little gadgets and finishing touches. The bar and restaurant are great with good service, choice and ingredients. Sip a Mojito in the bar if you get the chance... the best I've ever tasted and made with seriously decent rum! One word on the roof bar, this doesn't open until the end of May which we weren't aware of. Not a major problem, but a 'good to know before you go'. We couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough to couples who want to get away for a romantic break for a few days to this great city. Already planning another trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: Keentravelplanner
Reviews.Content: Booked this after checking out reviews on Tripadvisor, because I was impressed by the hotel's follow-up/responses to reviews - negative and positive - and because it's just been added to the Mr and Mrs Smith portfolio, so we could use our vouchers, received as Wedding gifts, for our 1st anniversary trip to Barca. Had great service even before arriving, as the Manager responded to various email requests, even though we hadn't booked directly with the hotel. We had brilliant service whilst there from every member of staff - from the bar staff, who delivered complementary Cava as a lovely surprise, to the reception desk staff, who booked taxis for us and chatted to us about our dining plans, confirming that yes, we had made good choices - and should stick with the anniversary dinner plan for Arola, despite the reservation being for 10.30pm (stupid o'clock for a Brit, dead normal for a Spaniard). The location is just about perfect - turn right at Placa Catalunya for the Ramblas, Gothic quarter and the beaches, turn left for Eixample and the Gaudi Trail, head next door for Starbucks if you need a proper cuppa (which sadly you sometimes do and it's great to be able to pop out 1st thing and pick one up to enjoy whilst you're getting ready for the day) - then cross over into the Raval for Modern art and funky cafes. The room was a superior and was very comfortable, though a little odd in shape (a long thin rectangle), as the bed was huge, with a great mattress, and the A/C very easy to control. Had no problem with the lighting in terms of flattery but found it a bit hard to work out in terms of functionality! The bathroom was a homage to dark marble, in the Spanish style - which I like. The shower was great. We were at the front, with a small balcony, and, whilst there was a bit of street noise, the double glazing was super-efficient and I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet a location this was, for such a central place (and considering I don't generally expect a peaceful night's rest in a Spanish city!) The bar is a really lovely place to sit before or after dinner (we didn't eat in the hotel at all so can't comment on that), with large white leather sofas and big scented candles. We had a wonderful stay, partly down to the weather (glorious), the food and wine (highly recommend Tapac24, about 10 minutes stroll away) and the fun of Barca itself - but definitely helped by our stay here. We'd stay here again - and it's very good value too, for a central 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, almost nothing to complain”
Reviews.Author: IntlManOfMystery
Reviews.Content: Choosed the hotel after reading Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. Only thing to complain was the noise from corridor, doors were not so thick and/or soundproofed. Breakfast was good, I have had better hotel breakfasts but also way worse. Other than that I would absolutely recommend to everyone going to Barcelona - I would go here again without any hesitation. As others have said, the location is superb. There are many multinational restaurant chains (Hard Rock Cafe, Starbucks, Burger King, McDonalds) located very close to the hotel for those who want to visit them. Aerobus to the airport leaves just from the other side of the square - couldn't be any easier.

Reviews.Title: “Winter breakaway to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Bislett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer 4 nights (Monday-Friday). We arrived at Barcelona airport (BCN) and jumped on the airport exress bus to the city center. Final stop was Plaza Catalunya and the hotel is located a 3 minute walk from the bus stop. This was very convenient. Despite computer "crash" at the reception when we arrived, they still managed to provide us with our room within minutes. The staff was generally very nice and helpful. The room was not large, but was practical and well equipped. Minibar was good and very nice complementary robes, slippers and toiletry for him and her (see picture). The toiletries were supplemented every day, we liked that! The lobby bar lounge was cosy and nice, with many lounge groups. Both hotel guests and locals frequented the lounge. We enjoyed very good drink appetisers there. Hotel breakfast was good with a variety of food to choose from. WiFi wireless connection is free, but the signal was quite weak in our room The hotel was perfectly located next to Plaza Catalunya and the top of La Rambla. It was also walking distance to Passeig de Gracia with its modernista feeling and style. The Gothic quarters and El Raval was also within a short walking distance. We were very satisfied with the hotel and our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer was a dream”
Reviews.Author: AZtraveladvisor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for 4 fabulous nights, and by the end of our stay, we wish it had been longer!! The hotel was clean, crisp and modern. The location could not have been more ideal. It is just a hop to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, but tucked away on a quite street where the busy tourist hustling and bustling seems miles away. Our room was amazing and superbly comfortable. I could have stayed in that bed all day if Gaudi and paella had not been calling to me! We would definitely stay at the Pulitzer again and would happily recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shiulee
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location..Just off La Rambla. Staff is very courteous and breakfast was great as well! I took it with the room, so got it for Euro 10, good value for a hearty breakfast. The reception area and room, do show signs of wear and tear..And lighting is strange at places, very dim!Sister hotel Regina next door has a beautiful lobby, one can access internet for free out there.. If possible, try not to take the room facing the main street, as it gets noisy at night

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer should win the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: scott6459
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Everything. Rooms, service, decor, location - can't beat it. Very close to La Ramblas and Barri Gotic area, as well as being close to Gracia Street (main street that runs through the 'newer' sections of Barcelona. The sister hotel, Regina, is next door. I went to see the lobby. Also very nice! (Did not see room in that hotel). Starbucks on the corner, if that is important to anyone. I also checked out the lobby and rooms at the Majestic Hotel, and I liked the Pulitzer much more. If I return to Barcelona, I would stay again at the Pulitzer, or, I might try the Catedral Hotel in the Barri Gotic. (I went to check out the lobby there, and location, and it is very nice - modern (in a good way) like the Pulitzer. My room at Pulitzer was 140 euros a night. Standard room, which was big enough, esp. compared to similarly priced rooms in Paris. The room had a sitting area, nice sized closet, also a desk/chest, and a large bathroom with nice sized tub/shower. It really made my trip extra special to come back to such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- highly suggested”
Reviews.Author: gugli
Reviews.Content: I've loved this hotel, great service, very good design and furniture, reasonable price, good location, it's strongly suggested

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool and Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer on my way back to the U.S. from a cruise. The Pulitzer is very centrally located on a side street off of the Plaza Catelunya in Barcelona. My friend arrived first thing in the morning (~6:00 a.m.) but the hotel was completely booked the night before, so we couldn't check in until around noon. Although they couldn't accomodate us, the staff was very pleasant and spoke English very well. The hotel itself is very stunning with chic, modern decor. The suites were spacious, the bathrooms luxurious, and the beds were super comfortable. We requested a suite facing the street, which have balconies. The street is a little noisy, but not so noisy that it kept us up. The location is obviously very central to the heart of the city, the Plaza Catelunya, and is optimal for shopping or touring. I would (and have already) highly recommend the hotel to friends travelling to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie063
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona with my teenage daughter for a short break of 5 days. The Hotel Pulitzer is in a wonderful location - across the square (Plaza Catalunya)opposite the bus stop from and to the airport (so don't bother wasting money on a taxi!). Look for Habitat and fnac on the corner - the hotel has sandwich boards outside advertising their restaurant (the hotel is not particularly obvious as the hotel name is printed on the door in black and I walked past it twice!). If you carry on past the Hotel Regina then you will come to a Starbucks which serves decent tea if you like it (you have to ask for English Breakfast!). The front desk staff were friendly, efficient and polite, as were the bar staff. I can't comment on the food as we didn't eat there. The room was a bit small but how much floor space do you need?! It was lovely and clean, and the beds comfortable, with lovely clean crisp white bedding changed daily and is amazingly quiet - and we were right by the lift! The bathroom was also clean, and the power shower fantastic! I asked for a non-smoking room (twin beds) and there was no evidence whatsoever of anyone smoking in there - no smell - it was really fresh. We paid what I think is a reasonable rate (109 euros per night - room only) for a very central hotel, and I should add that I have paid more in this country for inferior quality rooms - especially in London. The only drawback is that there is no tea and coffee facilities in the room (but I already knew this - I took a travel kettle). There is a mini bar that I didn't use (I did drink the bottle of red wine next to the safe, this cost 5 euros). I thought the bar was also expensive, but I don't drink much and was comparing it to prices in the UK as I didn't visit any other bars whilst in Barcelona. All in all - its a comfortable clean hotel, and in a fantastic location. I'd happily visit the Hotel Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: carmcd
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with hotel, we had twin room, very small, we could not pass each other at end of bed, and hit my head off TV on wall more than once! Bathroom was not clean, soap scum on sink and bath. No spare pillows, duvet felt like 2 tog.No tea/coffe in room, 4 star???? Would not recommend this hotel, not good value for money and staff were not very welcoming. Location was good at top end of ramblas just off Cat Sq. Do some homework on good restuarants before you go as we were served rubbish on ramblas, best meal we had was in Hard Rock Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Would I return? Yes”
Reviews.Author: hxdirect
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel primarily because of it's location and value for money. We paid £378.88 for 4 nights through Expedia. Breakfast was not included. Pro's - location, location, location. The hotel was just a few yards from the Placa de Catalunya and within easy reach of all the major streets of the Placa including La Rambla. Both the Aerobus and the Barcelona Tour buses can be accessed here. The staff where very helpful both in the bar and reception and gave us some excellent recommendations for restaurants in the city. The hotel was stylish and clean. The crisp white bedding was lovely and the air-conditioning worked perfectly. Con's - Tripadvisor rates this hotel as a 5* yet the little booklet in the hotel labels it 4*. I would certainly not call it 5*, the Langham Place hotel in Hong Kong is a true 5* with a doorman, staff to take your luggage to your room, in room tea/coffee making facilities, better toiletries etc etc. Since I wasn't paying a 5* price then I wasn't too disappointed but this hotel is supposedly only 4 or 5 years old and is showing distinct signs of wear and tear. Dark hardwood floors and woodwork feature throughout but in several places in our room (314) the floor joints had separated significantly. A huge chunk of wood was missing from the skirting board. The glass shower panels above the bath don't do the job effectively as copious amounts of water can seep through the gap and end up on the floor. Adjusting the angle of the shower head didn't seem to make any difference. Also whilst the bedding was very nice the bed was as hard as a brick but that's just a matter of personal taste. Several of the chic white leather/PVC sofa's in the lounge area are in dire need of replacement as the leather/PVC is torn, scored or split in several places. Now as I said in the beginning I would still return to this hotel despite the con's listed above provided I got a good rate. If you are used to 5* luxury and all the fringe benefits associated with it then this is not the place to go. I would rate it in it's current condition as 3.5*

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to the Hype”
Reviews.Author: SOtt
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly researched hotels and was supremely happy to find that the Pulitzer Barcelona lived up to the TA hype. Yes the rooms are small, but that is Europe for you. And I do agree that the bathroom lighting absolutely is dim and should be updated. I had only one disappointment and that was the dessert at the wonderful lounge area downstairs. The brownie was frozen solid, but they comped our drinks as a result, even without us asking! Due to the lackluster dessert, we decided to skip the restaurant as there are already so many choices of where to eat steps away. Ok, now the things I enjoyed! The crisp white sheets and bedding were very soft and clearly of a higher quality and my request to have 2 twin beds pushed together was followed as they did not have king size available. I loved coming back to a very clean room that smelled totally luxurious. Whatever cleaning solution it is they use, it certainly is not your typical one. And I agree that the mint leg gel was a refreshing end to a long day of walking about. The rooftop terrace was lovely for sitting in, even during the day just to read and relax a bit. The location is perfect; steps away from the metro and Cafe Zurich, and very close to the Eixample area where there are beautiful wide streets lined with lovely shops. I was able to find a very good price through the booking.com site and even saved money by checking it again closer to the date of my travel. The free wireless access is a huge bonus since it is not as common as where I am from. They also have adapters for plugs free of charge for use during the stay. I loved the Pulitzer and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good though room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Phikie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January 2009. The bar and restaurant areas look great and the staff were in general very helpful (though some of the reception staff could improve their attitude). The rooms are on the small side but are otherwise very pleasant. We didn't get our preference of a non-smoking room and although the room didn't smell when we arrived, the vents must have been connected to the adjacent rooms because we could smell when the occupant of the next door room was smoking. The hotel needs to invest in some sound proofing; the predominant sound that we could hear was the lift clunking every minute or so. The location is great and very central with easy access to the metro etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: windsorLondon
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this hotel the rooms are very small for a 5 star hotel. The pictures on the website should win an award for making it look palatial. The staff are un helpful but having said that it is located very centrally. I spent alot of my time in the Majestic hotel around the corner a much better option in my opinion. It is the second time ive felt let down by hotels rated on tripadvisor, my search was for the top 5 star hotel in Barcelona., the Pulitzer is far from it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Pulitzer Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travel_i_adore
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitzer is a chic hotel located centrally in Barcelona. A skip, hop and a jump away to Placa Catalunya, Las Ramblas, La Boqueria, Metro and all the shopping and restaurants. Yet its tucked away in a tiny street/calle where you will not feel and hear the noise and busyness of the city. The room was sufficient in size, very clean and modern. They have thought about every single thing for their guest's comfort from lighting and all the different amenities available in the room. They even have the turn down service nightly. Buffet breakfast was very well worth the money, excellent variety. The staff are not only friendly, they are also very respectful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing chic styish hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jorichards
Reviews.Content: I read all the great reviews On TA before i went but was still pleasantly surprised by how Chic and stylish this hotel was. The location is excellent , 1minute from Placa de catalunya and catalunya metro station , 2 minutes from the top of La rambla and centrally located to all main sightseeing sites. The rooms are very stylish, kitted out in black and white with dark wood furnishing, maybe alittle narrow but very well appointed. Tolietres and amenenites kit both excellent. The bar is probadly the best aspect of the hotel , very cool , contemporary and stylish , great for pre and post dinner drinks .Bar food also excellent for lunch. Food in the hotel restaurant was also excellent, got a great deal for a 3 course meal with 1 glass of wine for 25 euros each(which was well worth the money) If you go when the weather is nice and sunny try out the rooftop bar location, Overall ,totally impressed by this hotel in everyway , made our trip to barcelona a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eurekaitserica
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is in a fantastic location, right on the Placa Catalunya at the top of the pedestrianised La Rambla. We arrived early from our flight and had a coffee in the lovely bar area while we waited for our room. The room we were shown unfortunately smelt heavily of cigarette smoke, which I was not prepared to tolerate, and we waited another hour for a new room, which was perfect. The room was plenty big enough, with a huge and comfortable king bed, and the bathroom was lovely with marble features and great shower. We stayed bed and breakfast which was really good, fantastic coffee and nice selection of fruit, meats, bread, cheese, pastries etc which were always topped up. The only minus of the hotel was the cost, but it was worth paying the price for the great location, great breakfast and lovely roof top terrace bar (which also wasn't cheap, but great for sitting out on a balmy summer evening!) Barcelona is a fantastic city break, and I definitely recommend the bus touristic (the turquoise bus with big eye on the side) to get a great view of the city sights. Hiring bikes was also an excellent way to get around the city, but three hours was enough in the hot summer! Segrada Familia guided tour is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 days during a recent trip to Barcelona. I LOVED this gorgeous hotel, and it's now one of my favourite hotels in the world! First up, the reservations staff I liaised with when I was booking our accommodation were very helpful. I asked for a free upgrade, was told they couldn't do it; however, that I can book a Superior room (next level up from the one I booked) for a similar price to the Standard room I booked. So I did! The Superior room we stayed at is exactly like the one pictured on their website. As you'll see from the photos on the website and the ones I've uploaded here, it is a large room with chic, elegant furnishing. The hotel provided their own branded toilettries which were really nice quality. I also liked the fact that they didn't just have the standard toilettries - they also had his and hers toilettry boxes which included things like leg massage gel (perfect after shopping!), lip balm, etc. Hotel Pulitzer is small but beautifully furnished everywhere. It had free wi-fi internet, which was fantastic. The front desk staff were courteous though reserved (perfectly fine by me). Lastly, the hotel is very centrally located. This was our first trip to Barcelona. We loved the city itself and our trip was even better because of this excellent hotel. I can't think of anything that could have been improved as our stay there was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “overall good but few minus points”
Reviews.Author: chats103Manchester
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i have just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona. Our stay in the Hotel Pulitzer started well, we were impressed by the location. Also the desk staff were very helpful. A big issue (to us anyway) was the hotel bar / restuarant opening hours. The hotel bar was only open to midnight? Also the restuarant was only open on certain days of the week? Another point was the noise - thin walls. The cleaners were quite noisy and with the thin wall, we were disturbed on both mornings. Overall a great trip and a above average hotel with a few flaws

Reviews.Title: “Mes que un hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graeme2701
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the back of the TA reviews. How anyone can rate this hotel as anything less than 5 star is beyond me. Superb location, superb staff, superb food. All in all it's just superb. Can't find any fault with it, don't think it would be fair to blame them for the snow. If you are going to Barcelona don't look any further than here. I have paid far more in the past for nothing as good as this. Simply the best. Mes que un hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Azkabanholdt
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel - central location, good sized room and bathroom, great breakfast, comfortable bar/lounge. The staff here is very friendly, helpful and accommodating. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Kindness, Location, Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: geni42
Reviews.Content: The perfect location... Only 1 or 2 minutes from aerobus station. You just cross the Catalunya plaza. You can find the Ramblas street easily. Kind staff..& sweet manner..I'm satisfied totally. I think it is the one of the best design hotel in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: Sam1Cork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located. Short walk from Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. Rooms are lovely and are very clean, little bit small but definetly sufficient for a weekend away, lots of wardrobe space. We did find the matress on bed VERY hard, as in morning i felt like i slept on the floor. We did mention this a reception, but were told all matress were the same. We had no issue in getting 8 extra pillows so made a new matress with these....slept soundly with the added comfort! Bathroom were also really nice. We would def stay in this hotel when visiting barcelona in the future, also helped when we received a complimentary bottle of champagne as we advised we were on our honeymoon One tip i would give if booking a taxi to the airport just do so from the street. We got a taxi from airport to hotel and was €24 so we said we'd get one back to save hassle of bus, so the receptionist booked one for us, ended up costing €39! appartently there is an additional €8 when the hotel books the taxi , we would have liked to have been told this by hotel! But other than that there are no complaints

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: westphillyboy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel stay. This is probably the best value in Barcelona. Excellent customer service, Great location and nice amenities for a great price. Decided to try after reading TA reviews. It was easy to book through the hotel's website. They answered my questions by e-mail promptly. We arrived early AM after flight from US. They were able to place us in our room. The rooms were very nicely appointed. Although the bedroom sleeping area was small, the bathrooms were quite large. The hotel was beautiful. There was a very nice lounge on the 1st floor which served cocktails and meals. The staff was very helpful and courteous. They suggested good restaurants and sites to see. The hotel is around the corner from Plaza Catalunya and Las Rambla. It was also close to the Metro and the city tour bus. I have nothing but praise for this hotel. I would definitely stay here again, when I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSK09
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning after an overnight flight from New York. We were welcomed with open arms and immediately checked into a wonderful, fully equipped and immaculate room. I have always had to wait for at least five hours to be able to check in when arriving so early in Europe. The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and extremely modern. The hotel's restaurant is superb. Thank you for recommending this hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joao_Amorim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located. Short walk from Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The staff was very friendly. I did a celebration package surprise to my wife and it was very easy to change the standard hours with the staff. Lovely and Fantastic surprise! The only thing I didn't enjoy was the extreme noise we could hear in the room... It seems they were serving coffees inside, but I already got a comment from the hotel that they are working on it, that's why I give it maximum score. Also they need to improve the breakfast via room service... Having tons of nice spanish delicatessen with just two pieces of bread is not so nice. In the overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying in an Art Gallery”
Reviews.Author: RJJAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This incredible hotel is located just steps away from Plaza Catalunya, Las Ramblas and the Metro system. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. You are immediately overwhelmed by the fabulous original artwork displayed throughout the lobby, bar area and corridors. We were surprised to also find so many original pieces in the room itself. (I think I counted eight). This incredible room is compact, but efficiently layed out. It is perfectly comfortable for two people. The double glass doors open on to a tiny balcony overlooking the beautiful street scene. The room was spotless! We cannot wait to return to the perfect hotel in the perfect city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: emcm09
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day City Break in Barcelona. You could not be based in a more central location than hotel Pulitzer, The Hotel is very Clean and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. the Rooms are smallish but are adequate. The Bathroom was large in comparison to the Hotel Room. Breakfast is an optional extra which should be passed on as there are numerous Cafes in the area that are much cheaper. All in all the Hotel is an excellent base for a short stay in Barcelona. And I have to emphasise that the staff were excellent and extremely helpful, in particular one Girl that worked the evening shift in Reception.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: blackJackalexandria
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer exceeded our expectations. The design of the public spaces is very imaginative and the art work throughout the hotel is excellent. While the room was a bit small, the bathroom was quite large. Three other couples travelled with us and everyone found the hotel enchanting - and the price modest. I have visited Barcelona many times and intend to stay at the Pulitzer again the next time I visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: VEEHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a lovely weekend at the Hotel Pulitzer. After checking out the trip advisor reviews, we found that the reviews were all quite true. The hotel was in a perfect location, just off "La Ramblas" which we found great not having to get taxi's all over Barcelona. The hotel staff were very professional and friendly. The bedroom was very comfortable, lovely big bed. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay at the Hotel Pulitzer again. We would recommend an open top bus tour (20 euros each) for the sights of Barcelona, you can get of and on the bus as many times as you like. For you foodies, the market is a must visit, absolutely fantastic. Overall we had a fantastic weekend in Barcelona even though we brought the british weather with us, rain!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: texarkana336
Reviews.Content: I have been to Barcelona twice this year, the first time I stayed at The Hotel Jazz and thought that the Hotel was fine but a bit expencive for a three star. This time we stayed at the Pulitzer and was very impressed. If you are thinking of going to Barcelona try this Hotel. The staff we found to be very friendly. Loved the bar area on the ground floor, great place to chill. I dont think any hotel can please everyone, but this one pleased us

Reviews.Title: “Let's not get carried away here”
Reviews.Author: araf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. Location great and hotel ambience super. Young staff very attentive and well trained. Our biggest gripe as mentioned by others was the noise in the rooms coming from the central atrium at the bottom of which was the bar area.Rooms have wooden floors anyway so beware the clip clop of heels above or to the side of your room. In all these hotels that have rooms around a central atrium they need another door to insulate the noise in the hall area before the bedroom area and this hotel does not have these. In our case in room 210 near the lifts we could hear most comings and goings all night at the lifts and needless to say with the regular supply of inconsiderate guests who speak at full volume at even 4.00am we had basically three nights with interrupted sleep. On this basis I couldn't recommend the hotel to others.View from room 210 not great either other than great roof sculptures of the C&A building of all places! The breakfasts were so so with erratic service from day to day. One day with coffee top ups every few minutes to the following day when we had to go find it ourselves. Hot selections were also not kept hot for long as there was no heating system resulting in tepid bacon and burgers!! and scarmbled egg. The buffet breakfast at the next door sister Hotel Regina looked much better. We stayed on a romantic break package which packaged the breakfast s with a bottle of Cava which we drank in the bar on a Wednesday night when they have live music (finishes 10pm). Most of the other people in the bar on all three nights were local young vistors not staying at the hotel. Coffee price in bar E3.00. Had a bar meal on night two which was of good quality at Burger E10.50 with Artisan chips for E5.50. Other tips for your stay. Caught train RENFE from airport E2.60 each -change at Barcelona Sants still on RENFE to Pl de Catalunya. The road for the Pulitzer is off the Plaza directly opposite the Corte Ingles apartment store. Meals ; had a great al fresco meal at El Cafe d'en Victor which is near the Cathedral in the Gothic quarter. Menu del dia for E12.00 sit outside price -three courses and a carafe of wine with Sea Bass as main course. Decent meal also at Siddartha on Carrer d'Avenyo Try and go for the day to Sitges. We went by train at E5.20 return each, takes about 30 mins and it is a lovely place to sit in the sun and eat if you can at the Costa Dorada just below the church by the beach where you can while away the day with beer and tapas. Heaven. Back to Barcelona. Go by cable car up to Montjuic and walk down to savour the great views.Great city full of shops for young people.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Stay at Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Silverpink25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our 10-day honeymoon in Europe, during which we stayed in 3 different hotels, and Hotel Pulitzer was hands-down our favorite. In fact, I'm going to go there and say that it was the best hotel I've ever stayed in. HP was the first hotel of our trip and it could not have started any better. The service, the decor, and the location were all superb. The rooms were small, yes, but sleek and modern and completely comfortable for two people who were mostly in and out. We had a room overlooking the street (which I'd recommend) with those classic Barcelona-style doors that open to a small balcony. The views were fantastic. The bathroom was also modern and sleek, with a dark granite decor. The bed had lots of pillows and was very comfortable! Another thing we really loved was the bar. The bartenders were true professionals and made the most well-executed cocktails I have ever seen! I greatly recommend trying some of the drinks on their menu because all that we tried were amazing. They really take their time and use great quality ingredients (try the mojito and the white russian!). They were also friendly and helpful. They recommended a tapas restaurant to us (Origens), that ended up being the best dining experience of our trip. The space is also cool. You can sit at the bar or settle in at one of the many comfy spots throughout the lounge. On most nights, there were small groups of people congregating throughout. There is also a really cute little back garden. One night while we were there, they had some live jazz, which just added to the experience even more! In addition to the service at the bar, the overall hotel service was also excellent. Never having been to Barcelona before, we had many questions and requests and they were always incredibly accomodating and friendly. Finally, the location was great, especially for someone just getting the know the city. It's a block of so from La Rambla, which is a great starting point for any direction you want to go in. Needless to say, we were very sad when it came time to check out of Hotel Pulitzer. If I ever find myself in Barcelona again, I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaatinen
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of the location and the reviews in TripAdvisor. The location is excellent. In the middle of everything, very close to La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. Spot on. Otherwise there was nothing special in this hotel. The hotel was art deco style - we have nothing against it, but there was nothing special in the interior that would have warmed our hearts. The room was OK, but again nothing that would make me long for this hotel. The bed was average and OK, but with these room prices I would have assumed a higher level of quality. Still OK. What was not at all OK was the soundproofing of the rooms. The exerior walls and the windows let all the street noise in - including louder conversations of passer-bys. Also the in house noise of the bar (clings and clangs of the glasses) three levels down continued late and was clearly audible inside the room. Fortunately we were so exhausted of walking the lovely streets of Barcelona that we fell instantly asleep. But if you have any trouble with your sleep think what I just wrote above. Breakfast was OK. The staff was OK as well, but again there was nothing that would make me say they were particularly friendly. Summa summarum: excellent location - bad soundproofing - everything else average.

Reviews.Title: “Super and Sullen”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldjp
Reviews.Content: The arrival in a taxi from the station was a non event. Struggling with our suitcases the doorman did not make any attempt to help us and one of us is seriously disabled. In fact nobody made any attempt to help us. Made us feel a but queasy about this place. right from the start...Not particularly welcoming staff at the desk. All very strange for a 4 star ‘hip’ hotel.! Room was superbly smallish and narrow..ish, however, except for some minor(major to us as it was a room especially for ‘disabled’ people) details it really was good accomodation .
