BUT..although the shower was excellent it was so dark you couldn't see the soap! NO facial tissues available at all….and most importantly the only socket in the bathroom is very far away from the sink for shavers, toothbrushes etc…. And imagine no socket for the laptop on the fold down desk!…I had to ask for an extension cord to be able to use a socket clear across the room. The bed ,though,was exceptionally comfortable as were the choice of pillows. Most annoying of all was the sullen staff everywhere (one exception: the excellent bartender) and most especially the unpleasant staff in the restaurant. Even when our wallet was stolen the front desk couldn’t have cared less and helped even less than that. Checking out from hotel was incompetent as the cashier tried the old/new trick of trying to charge in our local currency instead of Euro….and then when he had to reverse the transaction he managed to block that amount off our credit line for 9 days after! A struggle as we had lost our principal credit cards and were living on a debit card off of an obscure account of ours! I would never return to the Pulitzer only because of the staff….the hotel is perhaps passable for just the atmosphere of the place itself and the rooms but the staff....phooey!

Reviews.Title: “perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: WiddyL65
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 2 nights at Hotel Pulitzer, Barcelona with my husband and two teenage daughters(following all the glowing reports on Trip advisor)..my research paid off!...what a lovely hotel!..a friendly welcome greeted us, the rooms were'nt huge but were imaculate in decor and cleanliness,..we all slept soundly on the very comfortable beds ,untroubled by noise. we loved the hotel decor, groovy yet comfortable. The only 'average 'part of the stay was perhaps the breakfast... I hope to come back to Barcelona again soon and would definitely stay at the Pulitzer!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: joop1
Reviews.Content: I hardly give a five star rating. There is always an improvement possible. But this hotel was wonderful for me. Nice staff, correct, discreet and helpful. Ideal situation. Special requests (low floor) very well respected. The room was a bit narrow and the TV was not ideally placed, you could hit your head at night if not being careful. Overall, we would certainly stay again here while being in Barcelona. Absolutely positive and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Phillyfans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights in Barcelona and were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel Pulitzer. I decided on this hotel based on a lot of research, including the Trip Advisor feedback. The hotel is perfectly located with easy access to all the major attractions by walking, subway or cab. The rooms are very comfortable and well furnished. As others have said, they are narrower than we are used to and modern isn't to everyone's taste but our room with King bed was very clean, well appointed with all the things we like (robes, slippers, safe, etc.) and very spacious overall. It's the staff that makes or breaks a hotel and the Pulitzer has a great one. Everyone we met was extremely helpful. They gave us an excellent map, sightseeing directions, made restaurant recommendations (excellent) and reservations and made sure we had a cab for an early morning flight. All of this was done with a smile. They were very gracious in allowing me to try to speak my poor Spanish (I didn't even try Catalonian) but were also willing to rescue me in excellent English when I struggled. Our room included breakfast, which was excellent and we enjoyed a cocktail or two at the bar. We were sorry that the roof top bar had closed for the season but maybe next time. The Hotel Pulitzer is a great hotel in a perfect location with a wonderful staff that provides exception value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Edwudz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night pre-cruise on 28th September. Chose the hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor, and also reading General manager's responses to any critiscism. He seems to take that extra care in ensuring standards are maintained. We arrived late on a Sunday evening. When we got to the room we found that the combination lock on my wife's case was jammed and we couldn't open it. On enquiry Reception staff were unable to help with tools as they had been locked away by maintenance staff, but an enquiry to sister hotel produced tools, which were delivered to our room within ten minutes. Great location. All staff seemed to want to give good attentive service. Only critiscism was that the eggs at breakfast were cold - perhaps they need to purchase buffet equipment to maintain food temperatures. Rest of food was excellent. It was the first time we had cruised out of Barcelona but if we do again we will look no further than the Pulitzer for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location; they do everything right.”
Reviews.Author: vivavino
Reviews.Content: First of all, I love Trip Advisor, for the information it contains. I had a 3 night pre-cruise stay Sept 6 - 9. I chose the Pulitzer principally because of the rating here, and the fact that the management responded to every single review. While that doesn't guarantee a fabulous stay, it is certainly a good sign. I was not disappointed. The staff couldn't have been friendlier. I was on a typical overnight flight, and arrived around 10am at the hotel. They held my bags and asked me to come back around 1pm. Everything was ready then, and I got settled in. They offered breakfast (at a charge, since it wasn't in my package), and steered us to the co-owned hotel next door for free internet access. The room was very comfortable, plenty of storage in the closets, and a very deep bathtub with shower. The bed was great, and I didn't have much street noise. The location is perfect. A half block from the tourist buses, and the Ramblas. I couldn't have been happier with the spot. My only criticism would sound silly, actually - the "purity of design" won out over some very practical things. No soap dish on the counter, for example.... so the maid winds up using one of the glass covers to hold your soap.... And not a single place in the tub/shower to hold the soap there, or put down the (very nice) bottles of shampoo they provide. "My kingdom for a soap dish." (Just kidding.) So, I'd happily visit them again, or stay at the neighboring Regina when I return in April. I wish them continued success.

Reviews.Title: “Your decision should be easy! Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: MariaGIreland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two-night stay in the Hotel Pulitzer in Barcelona. Our decision to choose this hotel was based on the reviews seen on Tripadvisor and most especially on the very genuine replies inserted by the hotel Manager. I did untold research regarding hotels for this trip as it was a very special trip for both myself and my sister. I wanted everything to be perfect with no time wasted fixing any mistakes or carrying out any re-working of our plans. We were not disappointed! We had a fantastic trip and this was definitely enhanced by this superb hotel. I actually feel quite hesitant recommending it as we wanted to keep it all to ourselves but that didn't seem fair! The location is perfect. It is literally a few steps from the central Placa de Catalunya. This proved to be an invaluable location as we were within walking distance of many of the main sights and on the route for the red and blue Bus Turistica (worth using, definitely if you are short on time). The hotel is situated on a quiet side street......so no noise at night! The staff in the hotel are very friendly (in a very understated, gentle, smiley way which we loved!) and extremely professional and efficient. The superb customer service actually started before we left Ireland at all! I had been researching the vast array of restaurants available in the city and became more and more confused. I eventually narrowed the list down to about 6 and couldn't make up my mind betwen them all. Because of the Manager's very genuine comments on this website, I decided that I could probably trust him to set us straight......and I was right! Within a day, I was contacted with restaurant suggestions for each night. I decided on two, and these were subsequently booked for us by Patricia at the front desk. No hassle, no problem just friendly, efficient service. What a pleasure! On arrival, we were greeted by Sergio at the front desk.He was very pleasant, friendly and efficient. (If you find that I am repeating my adjectives, that is because there are not enough to do justice to the standard of this hotel). Our check-in was handled quickly, our restaurant reservations were confirmed and we were given little "appointment" cards for each. Our room was excellent. I had thought that our room would actually be smaller so we were both pleasantly surprised by the space we had, The room is very trendy and modern, but most of all comfortable. There is excellent and smart use of the available space with your every possible need catered for. The suitcases fit underneath the bed; there is ample wardrobe and drawer/shelf space; the lights are controlled with switches which you keep depressed so as to alter the lighting levels in a slow manner and thus you can easily control the level of lighting you prefer. There is aircon, a lovely shower, a large mirror in the bedroom and a make-up mirror in the bathroom. We were provided with bath-robes and slippers and ample, very nice, toiletries. The beds were very comfortable. To avoid boring you, the room was more than perfect for our needs and exceeded expectations in terms of comfort. It IS narrow but definitely there is enough space so as not to be restrictive. After our return from the restaurant on the first night (El Passadis del Pep........HIGHLY RECOMMENDED), we retired to the hotel bar for a drink. The bar is very relaxing and is decorated as per the rest of the hotel....clean, crisp lines with modern , trendy furniture. The atmosphere is very mellow and added to the feeling that this hotel was fast becoming our home from home. The staff here were very pleasant and again helpful. We decided to have breakfast in the hotel for the sake of convenience and that was the correct decision! For €15, we had unlimited access to eggs, mushrooms, cheeses, stuffed tomatoes, fruits, yoghurts, various breads, various pastries, coffees etc etc. What a spread for that price. The staff here were again very friendly and attentive. The man on duty was particularly excellent as he really tried to make sure that we wanted for nothing. He was very gentle in his attitude and made us feel right at home. Fully fortified we headed off for our day but returned in the early evening for a drink on the outside terrace. After our meal that night (L'Olive.....again we would recommend this restaurant.....just go easy on the breads at the start. We overdid it a bit and found the subsequent courses hard going! Try the sole catalan style.....) we returned to the hotel bar for a night cap which again, provided a perfect end to a perfect day. A taxi was ordered for us for our early start the next morning and this arrived a little early, which suited us perfectly. The efficiency just went on and on.......... We would both HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.This is based on the staff, the hotel ambience and decor, the location and the facilities. We will return without a doubt and would not even bother researching accommodation again. Thank you Mr. Sanchez and all your staff for a magnificent stay. See you again some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: npgPhilly
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Pulitzer on 9/15 and stayed for 5 nights. Our room was ready when we arrived even though it was before the check-in time. We had mentioned that we were celebrating a special birthday and the hotel sent a bottle of wine and a fabulous chocolate cake to our room. How nice!! The hotel is a boutique-style hotel with lovely common areas. The rooms are a little small but very adequate and modern. The free Wi-Fi was a real plus. The front desk staff were very helpful during our stay, especially Andrea and Ivker. Two restaurants that we really enjoyed during our stay were: Cuines Santa Caterina and Senyor Parellada. A highlight of our trip was a day tour by mini-van to Girona and the Costa Brava coast (Palafrugell) with Rabbies tours (www.rabbies.eu.com).

Reviews.Title: “Our third visit ..”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller_1975
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona on Monday around midday and we checked into the Pulitzer for the third time since 2004. Check in was seamless thanks to Sergio, and our room was all ready for us. The weather in Barcelona was unlike anything I have experienced there before, but thanks to the front desk staff lending us an umbrella we decided to venture outside. Over the course of our stay the weather did not improve so we spent most of our time in the hotel. Given the extensive wine, liquor and cocktail menus on offer this was a pleasure and not a downside to our trip. The staff were mostly attentive, however the bar staff duing the day left a little to be desired. We have travelled all over the world and stayed in many fantastic hotels - and this is one of the best in our opinion. All in all the Pulitzer offers fantastic contemporary rooms, free wi-fi (which is quite unusual), and a great atmosphere. We will definitely be back, and also plan to visit the new Pulitzer in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Three nights before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: Azulann
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Barcelona , in part do to the Hotel Pulitzer. We arrived from the USA at noon and our rooms were ready for us. I, as a single person ,was traveling with two couples. I did receive a single room rate. The location is perfect. At the end of the block is Plac de Catalunya, gateway to a number of neighborhoods to explore on foot,and the access to La Rambla. The front desk staff were so helpful. We received a map and a tour book upon arrival. They helped us with recommendations for dinner, got us taxis, found out the Mass times at the Cathedral,suggested streets to explore nearby. The bar/wait staff were also very helpful and friendly. Hotel staff are the first people one meets in a foreign city and they can set the tone for the whole stay. All of our rooms had the same layout. Clean, high ceilings, wonderful beds, sleek bathrooms with nice amenties. Loved the bathrobe and slippers. Rooms facing the front had large windows and small balcony to observe the street below. Great variety at the breakfast buffet. Nice outside seating area. I loved the lobby bar , understated modern elegance. Best of all was the roof top terrace, for drinksand conversation after a full day of sightseeing. I will be back to Barcelona and will definitely stay at the Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: 21player
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. This Hotel is spotless, very good condition and the service was second to none. My wife and I arrived on Friday morning 8:30am Sept 12th. The room was READY! Great start. Breakfast buffett was just right to get the day started. The service by the front desk people and both bars was fantastic. Iam an avid forum poster on Trip Advisor, and this is how I found out about this place. When the Mgr Jose responds to reviews like he does, that just shows me what kind of people run this place. Thank You Jose, My wife and I are already planning on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatDane33
Reviews.Content: After having read all of the positive reviews at Tripadvisor it was with great anticipation I arrived at the Pulitzer Sunday September 15th for a 3 night stay. Unfortunately the hotel didn’t have my reservation in their system so despite the booking confirmation I had brought with me I was kindly asked to take a walk (- I was even handed a map) while they tried to figure something out. We agreed that I should come back after approx 2 hours and before strolling out in the beautiful weather of Barcelona I was asked if I would like to leave my suitcase at the hotel. The location of the hotel is simply just perfect. Before going I considered staying at the Le Meredien at the Las Ramblas and without saying anything bad about the Le Meridien I have to say that I’m glad I booked at the Pulitzer instead. This only based on location. When I returned to the hotel everything was settled and I was given a room at the first floor facing the street. I liked the room a lot but as I know this is solely a matter of individual taster I’ve decided to post a few pictures from the room/bathroom so that you can decide for you self. It’s not a big room but it got all you need. No turn down service though ;o) The hotel lobby is very “friendly and full of light” – The same goes for the bar and the restaurant. At the 6th floor there is a very nice terrace bar which is a great place to wind down after a busy day in the city. It’s even possible to have a snack but the choices could have a little more variety. The staff is really something. Whether it was the people at the reception desk, in the bar (terrace and lobby bar) or the two charming girls in the breakfast restaurant they were all very kind and very professional. I actually only have two little things I would like to mention as being less positive. 1) The noise level in the room from inside the hotel is rather high. Perhaps it was because I stayed at the 1st floor and therefore could hear almost anything going on in the bar on ground floor (porcelain more than people). A better isolated door would really have done it for me as no noise from the street outside ruined my night sleep ;o) 2) I’m not really sure this has anything to do with the hotel but I would like to mention it anyway. The taxi from the airport to the hotel was Euro 23,- The trip back to the airport which was a taxi booked at the reception desk was Euro 42,- !!! I had the pleasure of sharing the taxi back to the airport with two other hotel guests and as we all insisted that that price couldn’t be right suddenly the price dropped to Euro 30,- After having stayed at the Pulitzer I can guarantee that it won’t be my last stay there. Actually I thought about not sharing this positive experience with anyone as that might make it even more impossible to get a reservation there next time but as so many of you have been kind enough to do it before me I decided to do it anyway :o) I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Jen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous weekend in Barcelona where we stayed in the wonderful Hotel Pulitzer. The location is first class - right in the heart of the city - stones throw from Las Ramblas (if you want it!), and walking distance to the old town and the port. We got the aerobus (only €4,05 one way) which drops you in the Place de Catalunya - the hotel is a 2 min walk from here... so no need for a taxi. Oh... and there's a Starbucks right at the end of the street :) The staff spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful. The hotel itself is an oasis of calm with wonderful funky music playing in the background of the lobby and bar area. The bar is kitted out with huge white leather sofas - great to flop into after a lengthy day of sightseeing. The room was long and narrow, but very well presented. The bathroom was lovely with the expected little extras. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever encountered. If you're a couple, get the 'Romance Package' with breakfast included in the price and a bottle of Cava delivered to your room on your first evening. If I was returning to Barcelona, I wouldn't look past the Hotel Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MikeGrimsby
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our first trip to Barcelona based on the recommendations on this site, and were delighted with it. It was very easy to get to from the Aerobus stop, and the location would be hard to beat - we walked nearly everywhere. We had a standard room at the back of the hotel - nice and quiet. Found the size of room fine, and liked the style of decor. The bed was as comfortable as any we've ever slept on. I do personally like a bedside clock, which wasn't present, but that's a very minor quibble. The aircon seemed very quiet, in some hotels I can find this a problem at night. All the staff we came into contact with were charming. Breakfast met our needs well, and we thought the one lunch we had in the hotel was good value at 20Euros - including a glass of wine and coffee. We enjoyed the rooftop bar - after our miserable English summer it was very pleasant to sit outside in the evening and be warm! We only had three days in Barcelona, so only got to see a fraction of the sights. When we return to see more, I'm sure we'll stay at the Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect holiday!”
Reviews.Author: HMT13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel from 25th-29th Aug 2008. The hotel was lovely, the staff very friendly. The room was perfect for us, they are slightly narrow but quite long so I never felt it was too small. The bathroom was very nice. The room was cleaned each day with new bed linen. The roof top bar was fab, we had a few cocktails up there. The only thing I didn't like was paying 11 euros for a cocktail served in a plastic glass, it kind of takes the edge away somehow? Not sure if this is due to the bar being open air and for safety etc? But obviously a very minor point. The hotel's location is perfect because you can walk easily to the marina down la rambla and also the other direction up passeig de gracia into l'eixample. The breakfast was definitely worth paying slightly more for, very relaxed and plenty of choice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: LeedsAnon
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer was recommended to me by a colleague who had stayed there. We stayed for 4 nights in a superior room. I did look at some of the reviews before I went and wasn't sure what to expect. We had a fantastic stay and loved the hotel. Our room was excellent, yes they are narrower than avereage but they are finished very well. It was the best bed I have slept in away from home. The bathroom was lovely as well. I had a look in a standard room which was v similar just a little shorter. The communal lounge/bar is a lovely space. V relaxing, an oasis of calm in a very busy town. The restaurant is equally nice and breakfast was very fresh with a good selection of hot and cold food. We also ate there one night and the standard was equally as good. There is a nice outside terrace area as well. There is a great roof terrace bar which is open from 6 onwards. The over all experience was excellent. We are pretty fussy about where we stay and the standards of service we expect and the team at ther Pulitzer surpassed them. The stay were very friendly and polite and its a v central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindsNick
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned from a three night stay at The Pulitzer and we were VERY happy with the Hotel. It is in a fantastic location right in the centre of the city, but down a relatively quiet street. The interior decor is stunning and the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. We enjoyed relaxing on the roof terrace and sampling the delicious cocktails and really appreciated the complimentary bottle of fizz! We would definately stay here again and are now looking at travelling to the other cities where there are Pulitzer Hotels. Thank you to the manager, Jose for arranging our room with a balcony. We highly recommend the Pulitzer to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: CMTB
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel with very friendly staff who speak English if needed. We arrived just as the restaurant was closing, but they gladly stayed open so we could have a snack. Very convenient for airport bus and for Paseig de Gracia (much nicer area than the tacky Ramblas). The only small quibble is they need a good make up mirror with lights in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: NorwayCats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week, and we really had a great time!! We first had a room without balcony (we had asked for it), but there was no problem to change to another room with a small and nice balcony with a lovely view. The staff was very friendly, and after a long day in town, we always looked foreward to come home to the hotel. Lovely breakfast and a location that couldn't be better. Just love this hotel, and will for sure book this hotel next time. Thank you for making our stay just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: canHarrisonOhio
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in the door we felt welcome. The staff couldn't have been any nicer and they more than met our expectations. They were more than willing to help with anything we needed. We would definetly stay there again or recommend it to anyone thinking of going to Barcelona. Everyone did everything with a smile on their face,which made you feel like smiling too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wenhelall
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided excellent service!! The hotel is an good location close to all the necesaff are say places you would like to visit within a walking distance. The staff are great!! The hotel is slightly expensive but its in a 4 star hotel and its also in the centre of everything and to be honest its not anymore expensive than most places Barcelona. Best hotel ever been too!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mr_guy_incognito
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because it was in a nice central location where we could walk to most of the major sights and it looked clean and modern. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Although the rooms are on the smaller side, there is enough room to move around with 2 people and it had a nice armchair to relax in. Amenities were good and the bathroom was reasonably spacious with good bath/shower. Room size should not be an issue anyway because if you are spending too many of your waking hours in there you're missing the point of Barcelona! The bed was perfectly comfortable and gave us a good rest to tackle another day of sightseeing. We had a drink and snack down in the lobby bar area which was of fairly good quality and service was quite friendly. Reception staff were helpful in terms of directions, restaurants, etc and working out airport transport. This is simply a nicely designed, well located, well kept hotel which is very comfortable and reasonably priced and will provide you with a great base for exploring this wonderful city. Exactly what you want and need from a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fair value, good location”
Reviews.Author: gzt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights on vacation. This is a well run comfortable hotel with a great location. Breakfast was included, selection was satisfactory and the presentation inpacable. The room is fair, clean and free wireless internet is provided.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ltancred
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived back from a long weekend in Barcelona and I definitely recommend this hotel. You couldn't ask for a better location. The lobby and bar were beautiful, but the roof top bar was my favouite- I didn't want to leave it! We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. A friend joined us a day after we arrived and we both managed to get checked in at 12 o'clock. The staff were able to provide great advice and the bar staff were friendly and fun. The rooms were lovely, exactly the size one would expect from a European city, with loads of nice touches in the bathroom, and very comfortable beds. We were on the first floor, and there was a door somewhere that kept slamming closed which woke us up a lot, but I could live with that. I didn't try the breakfast, but I've been told it was great. Overall, I loved the hotel, I'd certainly stay in it if I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Fridaysmom
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, I had high expectations for this hotel, but have to admit, similar to the previous review, that I was somewhat disappointed with this hotel. The lobby area, dining room and roof-top bar are all very nice, but the rooms are very small! We had even decided to book the 'superior room' as we knew that the rooms were small, but it also was very narrow and the only difference between this room and the standard room appeared to be the addition of a small couch. The width of the room, however, appeared to be similar, which me feel quite claustrophobic. As previously noted, there was little space to get by the t.v. on the wall to the desk area (you actually had to duck down to get by), and the sitting area by the desk was also quite cramped. We did have a small balcony, but couldn't figure out how to open the door. Similar to the previous reviewer, we were given no instructions on the room when our luggage was brought up. We also arrived from overseas around 11 am and were told that because other guests in the room wouldn't be checking out until noon that the room wouldn't be ready until around 2 (or possibly 1 at the earliest). We checked our luggage and tried to entertain ourselves, but after an hour of walking around returned to the lobby in the hopes that we could get into the room early. After listening to rather annoying new wave music for nearly 2 hours, we were finally let into our room at 1:55 pm. I have to admit that I was quite disappointed that no efforts were made to attend to our room to accommodate the fact that we had been traveling all night to get to Barcelona. We had also booked the romantic package, but despite previous reference to red bows and rose petals all we got was a bottle of cava delivered to our room. Positives of the hotel include a great location (close to the Ramblas and to several metro stops), very friendly staff (who helped with restaurant recommendations--including a very good nearby tapas bar), free internet, a good breakfast buffet, and a nice roof-top bar (we did not have a drink there though). I haven't stayed in other hotels in Barcelona so don't know how this compares, but I would not rate this hotel as anything special as compared to hotels that I have stayed at in other major cities around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Loved EVERYTHING about Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: TMLA
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Pulitzer from 6/20/08 to 6/26/08. Everyone at the hotel, from the front door, front desk, breakfast room and to the roof-top bar, including cleaning ladies, was very friendly and very helpful. The location was great on a quiet street by Plaza Catalunya. Since I did not care much about Las Ramblas which I though was so similar to Venice Beach Boardwalk in Los Angeles, I was glad that the hotel was located away from Las Ramlas. We loved their buffet style breakfast with good selection of bread, fruit, cheese, meats and other items which prepared us ready for all day sightseeing. Yes, our room was narrow as indicated by other travelers but we did not mind. The bathroom was very spacious. Our room was quiet and I slept very well in the room. I loved the interesting design of the building and also the colors used for decoration. I look forward to staying at Hotel Pulitzer again when I return to Barcelona. Note about reservation: I initially booked a room directly through Hotel Pulitzer's website. But later I found out that my travel agent was able to get a better room rate. I ended up canceling my reservation and had my travel agent re-book a room. I thought our direct on-line reservation would get us better rates but it was not the case with Hotel Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: star2006
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break at Hotel Pulitzer. I enjoyed every aspect of the hotel - great breakfasts, friendly staff and clean chic room. Corridor carpets need upgrading - they are now looking a little shabby in comparison with the rest of the hotel. I will return - but I would like to be at a higher level away from the street noise next time. Bet Davies, Cardiff

Reviews.Title: “stylish but no substance”
Reviews.Author: mrkz
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is well located and stylish - as it should be for the price Unfortunately, the rooms are on the small side More importantly, the service we experienced was very patchy -- not good enough at these prices. For just a few examples: The rooms were on two nights not cleaned until afer 5pm even though we had left the room before nine. Asking the staff at front desk to arrange to Fedex a package was a big production, they had little idea what to do. Even worse, a film crew took over the whole lobby and bar area on our last day, and the staff we completely occupied with the chaos. They asked us to wait "a few hours" to check out, and in the meantime the lobby was unusable to guests. Very disappointing for paying guests. In summary, if style is all you need, great -- but there are better options that are just as cool. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room to Improve”
Reviews.Author: WARRENDEE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in May 2008. Very expensive but wonderful central location. Room very smart and modern though quite narrow for two people. We had a problem with the cable television which failed to work for 4 days despite Reception telling us that it had been fixed then finally admitting that they did have issues with it. Our room was quite chilly in the evenings but the temperture couldn't be raised unles we wanted the air conditioning put in the heating mode permanently.(We needed cooling during the day). You could only have either heating or cooling not changing from one to the other. The breakfast was good value but unless you ate very early the hot food was cold and the cold milk had gone warm. Some of the breakfast and bar staff need cheering up rather than dragging their feet around in oversized shoes looking very miserable. The "library" summed Hotel Pulitzer up for me, most of the books are fake! It looks fabulous on the outside but needs more attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Pulitzer because the Regina was full on our last night in BCN. They are actually sister hotels of the same hotel group, and the décor definitely reflects this. The hotel is very modern and sleek. The staff at the front desk were efficient, and our room was ready at check in. The room was VERY narrow –barely room to walk past the bed – but otherwise fine. Bathroom was large with great marble and cool shower. My biggest complaint is the way the lobby bar is situated. All the noise from the bar echos up the corridor and is actually pretty loud in the rooms. We were at the far end closest to the bar and on the 3rd floor – not sure if it gets less loud the further up you go, but it was kind of annoying. Location couldn’t be better. Free WiFi in the rooms is nice, and the doors open on to balconies. I’m a little biased to their sister hotel, but the Pulitzer is a great hotel at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: fionakeira
Reviews.Content: For those looking at hotels in this price range let me put to rest, this is the hotel to choose. Outstanding in every area, this small hotel exceeded our expectations. Service, rooms, atmosphere, food and location - one cannot go wrong. I spent time looking for hotels in Barcelona and finally rested with the Hotel Pulitzer because of the reviews on this site and the location. It took us no time to jump onto the Metro, which is a 2 min walk from the hotel, and if you really want to see Barcelona the Metro is the way to go - easy and efficient. But what makes the hotel is the service, the people at the front desk are pleasant and always helpful. Their restaurant recommendations are generally very good and their knowledge of their city is excellent.. My wife and I were pleased with the choice and thank the Hotel for their outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish -- like a Spanish W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katgut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June '08 and had a good experience. The hotel felt exactly like staying at one of the Starwood W hotels in the states -- stylish, central location and nice service. The best part of the hotel is its amazing location right near the Plaza Catalunya which is the nerve center of Barcelona. This alone would have made the stay worthwhile. The hotel itself is stylish with good service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It also has a beautiful rooftop and very nice bar & restaurant. The rooms are nice but a bit small (typical of urban hotels) and sometimes one gets the feeling that comfort has been a bit compromised for style. For example we couldn't figure out the crazy light dimming options in our room and had our bedside lamps flickering on and off during the entire stay. A bit annoying, but overall not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: cjones8778
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer in the end of May and have no complaints. The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing and for just getting around in general. The service is fantastic. The airline lost our luggage on the day we arrived, and the hotel's front desk took care of helping us get it back; they eliminated all stress. The hotel has a partnership with a very good gym down the road, and you can go for free. Comfortable and clean room. I will recommend this hotel to anyone I know travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: rwny
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, following a Mediterranean cruise. Location just to the west of the top of Las Ramblas was excellent. The staff were superb - seemingly trying to outdo each other in helpfulness. Room was fine - larger than most we've had throughout Europe. The mattress was REAL hard - the only negative of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: www.chubbyhubby.net
Reviews.Content: I travel at least a week every month, so I see a lot of hotels. I also stay in a lot of boutique hotels. So, I don't get impressed too easily. My wife and I just came back from a one week trip to Catalonia. We spent the first two nights of our trip and the last at the Pulitzer. We liked the hotel a lot. It was chic, smart, clean, comfortable and well-designed. In order, here's what I liked best: 1. Location! Right off Plaza Catalonia. Perfect. 10-15 walk to La Boqueria; 5 minute walk to Passeig de Gracia. You could not ask for a better location. 2. Polite staff. The staff were all helpful and very charming, even when I was peppering them with dumb questions. I really admired that when my wife and I were waiting on the sidewalk outside of the hotel, for a friend to pick us up in a rented car, the security guy on duty made it a point to stand near us whenever suspicious characters came walking down the street. 3. Smart contemporary and not over the top design. I am very sick of over-designed hotels. The pulitzer was classy. The lobby was chic and filled with cool-looking people our whole trip. The rooms, while nowhere near huge (this is Europe after all), were decorated smartly, with nice neutral and earthy tones. 4. Smart design touches in the room. The foldaway desk was great since I needed to do some work on the trip but didn't want to be tripping over the desk at other times. The light switches by the beds were well-placed. The bathrooms were well laid-out and the amenities were nice. 5. Price. The hotel gave me a great rate so I couldn't have been happier. I got great value for money. I would stay at the Pulitzer again in a heartbeat. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Boio
Reviews.Content: I booked a "Superior room" directly with the hotel (for some reason, this level of room cannot be booked on their website; only "standard" rooms via the web...). This was based on the reviews describing the small rooms. Sure glad I chose the superior, as any smaller would have been very cramped for two people. As per some other reviews, I agree that the position of the TV on the wall, with almost no clearance between it & the bed is particularly poor design; a definite hazard potentially. Having said all that, I was very glad I stayed at The Pulitzer. After a 26 hour trip from Australia I wanted a room with good noise insulation and good curtaining for light minimisation, and this place delivered the goods. Location is great, staff are friendly. Free internet next door at Hotel Regina, and nearby gym, were used & appreciated by me. Would stay again. I was back in Barcelona later on in this trip & stayed at the Regina Hotel, but went to dinner at Visit restaurant in The Pulitzer; one of the BEST meals I had in Spain! Would definitely recommend eating here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Jb098451
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Pulitzer after reading the reviews from fellow travellers. We stayed for 3 nights from 02/05/08 - 04/05/08 to celebrate my 40th birthday. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Superior room which was a lovely suprise but friends joined us for 2 nights and their room was a standard room and was also lovely. The hotel is very central but also quiet enough not to be disturbed. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have slept in! The decor is smart and stylish and the staff were most helpful and even brought a cake on my Birthday evening.Our only disapointment was the rooftop bar was closed for the duration of our stay. I believe it opened on the day we left but looked delightful. All in all a great experience and I would thoroughly recommend the hotel. We also booked a restaurant " Can Majo" for my birthday meal, down at the seaside and were so pleased we had. Fabulous food,ambience etc Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in a perfect city”
Reviews.Author: skyejaden
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer from April 30 - May 7th. I chose it originally through reviews on this site and I couldn't have been more pleased. I am a female who traveled to Spain solo and met a friend there, so I chose it first and foremost on its ease of getting there by myself. It's just literally a minute or two walk to the A1 airport bus which is hands down the best way to get back and forth to the airport. The staff at the front desk were very courteous and kind with my limited knowledge of Spanish. There was a tiny mix up in the bed configuration, but they solved it quickly and check-in was a breeze. I had requested a room with a balcony facing the street and I'm happy that I did. It lets in a nice amount of fresh air. We never found a problem with heat or air conditioning - it was always perfect and easy to control. The beds were very comfortable to me, and the linens were super clean and fresh. The bathroom was extremely spacious with nice touches and amenities. The shower was strong and hot water was never a problem. The whole room was very clean and smelled really nice. The design of it was very pretty with the dark colors and artwork and the flat screen on the wall was a plus, although the channels to choose from were not so great. But I didn't go to Spain to watch TV! While a lot of people have said the rooms are small, this is true but I never felt closed in at all. And Barcelona is a city to explore - not one to stay in the hotel room!! But upon return to it, it was a quiet calm haven to rest in. With two of us there, we didn't feel squeezed in at all. There's a spacious closet in which to place your suitcases and hang clothes. I didn't try the room service or the restaurants, as there are a bounty to choose from right outside the door. But I did get ice at the bar and they were happy to provide a bowl of it! I wouldn't hesitate at all to book this hotel again. It's location is far enough off of the Ramblas to be quiet, and close enough to walk two minutes and have your morning coffee there. It really couldn't be situated any better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fastbloke
Reviews.Content: Really nice rooms, good breakfast, central location - this hotel was just great. This is one of my favourite hotels that I have stayed in. The rooftop bar is a great place to unwind at night and watch the sun go down.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Syc06
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel indeed. The room was clean and the staff very handfull and friendly. When I come back to barcelona I will stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location and style”
Reviews.Author: marcik2
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. Artistic decor and a fabulous location - convenient to La Rambla, trains, etc. The room was rather small, but very modern and comfortable. The balcony added some fresh air and space. Rooftop was charming and relaxing. And the food was great. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: HarrietSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April at the beginning of a 3 week trip to Spain - the Pulitzer was fabulous! Great room, although on the small side, friendly helpful service at reception & we LOVED the bar/lounge area. I arrived at around 9.30am after a 25 hour flight from Australia & was warmly welcomed , with an early check-in. I heard about this hotel from a friend, & it lived up to all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MSB5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Jazz graciously transfered us here since we wanted to extend our trip and they couldn't accommodate us. Only stayed one night, had 2 rooms, but loved it! Basically same great location as Hotel Jazz! Very nice decor- more stylish! Liked that breakfast was included, it increased the value! We would definitely stay here again! Although we were happy at Hotel Jazz we liked it here even more; but it was also more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the relaxation break at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Lollipop1975
Reviews.Content: Hi There, We stayed at this hotel in March we had never been to Barcelona before and I personally think the hotel, location and atmosphere will make me go back there again and again. I cannot remember my room number but our room opened onto a court yard which was lovely. I LOVED THIS HOTEL, I loved having a glass of wine in the lounge in the evening before heading out to dinner. I loved the design of the hotel, the staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast's were really delicious. I told my husband that we would be making this an annual event. I did not want to come home at all. We also got the champagne/Cava and it was a lovely touch. Cannot wait to go back again.... Next year roll on..

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: colleagues
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. The rooms are nice but somewhat small for the price. However, the bathroom is spacious and comfortable. The decoraton is very dark and we would rather have more lighting, which is the only minor negative remark. The design of the hotel is beautiful and the staff is very helpful. Ask for a room on a high floor with a view to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: decision
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of April. We picked this hotel having read the reviews. The best part of this hotel is it's location. It's on a side street, turning left out of the hotel it's less than one minute's walk from Pl. Catalunya and turning right it's less than one minute from a Starbucks cafe. Room : We were not fortunate enough to get an upgrade as others did, so we had the basic room which is quite small width wise without the couch but with one armchair. The television is on the wall facing the bed and every time we passed it we felt we were going to hit our heads. The lighting is very nice and you can dim them if you are in the mood which is a nice touch. There are robes and slippers provided. The bathroom is very nice with nice fluffy towels and shower gel, shampoo and moisturiser provided. There is also a man and woman box which has a toothbrush, toothpaste, razor, etc. but one thing missing is cotton buds which is usually provided in 4* hotels. We booked the romance package which included breakfast and a bottle of cava. For anyone else booking this package, apparently the cava is delivered to the room around 7pm in ice bucket with two champagne glasses. We had to ask when it would be delivered. If we hadn't and only returned to our room late after eating, I would imagine the cava would have been warm at that stage. Our room was on the 5th floor to the back of the hotel which got the sun for most of the day, looked down on the back of the hotel and onto the next street on which C & A is located. There was no balcony but the window doors opened in with a railing outside. If you are to the front of the hotel, there is a very small balcony with standing room only. The street is not very wide and you only get the sun in the evening. Breakfast : This is served until 11am during the week, later at the week-end. It comprises of juices, cereals (no cornflakes), cold meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, scrambled eggs, mini saugages, crispy bacon, bread rolls, bread to be toasted, yogurts, danish pastries and doughnuts. We arrived down for breakfast at 10.30am to see a waitress taking plates of what looked like really nice shortcake cookies, we presumed to a different location in the breakfast room. We soon realised that they were clearing away and these were not available when we would have liked them with our coffee and tea to finish. If you like coffee there's no problem but if you like tea, like me, they bring a cup of warm water and a tea bag. You get the milk from the large jug for the cereal. Most 4* star hotels we have stayed in have teapots and small jugs for cold milk which make it much more user friendly. Pulitzer Management please take note. Restaurant : Not open Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday nights. Having stayed previously in the AC Diplomatic which is a further 5/10 mins away from Pl. Catalunya, We are still undecided which is better overall!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish”
Reviews.Author: LeanneCirencester
Reviews.Content: Very glam hotel - very stylish. Friendly staff. Great breakfast and really good location - just across the plaza at the top of Las Ramblas. Room a decent size with a large bathroom and excellent shower. Plus, decent toiletries. Only complaint - pricey breakfast and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a stay in Barcelona's Pulitzer. One of my female collegues was staying in the Pulitzer. I decided to go to the Barcelona Art's hotel; what a dissapointment. After 1 night I decided to switch from the Art Hotel to the Pulitzer! And what a good decision I made! The Pulitzer staff is very friendly; well trainend; polite and willing to do everything they can to make the guests feel at home. The rooms are nice; well decorated; only thing I found a bit disappointment was the view at the back of the hotel. Next time I hope to get a frontroom. The bathroom is nice and most important very clean! Waterpressure from the shower is ok! After all; my best place to stay in Barcelona! 23 of April I'am back for a private visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LyndaCarville
Reviews.Content: Great location, would recommend this hotel for a city break! Just off the Placa Catalunya, but no problems with street noise, the room was fine. A little small, but we didnt spend much time there anyway. We didnt eat in the restaurant and breakfast wasnt included so cant comment! Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: andyg7
Reviews.Content: I've just returned home from 4 nights at the hotel Pulitzer. It's the second time I have stayed at this hotel. I made a special request when I booked my room which was carried out perfectly. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. There is a stylish bar on the ground floor which is great to relax and get a few drinks after a day seeing the sights. There is also a rooftop terrace which we used to soak up the sun and chill out. The rooms are neat, modern and stylish with lots of little touches to remind you that you're in a 4 star hotel. On top of all this the hotel is located in a very good spot 1 minute walk from the Placa De Catalunya. Thanks tripadvisor for helping me choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: yorkshiretourist
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pulitzer on the strength of the reviews we had read on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed! The hotel is very well situated and handy for the metro and all the major sights. The reception staff were friendly and very helpful at recommending places for tapas etc. The room was small (as we expected from the reviews) but very nice. We were at the front of the hotel but there was very little noise to disturb us. We didn't eat in the restaurant but it looked okay. When we return to Barcelona in the not too distant future we will definitely stay at the Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PhotoNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Pulitzer several months ago and found the hotel to be a great value! The hotel is in the perfect location very central to exiample, barrio gottico, barcalonetta, and all other neighborhoods. You can pretty much walk anywhere with in a 1/2 hour. It is 2 block away from Las Ramblas but you would never know it. The rooms are small but very functional and well designed. Dark woods and beautiful white linens with some very funky art deco chairs and desk. The lobby has bolstered sofas in white leather with asian accents and beautiful restaurant, bar and gorgeous roof top bar!!!!!! The staff is extremely efficient and very helpful with out being invasive or over the top. They suggested two very good restaurants that are a must if you are a foodie!!!!! The first was cinc sentis (amazing food!!!!! Lacked ambiance though no back ground music so it was bit uncomfortable) The second was Comerce 24 amazing food with various types of foam and dishes you would never expect or dream up. Make sure you make reservations and you arrive on time..... The Spanish find it very rude if you are late to your reservations. I would definitely recommend Hotel Pulitzer for it's great design, helpful staff, Amazing Location, & affordable price!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average artsy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer for a big conference and chose the hotel solely for the fact that it was the only mid-price hotel available in town. Later I learned it had great reviews on tripadvisor.com, and I was not disappointed. There was some problems with the room: specifically, the lighting controls were weird and hard to manage and master, and oddly the shower head flew off repeatedly when the water was turned on. There was no fix for the lighting, but the hotel quickly fixed the shower head problem. (Nice touch: the shower head was placed high on the wall -- nice for us tall folk.) Another weird issue -- the bar soap was tiny and smelly. I expect more from a high-end hotel. Otherwise, the room was fairly design-y. Dark wood floors, dark wood furniture, and a firm (comfortable) bed. One down-side of the dark wood everywhere was the lack of lighting in or near the closet. I was constantly afraid of leaving something behind in the drawers or on the shelves. The electric outlets in the room for charging cell phones and plugging-in laptops were not easy to reach, but the in-room safe was big enough for my 15" Macbook. Good things about the room: minibar was fairly inexpensive (2,20 euros for water) and free WiFi in the rooms. All rooms in the front of the hotel had small balconies overlooking the street with a view to Placa Catalunya down the street. My Wallpaper* guide to Barcelona mentioned that rooms 306 and 506 had extra space and a leather couch. I can vouch that 406 had the same extra space and couch. Nice and big, but a weird lay out in the long thin rectangular room. However, the fire escape map on the room door showed that most rooms were tiny. Be warned. Ask for one of the bigger rooms. As for the common areas, the bar area looked comfy although I did not take advantage. The breakfast buffet was great and included in my 300 euro room rate, so I can't comment on the value. I did not get room service, but I believe it was 24 hour service. Location-wise, it was quite convenient to Las Ramblas and the #1 underground metro line. And if you have to get to the hotel from the airport and there's a huge line for taxi's, the #17 bus from the airport stops just a block from the hotel (1,40 euros I think). (I usually do take the taxi, but in this case had to find an alternative method of transport!) All in all, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel – would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Dominey
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, very modern, clean and stylish in a great location, just of Placa Catalana. The communal areas with large white sofas are great to relax and sip a cocktail before an evening out. There is also a roof terrace bar that unfortunately was not open in Feb - a good reason to return again in summer! Our room was on the 4th of 5 floors, accessed via a glass elevator with dizzy views down to the bar area. The room was a fair size, not huge but fine for a weekend stay. There was a large bathroom with a deep bath (many hotels I've stayed in Barcelona have only had a shower or half bath) nice robes, slippers & toiletries. We couldn't get the temperature right in the room, it was rather warm throughout our stay - but couldn't be bothered to report it to reception so can't really complain! We had the room service breakfast which was a generous size, we didn't eat in the restaurant - although it looked very nice, with an outdoor terrace - so can't comment on the food. The staff were very helpful, booked us tables at restaurants, laundry and taxis. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Decor and a Fab Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBell
Reviews.Content: The Pulitzer is in a great central location with stylish decor, great art and friendly staff. Our room was well thought out with everything we needed including a safe. Great breakfast, cool roof top terrace and a bar that does a mean gin and tonic. I was robbed whilst shopping in Barcelona. I got back to the hotel and they helped me cancel my cards and call my consulate, as my passport was in my bag. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and supportive. It was very much appreciated - so thank you. I will definitely be staying at the Hotel Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “oasis”
Reviews.Author: MxUK01
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, well located in Barcelona, especially for arriving and leaving on the airport bus - only a few minutes dragging suitcases across Placa Catalunya. It's rated as 5 star - I wouldn't give it that - no facility to make a hot drink in the room and - what is it with hotels these days ? shower caps are like gold dust !!! Nice touch with the him and her bathrobes but I'm a small size 10 and the 'hers' was a bit tight. The whole place including the room was very 'boutique' in decor and 'bloop bloop' music , reminiscent of many spa hotels plays in the bar. I liked the man and woman boxes in the bathroom - love little things like that. The staff were pleasant and breakfast was good - and goes on until 12 at weekends ! Forgot to mention - the beds and pillows - are to die for - soooooo comfortable, slept really well despite the excess warmth. I agree with other reviewers that the south facing rooms ( as we had) are HOT and another little nigle was that the shower leaked all over the floor but if we had been really upset we would have reported it. I wanted to look at the roof top terrace but the lift didn't seem to want to go up there - shame, bet the views are brill. Overall - a very good 4 star hotel in Barcelona - bit expensive but good quality. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, good location”
Reviews.Author: Respilosa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pulitzer is very aesthetically pleasing. I'm a terrible snob about interior design, but could find no fault with the Pulitzer's tasteful decor. It made me happy. We were given the smallest room, which also had a large pillar blocking the middle of the space, but it was still an attractive, cozy, romantic place to collapse after a long day of walking. At 120 Euros a night, it was also a good enough value not to matter. Our one complaint about the room was the heat. Others have also mentioned it in their reviews of the hotel: the a/c doesn't work in the Winter, but the sun is strong enough on the southern side of the building that our room was unbearably hot unless we kept the windows open all night and the blackout curtains drawn all day. We weren't bothered by traffic noise, but a very light sleeper probably wouldn't do well with open windows. I recommend requesting a room that doesn't face south. The hotel's location off the Placa Catalunya is great for exploring all directions of the city on foot. The hotel bar is a very nice place to relax and have a few drinks. We also had a midnight meal there. The food was tasty, healthy and reasonably priced. The hotel charges 15 Euros for breakfast, but cheap and delicious coffee, xocolata and breakfast is available around the corner just inside the FNAC department store. Perhaps not the prettiest setting, but it's also not at all touristy, it's quick, and they do offer very good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gem in the Heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: IM_sl
Reviews.Content: Whatever most people said about the Hotel Pulitzer, it's true! I booked the hotel for my Jan trip confidently after reading many great reviews of the hotel and I was not disappointed. The location; at a quiet street off Placa De Catalunya, was a gem. This means safety especially getting back after dark as there would still be many people around. Most Metro and train stops were within easy walking distance including many tourist stops. Port Vell was a leisurely 15 mins walk.... The service at the hotel was excellent, they let us check in early when we arrived and greeted us whenever we passed through the lobby. Only gripe was that there was a fresh paint smell which permeated the room when we were there. The doors and walls were also a little too thin, you could hear when your neighbours left or entered the room. All in all, the location and the quality is value for money. Well worth staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pulitzer01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was truly great. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, the room was very comfortable and quiet and the location was ideal. If you are going to Barcelona, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kiwimango
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in Oct 07. I was very impressed with everything. The room was very spacious for a European hotel. Very clean and contemporary. While I was there, I believe that there was some co nstrustion going on, but they would only make a little noise during the day (when most of the time we were out.) We never ate at the hotel but I remember thinking that the breakfast was a little pricy. The best part of the hotel had to have been the location. It was absolutely perfect. We visited many attraction while we were there and not once did we have to get in to a cab except to and from the airport. It was right on La Rambla with excellent restaurant within very short distance. The staff at front desk were always very helpful when we asked for suggestions. Whenever I go back to Barcelona, I will definetaly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: robhSydney
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. It's very central for access to all that Barcelona has to offer. It is also has the bonus of being a couple of hundred metres away from the Rambla which can be a bit of a Zoo and very noisy if your hotel is right on it. The rooms were good and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in our package and it allowed choice of hot and cold selections so should cater for most. We loved Barcelona and even though it was January the climate was pleasant and not too cold. We looked at a number of hotels in Barcelona before deciding on the Pulitzer and believe it offers very good value for money for the class of Hotel. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Touches Mean A Lot!”
Reviews.Author: dublindec
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with almost all aspects of this hotel, but mainly the staff. Having chosen a trip to Barcelona as a special treat on proposing to my partner, the staff went above and beyond the call of duty. A box of chocolates in the room, a typed letter from the manager and an upgrade to a beautiful room combined to make my stay in the Pulitzer ever the more special. This is how I saw the hotel - Rooms – As stated we were upgraded to a Superior Room, which contained a beautifully finished bathroom, small lobby type area with leather sofa, nice double bed, and small balcony overlooking Plaza Catalunya to the right. The rooms had a flatscreen panel TV at the end of the bed, came with dressing gowns, slippers, minibar and the previously mentioned bathroom boxes. Hotel Location – Perfect. Situated on a side street off Plaza Catalunya which is at the top of La Ramblas. A stroll down to the port through La Ramblas would take no more than 15 minutes. Plaza Catalunya is also perfect for Tourist Buses, Tube station etc., being just 150 yards from the door of the hotel. Breakfast - All the usual fare – cereal, fruit, cold meat, bread etc.. There was also hot items – bacon, eggs etc.. Bar - The hotel bar is extremely ‘cool’ and is very much designed to ease you in or out of your night. It has plush sofas, a nice library area and some beautiful wines. Service – Check in was perfect, the room cleaning exemplary. My only small issue was that the bar staff could have been slightly friendlier. This is an extremely small note, and did not take from the experience. Overall – Beautifully styled hotel, with an ideal location. Staff (especially hotel manager) showed nice touches which will not be forgotten. Well worth a visit...will return!

Reviews.Title: “Winner All Around!”
Reviews.Author: hapasf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of our honeymoon trip for 4 days. It definitely had the best bed out of all our stays throughout Italy and Madrid. They were kind enough to upgrade us and even brought us complimentary cava and strawberries which was a nice surprise. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and nice. Slightly small, but not too bad. It was convenientlly located near the Ramblas and a metro station. We walked everywhere from here. I would definitely stay here again. Definitely great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: sfjonathan
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel on our honeymoon. We wanted a fancy, luxury place. We were not let down. We got upgraded to an amazing room. We were also sent truffles, strawberries, and cava as a welcome. The bed linens were soft, the bathroom welcome kits were clever and handy, and the location was perfect. The staff was great and helpful with every contact. We were happy to come back to this room after a day of siteseeing. I would stay here again. I would still be there if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but shame about the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: irishnomad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location for exploring the city. 10 secs from Place de Catalunya. Aerobus and tourist bus leave from/arrive to here so it was more than handy. If you're a shopping fanatic it's also a great area with both Cortes Ingles within feet of each other and Las Ramblas just around the corner. Some great small boutiques down the side streets here. When we arrived we were shown to a smoking room which didn't suit. There were no indications of preferences when booking on the site so we just assumed that it would be non-smoking. We went back down to reception and were given a new room straight away. Although we were asked if we had used anything in the room which I found a bit unnecessary as we had literally been there for 2 mins. Otherwise I found the staff courteous and pleasant. Overall the room was lovely. Great design in some areas and made the most of the space. Bathroom overall was nice but the only thing that let it down was the staining on the marble tiles as mentioned in previous reviews. The thing is that the bathroom was spotless otherwise but the staining probably looked worse that it actually was. I'm sure there's some kind of cream to improve this..... The new room we were given unfortunately didn't have the view of the previous one of the side street. Instead it looked out over the main street and the breakfast room/terrace. The main street was quite noisy but you soon got used to it. Also you could hear the odd peep from the other rooms and the hall especially when they were wearing heels! Breakfast was good. No complaints here. Room was nice and bright and terrace was lit up at night. It was while we were here that we realised where the music was coming from which woke us up each morning when we had the door open. Not great but we were getting up anyway. Lobby very nice too. Lovely rioja and great atmosphere. One of the only times I've had room service in a hotel and it was fantastic! We had the burgers and they were just what we wanted. Recommended if you're feeling a little tired and can't be bothered to go in search of food. I would stay here again but I would ask for a room on the other side of the hotel as to avoid street and breakfast noise and I would also hope that they had found something to improve the tiles in the bathroom just for appearances sake.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Lexicles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer in December 07. Considering it's location and style I thought it was fantastic value for what I paid. Rooms are a little small but very comfortable and clean and the bathrooms are well equipped with lots of little extras. We didn't eat in the hotel but did have drinks at the bar which were excellent quality (especially the wine) and very well priced. Quite a stylish hotel, small, fashionable and discreet, and brilliantly located just off Plaza Catalunya. Probably not what you'd want for a family but for girls shopping trip (us) or weekend away it would suit the bill very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, but...”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: You cannot control the temperature in your room. If you stay in the back of the hotel, where the rooms get direct sunlight, your room will be very warm (about 80 degrees). If you stay in the front of the hotel, you will not get direct sunlight and your room will be much cooler. Still, there is no individual temperature control. If the central heating is on, the entire hotel is set to the same temperature. Your comfort will be at the mercy of the person who has set the temperature, or the placement of your room to the sunlight. When we first checked into the Pulitzer we were given a room in the back of the hotel, facing the sun. Because it was near 80 degrees in the room (maybe even warmer), we didn't stop sweating. It was gross not being able to cool down. Later on that day Jose said we could move if the room didn't get any cooler (thank you Jose). So we moved to a room in the front of the hotel. It was smaller, but MUCH better. I prefer climate control and service over room size any day. The room in the front of the hotel also had a small standing balcony (which we were supposed to have had to begin with). To make the climate more comfortable we just left the huge windows wide open, with a big fan blowing the cooler outside air into the room. (You will have to ask for the fan, they aren't usually in the rooms). The hotel's heating system is so powerful that even with the window open on a winter night and a fan blowing in the cool air, it was never too cold. The temperature in the room got down to 65 but not much lower. If you are a person who loves warm indoor air, or perhaps has poor circulation, or a person who keeps your thermostat set to 72, you will love it! If you are a person who loves the ability to control the temperature: making it warm when needed and cool when needed, you will hate it. Because you cannot control the climate in your room. The location is great and right in the center of things. It is possible to walk nearly everywhere from this hotel. The hotel is literally next door to the Best Western Premier Hotel Regina (which appears to be run by Jose and the same team from the Pulitzer). Are the rates better there? Might want to check. There was also quite a bit of construction work happening at the hotel. On our floor there were missing ceiling tiles. The exposed rafters weren't so pretty to look at. My advice would be to make sure the pipes aren't exposed visually. See photos. The rooms are not sound proof. A couple times I heard people in the next room use the bathroom. And when we would shut our door I could hear something fall off the wall in the next room (the doors are heavier than the construction of the walls). It was no problem with us, we thought it was funny. But if hearing your neighbors use the shower or restroom bothers you, bring along some ear plugs. Also, the floors are not hard wood in the sense of having hard wood flooring like the rooms at the Bowery Hotel in NYC. They are inexpensive wood laminate. There were several spots in the room, halls, and on the elevator where the laminate was coming up or bubbling. The "man" and "women" boxes in the bathroom are a cute idea, unless you're two men, or two women. Then, of course, it isn't so cute. The bathroom floor could be cleaner (you can clearly see "stains" where prior male guests didn't quite make it into the toilet). The rates are not very high, but as the old saying goes: "you get what you pay for." If back in Barcelona I might stay here again if I had a cooler room in the front of the hotel. But I might try one of the nicer hotels in the Eixample area or maybe the Meridien. Within walking distance, Casa Calvet was great for dinner. And not expensive. On a whole, the food in Barcelona is disgusting. Everything is either fried, fishy-tasting (not in a good way) or covered in mayo. Hunting for a single vegetable or healthy dish is an exciting way to spend the afternoon. We did find a couple Tapas bars within a few blocks of the hotel that had one or two clean, healthy dishes. Tip: Skip the hotel's breakfast. You can get more food for the same cost (or less) at any of the tapas bars nearby. The blonde girl at the front desk is not good with customer service skills. I asked her if a specific tourist site was open for visitors (it was a bank holiday) and her response was, "I don't know...." then she just stood there and looked at me... She didn't bother to pick up the phone, make a call, and find out. (Jose, no worries - don't bother to respond about this. The excellent service of everyone else at the hotel made up for her lack of enthusiasm. ALL the other people were incredibly generous, friendly and great. Plus, Amanda is a genius.) I give this hotel an "Average" rating because it was average. It wasn't super great yet it was far from terrible. But I honestly feel it's right down the middle. It's a safe place to stay with a good bed -- and that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live in Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: CaminoGirl
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotels in the whole world. Unbeatable location, located 1/2 a block off of placa catalunya, truly one of the coolest locales in the entire world. It is possible to walk early morning or late at night and not be afraid, there is always action in this area, which is located just at the top end of La Ramblas, and the rest of the medieval city (barri gotic). It is a short walk down to the Mediterranean, alternately you could conceivably (we did) walk up to Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia or Mont Juic. You can get yourself fabulously lost in the beat of the city. DO IT! The hotel is modern and minimalistic, well designed & thoughtfully furnished... LOVE! The rooms were what you would expect, smallish, but what more is necessary when you should be outside exploring? Having said that, they are lovely and clean, with hardwood floors and black stone washrooms, flatscreen tv, beautiful wardrobes. Another touch was that the bedding was crisp and clean with a super comfy duvet. The cleaning staff were incredible, the rooms was sparkly every day, and she/he completely anticipated our needs and would leave us extra toiletries. The management were extraordinary. I have to give them a huge thank you because it was our honeymoon and they left us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room, which we found upon our return in the evening. Incredible service!! Lastly, the food was great. They have a few restaurants and a funky bar/lounge, as well as a rooftop lounge with great views. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: verdebug
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Hotel Pulitzer, and were very happy with our stay. The hotel had a modern, chic vibe - like so much of Barcelona - and it really suited us. We arrived around 9 am, bleary-eyed after an overnight flight. We had asked in advance if we could leave our luggage before checking in later in the day, but much to our delight we were able to check in right away. We were so grateful for this courtesy and the chance to have a hot shower before exploring the city! We enjoyed this exemplary level of service every day, and I think this is the true reason this hotel rates so high. The rooms were smallish but more than adequate, the bathrooms were lovely with lots of black granite, and there was ample storage space for our luggage. We had a room with a small balcony and two twin-sized beds pushed together to form a queen. Note to tall people: my husband and I, at 6'2" and 6'0" respectively, slept quite comfortably (though perhaps the jet lag had something to do with it!) The location in particular was fantastic, on a side street off of the Plaza Catalunya, a block from Las Ramblas and the subway. We loved the Hotel Pulitzer and I will definitely stay there the next time I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: R0bbie
