Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in Barcelona. We will definitely be back to the Pulitzer. The hotel staff were so helpful and friendly and able to answer our questions. Excellent help behind the bar with great suggestions of what to do and eat nearby. A most comfortable, livable and well designed room. Though normal European size, it seemed to go on and on. Lots of storage space, great bathroom with fascinating 'Man' and 'Woman' treat boxes! Even a step out, sunny balcony. Location, location! It seems that so many wonderful things are close by (Plaza de Catalunya, La Rambla, Barri Gotic) and with the T/10 ticket for the Metro, so is the rest of Barcelona. Once again, TripAdvisor steered us to the right place.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: nynygator
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay for 5 days at the Hotel Pulitzer in Barcelona. Location was perfect and on a nice quiet street near all of the great tourist locations and local neighborhoods. The lobby/check-in was easy and quick. Very friendly and also provided map/guidebook when I checked in. Very nice touch. Room was great, comfortable beds, good water pressure and clean. Even though the rooms are not huge, it was quiet and comfortable. Even a balcony to open and get fresh air and step outside. For my first trip ever to Barcelona, it was a great choice and provided a great place to stay in a wonderful city. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer Prize!”
Reviews.Author: gigi_glasgow
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a couple of nights for his birthday. We couldn't have picked a better hotel, the location is great; close to the metro and walking distance to all of the sites. The room has some lovely design touches, I really liked the modern art. Only one complaint, the bathroom floor could have been a bit cleaner. The bar area is great for a comfy night cap, great Cosmo's!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: olafuraj
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife came from Iceland to Barcelona to celebrate her birthday and chose the Pulitzer. From now on this is our hotel in Barcelona. I booked a romantic/celebration stay and it was perfect, from a bottle of Cava waiting in our room which was spacious and welcoming to booking a perfect meal at Quatre Gats restaurant. When we came back from the meal a hot bath was waiting for my wife with cava, strawberries and chocolate and the room decorated with roses, perfect. Front desk and all staff was perfect, they organised a masseuse to come to our room for a deep and relaxing massage for my wife. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front of House Team”
Reviews.Author: bobseylala
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for a friends 40th Birthday in December. Great location, excellent front office team, especially Amanda, great bar. The rooms were on the small side and if I stayed again would book a superior as these were bigger. The lighting in the bedrooms and bathrooms does need improving as not easy to do make up in poor light. Overall we had a great weekend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steph2727
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Pulitzer for 2 nights prior to our cruise. We were able to check in at 9:00am which was great. Room was a nice size and bathroom was also very large. Loved the sink. I thought the "women" and "Man" toiletries were kind of silly. Beds were comfortable and room was very quiet. We did have a problem with the lights as they flickered but we just turned them off. The TV seemed a little small and could have been placed higher on the wall. Closet space was very good and they had a safe in the desk. The gizmo to open the balcony door was hard to use. I imagine that due to child safety there is no handle on the door. The hotel is in a great location next to the Regina with Starbucks on the end. Front desk was very cheerful and friendly. The lobby area was very nice and the candles at night were a nice touch. Would definitely consider staying at The Pulitzer when we return to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer - Will Definitely be Back!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieO22
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pulitzer is a lovely hotel. The staff is extremely helpful and the rooms are clean and a pretty big size for Europe. The bar in the hotel is very nice with great wine. It is a fantastic place to hang out before dinner and we met some really nice people there. The hotel is also in a great location. Close to everything but far enough away from the real craziness. The only small complaint is that there was no extra blankets in the room and I woke up a little chilly one night but that is a very little criticism during an awesome three night stay. A special note – they had the nicest toiletries available that I’ve seen in a hotel. They have separate boxes for men and women. It’s adorable. I plan on going back to Barcelona soon and when I do, this is the hotel I plan to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer after a cruise. I found the hotel charming. It has a great decor. The front desk was friendly and helpful. We arrived at 730A and they did all possible to get an early checkin. The bell staff was very helpful The room was large and had a couch. The bed was very comfortbalbe and nicely decorated. The shower had a powerful stream. They have an excellent Plasma televison. We had a great view of the street. The location is great as it is at the northern tip of Las ramblas. I highly recommned taking the tourist bus around the city which is on the Plaza Catyluna which is outside the front door of the hotel. The tourist bus stop is just a short walk away. The airport bus is next to the tourist bus. Both, great deals. The hotel does not have coffee in the room and does not offer service till 700A. That would be the only draw back. They failed to tell us that if you go down to the lobby you can get a cup of coffee before 7. Since, it is a boutique property it didn't offer a gym facility. I had booked a great rate, but the dollar was taking a beating at this time. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyDell
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night weekend stay on LastMinute.Com and chose the Pulitzer Hotel from the good write ups from Trip Advisor. All I can say is dont even worry about looking at other Hotels. The Pulitzer is PERFECT. Great Location Friendly Staff Stunning Rooms Brilliant Shower The finishing touches make it really special Perfect for a weekend break away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. Friendly helpful staff. Excellent bar. Trendy decor. Rooms are well fitted out, beds comfortable, cool bathrooms. Good value for money. Location is perfect, within walking distance of all major attractions and Metro stations. Loads of nice shops close by. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will go back again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: cafoodie2
Reviews.Content: I loved the Pulitzer! I read the reviews, looked at their website and booked it. It was clean, modern, and comfortable. We loved that it was on a semi quiet street and close to everything. The desk clerk who checked us in wasn't very friendly, but the other staff members were fabulous. One clerk provided us with dinner suggestions of places he frequents and asked about it when we returned. Loved the internet access next door and really enjoyed the roof terrace. My next trip to Barcelona will most certainly be at the Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel with good postion”
Reviews.Author: NeilandBarbara
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night yesterday on buisness. Very modern, obviously recently renovated hotel in spot on location next to the Ramblas. Hotel room small, fairly typical of a city centre. Very modern fitments and everything you required. Great flat screen TV, mini bar, digital safe. Cool bathroom and a great selection of cosmetics. His and hers kit - Nice touch. I also found the room hot and cold not cool it down , but after some tapas and a fine red, I slept fine. Good points - perfect loacation. Very modern. Typical smallish city room, but very well appointed. Bad. Non working AC. Yes I'd recommend it. Reasonably priced for the location. Very modern. Overall better than many I 've stayed in. N & B

Reviews.Title: “Overall A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmctrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in November. Upon arrival you are given an excellent book of tourist routes and restaurant reviews by the staff . This was very helpful. I had a room on the 4th Floor with two twin beds pushed together. The room was long and narrow with a nice bathroom (bath/tub combo). The toiletries were very nice (shampoo etc, nice creams (face and foot) and toothpaste/brush). There was a plasma TV and minibar. The bed was very comfortable. I did find the hotel very clean. The location was great. It is at the top of the Placa de Catalunya so it is close to the sites and to the aerobus. I was able to walk along the Paseo de Gracia at night for tapas and during the day I headed south to enjoy all the great sites. The Bus turistic is right by the hotel (a minute or so). I did not eat at the restaurant as I preferred a small breakfast so cannot comment on the restaurant. With respect to the noise issue mentioned by other posters, the room did face the courtyard where the bar is located. There was some minor noise from the bar (plates being stacked) but not enough to bother or keep me awake. After a certain time in the evening it was clear that the staff were making every effort to be quiet. If you are a light sleeper you could request a room away from the courtyard but quite frankly I was so tired from all the sightseeing and I confess the great food/wine in Spain that I fell asleep right away! The only issue I had was that the safe in the room did not work. To be fair the staff at the front desk called the technician right away and it was replaced the second day while I was out and I was able to store my passport etc for the rest of my stay. I would recommend this hotel to those wanting a nice, clean central hotel in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gettingthere-7
Reviews.Content: Only back today ,Was my first visit to barcelona,birthday surprise for my partner so i was very keen to get a good hotel and boy i wasnt dissapointed. We arrived early and room wasnt quite ready,so we left our cases with very helpful gentlman at reception and headed to hard rock for lunch When we got back we were allocated our room immediately,room was a lot more spacious than i thought it would be,all rooms have balcony,lots of wardrobe space,well stocked mini bar,lots hot water,very comfy bed,bathroom sets with razor,toohbrushes,footcream,combs,tissues etc were nice, i really really missed that there was no kettle in room,and my only complaint was that water in restaurant was not hot enough for tea,yet it was in bar,all staff were extremely helpful,without been intrusive and very friendly. would i stay here again ...YES without a doubt would i recommend to best friend,DEFINITELY keep up good work pulitzer

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service (and patience!) by Reception Manager”
Reviews.Author: civetta11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights prior to Mediterranean cruise, booked Superior room for parents and Standard twin room for brother & myself. For the Standard room we were allocated a room with handicap facilities (we were told the hotel sells this room as a standard room). We were offered another room where the 2 single beds were placed close together with a gap of no more than 4 inches, which isn't the most convenient for adult brother & sister. We were shown another room which also had the 2 single beds close together, but we appreciated being offered the choice. In the end, the Reception Manager suggested to move the bedside table in between the 2 beds and even moved the furniture himself with the help of a junior staff. All was sorted within minutes. A good selection of breakfast is offered in the airy, bright room of the restaurant. Location of hotel is excellent, close by Plaza Cataluyna/ Ramblas. The hotel arranged for a flamenco dinner show (surprisingly good) for us one night and a private city tour with an exceptional English-speaking guide. All in all, an excellent stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jade97
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night based on tripadvisor reviews. Didn't disappoint. Very good hotel. Location - Like its sister hotel Regina Hotel, it's just 2 minute walk from centre of town Plaza de Catalunya, very close to the tourist information centre and tourist busstops. Room - Very comfortable and stylish room. The lightswitches were a bit confusing. Toiletries were splitted into a men's package and a ladies' package. Oddly enough some of the toiletries (like toothbrush) that were provided by their sister hotel Regina aren't available in this room. Service - Very good. When the porter delivered my luggage he explained all the facilities in the room to me. Check in and out were very smooth. Food - Breakfast was decent, altho they opened a bit later than the specified start time. They were doing some refurbishment on my floor so there was some noise during the day. At night there were no noise and was very quiet. I've enjoyed my stay here and would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: raha38
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel!! Clean, trendy, smart, relaxing, excellent staff who were polite, friendly and keen to help, gorgeous food (breakfast spread is amazing - make sure you're hungry). I can't rate this hotel highly enough! I'll be sure to return. Not cheap but worth every penny :-)

Reviews.Title: “An unplesant stay”
Reviews.Author: jteegar
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stay in this hotel after returning from a 12 days cruise and were truly disappointed. I had booked this hotel because it was Trip Advisor's 2006 "Top Pick". Although I had contacted the general manager and asked for an early check in, we waited until about 1:00 before we were able to check in. We found the lobby to be very shabby and when finally showed to our room there was construction on our floor (which was never disclosed when I contacted the general manager about early check in) The room was especially small, the beds (twins) were pushed up against the window, what I thought was a balcony room ended up overlooking the top of other buildings and the room was "really" narrow which I understand is typical of European hotel rooms but this was beyond small. The bathroom was so narrow that you couldn't fit two people in it, although that would have been difficult since there was only one sink which kept clogging up. The resturant was not open for dinner and didn't open until 2:00 for lunch, so we were forced to find something else. Although the staff was helpful there seemed to be a lot of confusion when we asked for help. I confirmed out flight for the next day, but found out later, after we arrived at the airport four hours early, that the reservation had changed. We stayed in another hotel the first night we arrived in Barcelona and that was a wonderful experience and were disappointed that this was the way we ended our trip. The most laughable thing was that they allowed "one" kleenex for two people in a little sample box marked for women, guess the men don't need kleenex. The lights were difficult to figure out, the noise level up to about 6:00 pm was really loud. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It was truly a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: CumbrianTourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the hotel as tourists and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. It is in a great location just off the Placa Catalonia. Although very central we found the hotel quiet and were not disturbed by noise at all. We ate one meal in the hotel restaurant which was very nice. We found all the hotel amenities very satisfactory and the staff very professional and helpful. We would definately recommed this hotel and would stay there again if we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Fun City”
Reviews.Author: andrewkoto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon. The Hotel was nice and clean and the rooms were spacious. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is located at the top of Las Ramblas and near the stops for Bus Touristic (which is great for sightseeing). The one issue we had with the hotel was the noise. This has been mentioned in other review before but we didn't think we would have a problem with it. On our third morning we were woken up by what sounded like people packing up and leaving. It souded like they were in our room. It is obvious that this hotel does have a slight noise issue. Other than that, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mruts
Reviews.Content: I booked the Pulitzer on their Website, after reading the reviews here. It is in a terrific location, on a safe street just steps off the main plaza. We had some minor problems, though. Our first room had non-functioning air conditioning and a dirty toilet. The staff switched us to another room that evening, which had the best shower I've ever experinced in Europe, except that it didn't drain, almost to the point of flooding the bathroom. That was fixed the next day, so the staff did their best for us. We found the stylish recessed spotlights throughout the hotel to be quite dim, especially entering the hotel from the sunny street. We loved Barcelona, and although I'm not sorry we stayed at the Pulitzer, I'd try another hotel next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Briallant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SisterMargaret
Reviews.Content: 5 friends on a break - I booked with the hotel directly via their website and must praise Noemi who was able to answer all my questions. The hotel is modern but yet the foyer, reception and bar area is full of atmosphere. Agustine in the bar is a lovely, mannerly young fella and nothing is any problem. The hotel sets high standards in respect of housekeeping and the staff are all extremely friendly. When I return to Barcelona I will definitely stay at the Pulitzer and have no reservations of recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel - perfect for a Barcelona stay”
Reviews.Author: shinobirastafari
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Pulitzer. We made two separate visits during our trip to Spain. Both rooms were beautiful, the staff was helpful, all services worked according to plan, the restaurant and bar were excellent. The rooms were (in our opinion, but we're from SF) spacious, particularly the bathrooms. An extra bonus point for geeks out there: the WiFi service actually worked -- at all times! The location made it easy to get around Barcelona, being a 2 minute walk to the Metro, and/or providing easy cab access. It is refreshing to see an expensive hotel actually meet or exceed all expectations. This hotel would be our first choice if we returned to Barcelona, and we highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: billingw
Reviews.Content: Our room was nicely appointed with very nice linens and very clean. The "stone" bathroom sink and floor looked a little tired and were the only parts of the room that needed attention. The desk staff was excellent. The lobby lounge was beautiful. The location is outstanding: one block to Aerobus and one block to La Rambla, both of which touch the Plaza Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: ruienc
Reviews.Content: I booked the Pulitzer based on Trip ratings, and while many aspects of the hotel were in fact as described there was a big issue for someone that was looking for a long weekend with no kids crying and awaking up in the middle of the night We booked the romantic package. At check in we kindly asked if we could get a quiet room, we were told by Andrea that the room was quiet, but it wasn't... the 102 room in the 1st floor was right over the hotel bar so you can imagine the noise at night. On top of that the vaccum cleaner used in the morning is sufficiently power to wake up all guests in the flooor it is being used... Apart from that that was very important for us, all other aspects were ok, just to mention some: - location couldn't be better, and the decor is great - breakfast was closed to perfect - Andrea gave us great tips about directions + restaurant tips - room was very modern and clean (but somewhat narrow) To cut a long story short it is a very nice hotel if you are not looking to sleep much, or to sleep at all... Nothing that a double door between bathroom and room couldn't solve for the rooms located in the lower floors above the bar...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CarbonOffset
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a conference trip after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. The reviews were accurate - the hotel staff were the best I have encountered in a long time. They were helpful at all times, were able to recommend restaurants and bars to suit us and our plans, gave accurate directions, lent us an iron and ironing board, and kept the rooms and common areas very clean. The location of the hotel is excellent - it is a short walk to Las Ramblas and the Barri Gotic, a moderate walk to the shopping in L'Eixample, a department store/supermarket (El Corte Ingles) is within 3 minutes, and the metro line to the CCIB conference centre runs from Passeig de Gracia station, about 5 minutes walk away. As we were there on business, computer facilities were important. Wireless internet is free in this hotel. We were able to use the printers in the Hotel Regina next door. The room was long and narrow compared to other hotels, but there was enough space. The desk is only a fold down door on the cabinet in the room corner. There is a room safe. Many of the rooms open onto the atrium that stands above the lobby bar. This was noisy on the weekend night only, until about midnight. The front door of the room did not block out noise of the cleaning staff or neighbour's doors opening, but we have had similar (and worse) problems in other hotels in Barcelona. Breakfast cost 15 euros. I ate at one of many cheaper cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pulitzer OK - But Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: I booked the Pulitzer based on Trip ratings, and while many aspects of the hotel were in fact quite good, there was a couple of things that cause me to rate as only average. To details. We booked a superior room, which does in fact have quite a bit more space than a regular room. All rooms are somewhat narrow and long. The nice flat screen TV's are mounted at the end of the bed, but you have to duck around it to access the other side of the bed. Best part of the Pulitzer is the decor, which is very hip and cool. Our room had great artwork very nicely framed and presented. It also had a great huge sliding door from the room to the bathroom, which had a very modern feel with full natural stone sink, floors and such. A nice leather couch was part of the superior room layout. Only downside was either due to poor selection of stone for the bathroom, or poor cleaning, hard to tell which. Unfortunately the lovely bathroom sink area had round glass stains all over it, and the floor had many water spot stains by the tub. This marred what could have been a true 4 star hotel room. There was also what looked like coffee spill stains on the wall by the bed. This could all have been easily fixed by a coat of paint and buffing of the stone in the bathroom. The lobby and bar on the ground floor is very nice, with white leather everywhere and a nice feel to the place. The location of the hotel was perfect for sighseeing in Barcelona, and just off the major thoroughfare enough so that noise was not an issue. Other than the bed being too hard for my liking (my wife loved it), sleeping was no problem at all. Other than Andrea, who was exceptionally helpful, unfortunately the rest of the front desk staff was clueless when it came to assistance. One desk member suggested a cab was necessary to get to a restaurent that was clearly only a 10 minute walk down one of the largest and most travelled streets in the city. The front desk staff seemed very young, and not very well trained. My advice is to seek out Andrea for recommendations and assistance. Although the Pulitzer was good value to money, and had a great location and many positives, I would look for something else next time I was in Barcelona. This is mainly due to the unfortunate staining of the bathroom surfaces and the walls. This is really not acceptable for a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service”
Reviews.Author: johnSomersetEngland
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Pulitzer for a 4 night break after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. I had booked a superior executive double but on arrival there had been some problem and the room was unavailable, so for the first night of our stay we were given a free upgrade to a suite, with a complementary bottle of Cava thrown in for the inconvenience, The suite was fabulous but so hightech that even the bath and shower needed a tutorial before it could be used. The TV was defunct but an immediate replacement was installed.Back to earth ton the second day to the room we had booked, which again was of a very high standard and this time with more familiar bathroom fittings The staff from the duty manager to the bellboy were extremely helpful throughout our entire stay, and are deserving of the highest praise for their cheerful courtesy

Reviews.Title: “loved the pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: gemsy23
Reviews.Content: a modern, very clean hotel in a superb location close to all the cities attractions. the buffet breakfast was of a very high standard and the staff were all extremely helpful. would recommend and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “wonderful celebration”
Reviews.Author: ultonian
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to the reviews on this site. Amazingly all my expectations were met and more. We spent 3 nights at the Pulitzer and it was wonderful. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was included and great. We enjoyed a beautiful meal in the restaurant and were disappointed that it only has limited opening. This is a wonderful boutique hotel; the rooms are a bit small but wonderfully laid out, decorated and maintained. The roof top terrace is fantastic for relaxing in the late summer/early autumn evenings. My wife and I can fully recommend the romantic celebration. It was a bit of fun which added to the celebration of our 20th wedding anniversary. It is a lovely touch and well worth the small charge. While we did have a problem, the staff and management worked to resolve it and in the end we were satisfied with how it was handled. Overall this is an excellent hotel and I cannot recommend it highly enough; location, cleanliness, quality, all in all a wonderful base from which to enjoy Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Melon7777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer for 2 nights at the beginning of August with our 3 teenage children. We booked because of the great reviews on TA so I just wanted to write in and say it really was as great as everyone says it is. We had 3 lovely rooms next door to each other with views of the street. We all loved the smart modern decor and everyone slept really well. We ate in the restaurant both nights and the food was very good - the breakfast had plenty of choice too. The reception staff were very helpful and ordered 5 seater taxis for us (most taxis only seat 4) and the location of the hotel was perfect for sightseeing. We have told all our family and friends what a lovely hotel it is and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fabulous, Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedBook21
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about Hotel Pulitzer. It was perfect in everyway. The room was stylish, clean and quiet. The beds were comfortable. The location was central and had easy access to all of the tourist attractions. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The roof top terrace was extremely nice and a great place to grab a drink and the end of the day. As well, don't miss the restaurant. We ended up there after getting lost going to another place. The steak was one the best meals that I had on the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Strong Recomendation”
Reviews.Author: GTaylorNYC
Reviews.Content: Dear Fellow Travellers: Greetings -- please see the letter below, which I wrote to the owner/president of the Hotel Pulitzer and which describes a recent incident my girlfriend and I encountered on the road to Barcelona and how the people at this hotel made a very bad situation much better. We are frequent travellers but have never encountered a hotel quite like this one, which is why I am posting this letter for everyone's benefit (my first posting ever). Happy trails! G Taylor September 25, 2007 Dear Mr. Roig: Please forgive us for not speaking Spanish. On June 21 of this year, we were attacked by bandits on the interstate just outside of Barcelona . The thieves cut our tire, held us up, and stole my girlfriend’s purse containing her passport, wallet, credit cards, cash, and irreplaceable personal items. One of the worst experiences of either of our lives. We quickly rushed to the nearby toll booth to call the police, but were told by the attendant to go to the police station in the city square. We parked the car close to the square and frantically ran into the Hotel Pulitzer to ask to use their phone to cancel our credit cards and to ask directions to the police station. As you could imagine, we were very shaken up and very emotional, especially as neither of us had ever been robbed before. Mr. Luis Carasa and Mr. Jose Sanchez calmly and professionally asked what had happened to us, and then allowed us to use the hotel’s staff phones to cancel our credit cards, free of charge and undisturbed. They also brought us refreshments and helped us to calm down. Mr. Carasa and Mr. Sanchez then offered to allow us to stay in the hotel at a special rate (we learned later that this took some juggling). This was both of our first time to Barcelona, and the mugging is an isolated event, but the kind actions of your Mr. Carasa and Mr. Sanchez afterwards went a long way to make such a bad occurrence better. They both went out of their way to help us in our time of need. We are both very grateful to these two gentlemen and the Hotel Pulitzer for the kindness and exemplary service we were given during such a bad situation. Mr. Carasa and Mr. Sanchez are a shining example of the many good things about Barcelona , and because of their actions, we would gladly return to Barcelona and would gladly stay in your hotel again (but where else?). Sincerely, G Taylor and J Sander

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: Jellycaa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a two night stay in the Hotel Pulitzer and only one word can describe the trip..........Fantastic !! We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a warm smile and very helpful receptionist who spoke excellent English. After checking our booking and explaining where the restaurant etc was for breakfast, we were given a map of the city and a book containing details of restaurants, bars and things to see. The reception and bar area were spotlessly clean and very stylish and a cool haven from the hustle and heat of outside. Our room was just as nice. We knew from reading previous reviews that the rooms were not big but to be honest it may have been smaller than some but was beautifully decorated in neutral shades, had comfy beds, plenty of wardrobe space and a lovely bathroom with bathrobes, slippers and toiletries. All of the staff we met were helpful and friendly with none of the stuffiness you sometimes experience in city centre hotels. I will be recommending this hotel to everyone i know and will definately stay here on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “pleased with the pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: jessie12
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. It was located near but not on the Placa Catalunya and La Rambla, so not loud yet very convenient. Breakfast buffet was nice, and you could eat outside on the patio which was great. I had read that some of the rooms were loud, so we called ahead and got a room on the 4th floor not overlooking the central courtyard so it wasnt noisy. I had also read that the rooms were small, but I didnt find that - the room was long and narrow as opposed to square, and the bathroom was also large. Great lobby/bar area and great rooftop patio. In fact much preferred this hotel to the casa camper where we also stayed, not only was it much cheaper but seemed brighter and more open. Would stay at the Pulitzer again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gedwards100
Reviews.Content: Much like previous reviewers have said the hotel and staff are great. Location is fantastic for those new to Barcelona. I always think that service levels when something goes wrong is what defines good service. We were travelling with our 1 yr old son and, having booked through Venere I had included instructions that a cot would be required. Being slightly nervous that these instructions would not be passed on I emailed the hotel directly 2 months before our stay. When we checked in i was obviously disappointed to find there was no record of the cot and no cots spare. However the desk staff were very helpful and by the time we returned from our afternoon out there was a cot set up in our room. So the right result and without too much additional stress, so thankyou again to the staff for sorting the mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Delta1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early September 2007. It's a gorgeous hotel - beautiful lobby, lounge, roof top bar. The room we stayed in was very nice and comfortable. Compared to other hotels in this price range, we found the room to be a bit small and were kind of navigating around our luggage as there wasn't a luggage rack or good place to store it other than the floor. The lighting system in the room was also a bit of a mystery....they were all set up on a dimmer kind of system but we could never quite figure out how to turn the light off we wanted without trying every light in the room. But the bed was very comfortable and the location couldn't be beat. A word of caution - and this is not intended to be positioned as the fault of the hotel - but watch your belongings very carefully. My husband and I stopped by the front desk to check a dinner reservation one night on our way out the door. My husband walked up to the desk and I took a seat on a bench / ottoman just off the lobby. I put my purse down beside me on the seat and watched what was going on at the desk. Within 2 minutes my purse was snatched without me noticing - and it was literally right beside me. The hotel is located just off Plaza Catalunya and a thief could easily cruise through a busy lobby and make their way out the door without anyone noticing in a matter of seconds and disappear into the crowded Plaza. Everyone knows to be extra careful out on the streets, but just a reminder to not let your guard down once you hit your hotel - an easy thing to do when the hotel is on the high end like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EwanHongKong
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Pulitzer on a short city break. The hotel was in a brilliant central location but was quiet and peaceful despite being near the amenities. The decor was fabulous and the room very nicely done. I would definitely come back if I ever visit Barcelona again. The General Manager of the hotel is very hands-on and clearly cares about the hotel and its guests a great deal. Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CityBreaker_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Barcelona - what a fantastic city to visit. We stayed in Pultizer hotel and have to recommend it highly. Firstly the location is ideal for touring the city. Easy access to most main attractions including Las Ramblas (which I think is slightly over rated). We got a run through best places to visit (and places to avoid) from a very helpful porter. The hotel was clean but does need a freshen up of paint in places. We had a room to the front of the hotel with a small balcony. The room had everything we needed and was very comfortable. There is a nice bar on the ground floor and also a roof top bar. Both are nice and relaxed and worth a visit. Our only disappointment is the price of breakfast (not included in room price) 15 euro each which is a bit steep, especially with so many little cafe's around the corner. But overall a great experience at this hotel and we will be returning on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “No place like Pulitzer!”
Reviews.Author: isajolicoeur
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in town! We were there for a romantic break, and everything was incredible: the staff was sooo friendly! Always a smile a word...! The hotel in itself is so stylish and trendy! My husband works in hotel business and he was so impressed by the good service and welcoming staff! The rooms are very well decorated; it is very quiet, no noise from the street, so you can sleep late in the morning! As it was for a romantic break just after our wedding, we took the "romantic package", it is 55 euros, and you'll have a big red bow on your door when you arrive, champagne, chocolate, strawberries, and last but not least, the bath with roses petals and candlelights!!!Amazing! We stayed 5 days, and we always have a drink at the roof bar! So quiet, relaxing! The bartender were great and they do wonderful mojitos!! I was ill the 4 th day because of food intoxication (nothing to do with the Pulitzer), and they were so warm, they called a doctor and they always ask for my good health! It was amazing! And the best thing for girls: you croos the street and you have Topshop!! you crossed the other street, and you have all the good shops; Zara, Sfera, Stradivarius, Bershka!! Really great!! I would go nowhere if it's not the Pulitzer!!! I will thank all the staff, especially the roof bartender, and the check in desk staff !!Thank you for this lovely break!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: amysa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at Hotel Pulitzer. Location: Cant be beat, in a safe area near la ramblas but far enough from the noise and crowd. Near a lot of shopping, convenient to public transport. Room: room not very spacious. However, interiors very nice, amenities very interesting (different set for male and female, female complete with lip gloss?!), water pressure good, Breakfast: did not change much the whole week we stayed in the hotel, but variety quite sufficient. Breads were fresh and good selection, cereals, freshly squeezed juice, hams, fruits, etc. Staff: Front desk was very friendly, speaks good English. Daily makeup of room. No complaints. Overall, this hotel is a very interesting hotel, very different from the big chain hotels. Liked the interior so much i got quite a few ideas from this hotel. Try the hotel website for rates before booking with other internet sites. Got a better deal booking directly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, welcoming, chic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emmapkq
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from staying in this hotel and can't imagine a better place to stay in Barcelona if you want a fabulous location,very clean, smart and modern surroundings with friendly staff and great value for money. The rooftop bar is perfect for a night cap, the restaurnet does lovely food and a more than satisfactory breakfast buffet and it is a great place to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the streets of Barcelona. One tip, if you are booking through the hotels website make sure you make it clear what type of room you want. We booked best rate for Queen/Twin and ended up in a twin. The receptionist said we needed to let them know which one we wanted which the website didn't tell us. Probably common sense but check to make sure. Otherwise a fabuous stay will deifnately come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: khaled82
Reviews.Content: this hotel is amazing because of their friendly staff the know everything they smile all the time they are helpful and kind what I like in this hotel is the amazing location of it its 3 minute walking to the dirty rambla if u like this place all the shopping area is around us metro too , the room is modern and nice but its very small i can’t walk around it , the lighting system is complicated a lil bit for the first time but with all this features it does not matter note that u have free wi-fi on all the rooms which is amazing there is a nice bar terrace

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: davecorbo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 11:30am and our room wasn't ready which was to be excepted before 12. We managed to book in and they let us leave our luggage behind the reception so we could have a wee walk around to get our bearings. The hotel's decor was very nice, simplictic, the way we like it. We also ventured up onto the roof terrace which was a beatiful retreat to get away from the hussle and bustle of city living. We took a couple of bottles of wine from the local supermarket up there and the glasses from our room as we were a bit skint by the end of our trip, hee hee. The staff opened the bottle for us too which was nice as we didn't think we would be allowed taking our own food/drink up there. The hotel bar was a joke, very slow service, expensive and the staff don't know how to make the cocktails. That is probably why it was empty. Go to the Zurich Bar round the corner from the hotel at the top of The Ramblas (Very Nice). Lots of seating outside with reasonable prices. The location of the hotel couldn't be any better to be honest, extremely central. The rooms themselves were perfect, not a bad word to say about them. I would definately recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, but slightly gloomy.”
Reviews.Author: JSTPK
Reviews.Content: Central location and easy to find. Reception staff slightly haughty, no-one mentioned rooftop bar, so that still remains a slight mystery to me. The room was very clean and plenty enough room for a city break, but everything was so dark, obviously a style thing, but nonetheless slightly gloomy., especially as our view was onto a concrete wall and then C and A sign, so no natural light. I was travelling with my daughter (19) and felt that maybe it was more of a couples hotel. Have to say a little noisy in the mornings as rooms are situated around a central atrium which means the sound is carried upwards from the lounges on the ground floor and through the central hollow of the building through the upper levels of the sleeping accomodation. But on the whole very classy, reasonably priced accomodation for centre of big city and any faults are probably based on personal style taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of location, style, service and value”
Reviews.Author: SWP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night after a cruise. The hotel is very stylish and perfectly placed and the staff goes out of their way to make sure your stay is a pleasure. The rooftop terrace has a great bar where you can while away an hour or two in the evening. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and were steered to La Gavina down on the watrfront. EXCELLENT!! All in all would recommend this hotel for just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite place in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Ddkent
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic - just around the corner from Las Ramblas. Like most European hotels, the rooms are small, but they are comfortable, modern and clean. Reception staff spoke English and we were able to make ourselves understood to other staff who didn't. One tip: In Australia, a "double" room means for a couple, ie one big bed. In Spain, it means a room for two people, ie twin single beds. Thankfully, the staff were aware of this and asked us at check in, then changed us to another room. Very happy with every aspect of our stay. Did I mention the fantastic location?

Reviews.Title: “Fab Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: FreqtravelBristol
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend visit to Barcelona and stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer. The hotel is amazing great decor, interesting art work, huge comfy white sofas in the bar lounge and on the roof top terrace, the lighting at night on the terrace and the chilled Ibizia type music was amazing and very relaxing. The food in Visit was excellent and the waiters informative and chatty. The rooms are very comfortable, again in the style of the rest of the hotel dark floors, white bedding. good air con and all the added touches. When I visit Barcelona again I will definately rebook the Pulitzer for its great ambiance and ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “So Suite......”
Reviews.Author: MarkC51
Reviews.Content: Ssshhh........here's a secret. The Pulitzer has a Suite, and it's fabulous... Despite several hundred positive reviews, no one appeared to have stayed in anything other than a standard room. We wanted something different , as it was our 10th Wedding Anniversary. I looked on the Hotel website and noticed they had 1 Suite (only one) in the Hotel, and enquired about availability. It was fortunately available, and exceptional value at 310 Euros per night. We arrived on Thursday afternoon after a decent flight. The reception staff were very cheerful, and I had paid for a 'celebration package' for the room. This entailed roses, champagne, chocolates, breakfast in bed, and a nice hot bath to await us. We were given our key and shown to our room. Upon entering my wife (who suspected nothing) , was blown away. The room was beautiful, decked out in chocolate browns , whites and greys, and luxurious. The room was very large, with a 4 poster bed in the centre. It really could not be faulted. As if we weren't already delighted, I pulled back the curtains to reveal an amazing Terrace/balcony, which was just decadent. It was very large, decked in solid wood throughout, and had loungers , remote controlled awnings, plants and a large table. We felt like royalty. The bathroom also didn't disappoint. Whilst quite narrow, they had made best use of the space with some natural light, and both a wetroom and a bath. All fixtures and fittings were of the highest quality. There are numerous other things that I could mention, including a fabulous Denon Speaker system throughout the suite, which allows you to connect your ipod and enjoy music in the bathroom, bedroom and terrace. There's also a 42" plasma tv, and various books. Breakfast was good, pretty standard fare, but nice. The location is perfect, a stones throw from the market square and las ramblas. If you are looking to stay in Barca, and want to treat yourself, look no further. Believe the hype..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nosuchthing
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel on a hot Barcelona day and was greeted by the friendly staff at the front desk and the cool air from the air-conditioning. We had to wait 1hr before check-in as we arrived at 1pm but they were able to look after our baggage while we sat at the lounges near the bar for drinks. The Hotel: Contemporary and sleek. The Room: Clean, contemporary design, and fairly small. The really odd thing about the room we received was that it had a pillar right in the middle of the room. There was also no desk and no where to put your luggage other than on the floor which ends up getting in the way of your path between the door and the bed. I am sure this is not the case for all the rooms. The other odd thing was the pillows (or lack of). It was basically like sleeping on the mattress it was that thin. Bathroom: was fitted with marble. They have a shower in the bath tub. They don’t supply tissue boxes in the bathroom which I thought was odd, but they supply you with his and her toiletry packs. Location: Excellent. Around the corner from La Ramblas and shopping area. About 5 minute walk. Staff: Very friendly and helpful but would help if they could speak more English. Other: Free WiFi! No gym or pool, but they do have a roof top bar which was cool. Overall, we enjoyed the stay there and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Keep going back......”
Reviews.Author: Smudger_by_the_Sea
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller to Barcelona, I first found the Hotel Pulitzer in the Winter of 2006 - and now I keep going back. The hotel is a very stylish boutique property - lots of attention to detail of style and comfort Some people have complained about the room sizes. If you are spending 12 hours a day in your room then fair enough, but for somewhere to relax, sleep and chill out in Barcelona, then I can't fault them. I have stayed in many hotels across Europe and beyond, and such room sizes are not unusual (don't expect American suite style rooms with 2 queen beds - this is historic Barcelona!). Just 3 weeks ago I decided to give another hotel a try, just as a change (close to Port Olimpic), and within an hour wished I had returned to Hotel Pulitzer. It's location is just off Plaza Catalunya - giving you great access to lots of shops, restuarants, sights and the famous Las Ramblas. Airport buses and taxis are in abundance within a few steps of the hotel. The upshot is, give this place a try and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: moveabout
Reviews.Content: Our primary motivation for selecting this hotel for our weekend trip to Barcelona was the location and the expectation it had modern / comfortable rooms (as per the website). We booked through the hotel website (EUR 170.00 per night for two nights during July 2007) and felt quite satisfied with the price. We arrived and were warmly received at reception. The common area in the lobby / bar / restaurant were all very welcoming though by the time you walk up and down the first floor you can tell the hotel is 'squeezed in what is a relatively narrow building'. We were given a room on the 4th floor (I guess one of the cheap rooms??) which was very very small (I think most of the standard doubles are this small) but had most amenities you could think off. The bathroom is very narrow but had a very comfortable shower. The surfaces in the rooms (simple wooden furniture that passes as modern furniture) was losing its luster with small cracks in the veneer / paint. None of this is paritcularly distressing because we weren't intending on spending much more than nights in the room. Though we were content with the room we discovered much to our dismay that the worn feel of the room carried through to the lighting (which was a real pain to use, using gradient lighting knobs), where we could find no way of turning off our night lamps (they have no switches on the lamp, rather a wall gradient switch). We took out the lightbulb, went to sleep, and complained at reception. They were very quick to accomodate us in an upgraded room on a higher floor (which was still small but much more comfortable) and threw in breakfast on Sunday. Generally greatly relieved that the hotel had such a positive customer attitude we went off for sightseeing and shopping. One last problem occurred on Saturday night where the hotel's air conditioning broke down. We were told on Sunday that it was a general problem (not only our room) and we were fortunate it hadn't been a sweltering day (Barcelona can get hot and humid in summer). Our overall impression was great location, with quality of the room and its facilities hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jellyb1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came back from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Pulitzer this morning and I loved this hotel so much that wanted to write a review straight away. The hotel was absolutely fantastic. It is very modern and luxurious and spottless with very comfortable surroundings. There was free internet access in the room so we took our laptop along and really enjoyed being able to email home and sends pictures to all our friends and family to make them jealous. We used room service on several occassions and found the price very reasonable. The food was absolutely delicious and at a very high standard. The location of the hotel was fantastic. You could walk to a great number of attractions and a 1 minute walk from the main shopping street. We also used the many metro stops around the hotel to travel to different sights such as the Segrada Familia and found it so easy to travel around the city. We both agreed one of the best parts of this hotel were the staff. They were so helpful and couldn't do enough to make our stay an enjoyable one. They always recognised us and said hello even though it isn't a very small hotel. When we ordered a drink in the main lobby bar the bar staff seemed horrified that we would carry the drinks to the table ourselves and insisted on bringing them over. They were all just great. If you have any doubt about staying at this hotel then there really is no need. If I ever go to Barcelona again I will definately be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A cool haven in summer.”
Reviews.Author: dawabbit
Reviews.Content: HOtel Pulitzer is a calm retreat on a hot day. The cool neutrals of the air conditioned room were welcome. Even though our room overlooked a main street it was quiet, due to good soundproofing. The location is absolutely perfect! Not on the Ramblas, but right off it, near a central square etc., with fantastic shopping. Note: this hotel is not partnered with other hotel Pulitzers in Europe, so it must be judged on its own value. The lighting system was difficult for me to learn, although I am not a quick study in things like that. The bed was very, very comfortable and we slept well. A few strange things: Since the room was very tiny, there was one possilbe hazard for a person who gets up, half asleep in the middle of the night to use the bathroom. To get there, you need to go around the bottom of the bed (if you sleep in the right), and in traversing the 18 inch wide ""pathway" to the facilities, is a wall mounted TV right at head level. I recommend turning the tv so it is a flat as possible so as not to break one's nose walking right into it. The only other quirk I found was that the "female" of the duo in the room was alloted a pack of two (yes two), tissues per person. Bring your own tissues. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would return there without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel for a special experience”
Reviews.Author: JamieHerts
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews have stated the hotel is very stylish and well located, I chose it for a special trip for my partner and our parents particularly as my partner and I travel often on business and were looking for something special. We were not disappointed with the rooms (although small) or the design and layout of the hotel which was excellent. The staff were friendly and the bar staff rather good looking! The roof top bar was a wonderful place to relax. The main problem was noise from the bar and the room next door. The atrium in the centre of the hotel is a great feature but the noise of glasses being placed on the marble bar and the music down stairs carried straight through our 5th floor bedroom door which is a shame as there is no noise from the street at all. The wooden floor in the room next door carried foot steps clearly through the wall and we could hear their TV as well as they did. For a hotel of this quality we were annoyed with the disturbance that we haven't really experienced any where else on our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Way to Go!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladylyme
Reviews.Content: I returned from the Pulitzer a couple of days ago and can't wait to go back. I hadn't been to Barcelona since the late seventies and wasn't expecting it to be a city with everything, having had a love affair with Italy for the last 30 years. Next time i will go for a week at least! And stay at The Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamleco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb of this year with two friends of mine, a girly trip! And i was very impressed by my stay. The hotel was so gorgeous and modern. They serve the best caesar salad! Also I left a pair of new jeans in the wardrobe and when I contacted them on my return to Dublin they posted them to me free of charge, nice touch! Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: jillybeansan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Pulitzer with our two sons. The rooms are quite small and minimally furnished -- for example, there isn't a stand-alone desk, rather, a fold out work station. The tv is tiny. There are no tissues in the bathroom -- you have to call housekeeping to bring you small packets. And if you want some ice, you have to pay a service charge to have it delivered or go to the bar to get it yourself! Pretty unbelievable for a supposedly 4 star hotel. The staff were nice although their English wasn't very good. On the positive side, the hotel is very well located and has free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish and well-run”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Pulitzer. The people behind the front desk were very helpful, especially Amanda, who is just lovely. We really appreciated Julian Rubio's advance e-mail restaurant reservations and advice. What a big help he was! We especially must thank him for his recommendation to eat at Passadis d'en Pep and Sauc, which were just wonderful. The location was terrific, as it was close to the Ramblas and Boqueria but far enough away from the madding crowds and noise. The major Metro lines were all nearby. I had a rear third floor room that was nicely furnished, very clean and comfortable. My friend had a second floor room over the restaurant and she felt it was a bit small and noisy, but overall liked the hotel. The bed was very good, the flat-screen TV well positioned and the free wireless internet access was reliable and fast. My only (very) minor criticisms: the soap in the bathroom was too small and did not lather very well, and the bathrobe was too small for most men, I would think.. The crowd was for the most part American and stylish, but not snobby or snooty. The espresso in the lobby bar was great. By all means go!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: jandon771
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. I selected it based on the Trip Advisor reviews, and we weren't disappointed. We only stayed for one night, arriving at 0800 after a trans-Atlantic cruise. Understandably, the room was not ready, but the front desk staff cound not have been more helpful, offering sightseeing and dining advice, and the promise to call our cell phone the moment the room became available. Great location, with 5 star restaurants mixed in with reasonable alternatives in the immediate area. Luigi the bartender was very nice and entertaining, and the entire staff was very professional, yet extremely nice. The room was not large, but clean and nicely decorated, and it met our purposes. I look forward to returning to Barcelona, and will make the Hotel Pulitizer my base. Don

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: torizoe
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Pulitzer and loved it! The location was perfect! I was traveling alone and felt safe walking back to the hotel at night. I found the room to be plenty big. The bathroom was lovely with a nice big tub. And tons of hot water too! The towels are HUGE and wonderful to wrap up in after a long hot bubble bath. Heaven! The staff was excellent! Very helpful and kind. Nice television but sadly only CNN and SKYtv in English. Of course, I didn't go to Barcelona to sit and watch television so that is really a very minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very friendly and very helpful. The hotel was modern, the rooms were not very spacious but we didnt spend that much time in the rooms. The lounge/bar was very comfortable, my only complaint was the rude bar tender who always seemed he had something better to do than take our order. AC was very strong which was much needed coz we went during a heatwave. The location was excellent. the coridoors had hardwood floors which might have woken you up if people were moving suitcases. Also the bar downstairs is in the hotel and it could get a bit noisy especially on the weekends but it was tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall positive experience at the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pulitzer several times for the following reasons: 1) Great location .. central to everything, but quiet enough to relax when needed. 2) Reasonable price/offers available, especially when you consider the location. 3) Very nice breakfast and service ... outstanding coffee and (rich) hot chocolate! 4) Friendly/helpful check-in and desk service. Happy to assist before or during your stay 5) Rooms clean ... turn-down service done regularly. The negatives which prevent me giving it 5 stars are: 1) Small rooms and small bathrooms. Can get very tight when staying with a partner (ok as a single stay however). 2) Air conditioning ... 2 out of 3 stays had problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better staff”
Reviews.Author: A_Cubed
Reviews.Content: Just had a 3 night break in Barcelona - my first trip to Spain. Staff at check-in were very helpful, particularly at identifying where to go (and where not). Room was a little smaller than i expected for the price (750 euros) but great in every other respect. One thing to be aware of - there is a bottle bank opposite the hotel that gets emptied each morning and woke me up - we were on the first floor. If you want to know where to eat in the evening, just ask the front desk and they can organise everything for you - and you do need to book as restaurants get very busy in the evenings. Ate at the hotel one night which was OK (but very quiet) Congrats to all at the Pulizer especially Andrea at the front desk and Luigi in the bar - I'll certainly be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Urbantravelfox
Reviews.Content: Booked for an extended weekend break. It was a very modern clean hotel, staff were very friendly and professional. We were personally welcomed by the General Manager for breakfast. We would recommend the bar. the restaurant and breakfast. The room was spotless and in very good condition, plasma television in the room. Perfect location just off placa de catalunya, ideal for all sightseeing, bus tours etc. Surpassed expectations and was easily up to its four star rating. Would definitely stay again and fully recommend to any potential traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel05
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed our first trip to Barcelona staying at this beautiful hotel for 3 nights over the Easter break. Easy to find, we transferred from Barcelona airport on the Blue Aerobus to Plaza Catalunya from which the hotel is only a few minutes walk & is equally close to the metro station so is in a great central position. Our room was just as we had seen on the website, always a relief ! It felt very luxurious and came complete with a 6 ft bed, beautiful crisp white linen, a gorgeous bathroom with a powerful shower and an ample supply of toiletries every day ! We appreciated the bedside control of all lighting within the room! The glass lift makes an unusual feature & as we were on the 5th floor, gave us a lovely view of the bar area below. All the public areas are modern with very comfy white leather sofas & chairs. We enjoyed a relaxing pot of tea here after a busy day sightseeing ! Breakfast was buffet style with lovely fresh fruit, cooked breakfast and the usual cakes & pastries. More than enough to last until lunchtime! Each & every one of the staff we came across were very helpful, professional & polite. Initially there was a slight confusion on the type of room we had booked so we were shown 2 different rooms for us to choose which one we preferred. You can't ask for more than that ! This is definately one of the best hotels we have stayed in & we wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone. As for eating out in Barcelona, if you love fish then head to Port Olimpic for a range of restaurants. We had a lovely meal at the El Cangrejo Loco overlooking the mediterranean, a vey romantic evening as the night fell. Barcelona is a mix of old & new & as the beach is within an easy metro ride, it makes for an interesting & contrasting city break destination.

Reviews.Title: “terrific location”
Reviews.Author: blatt
Reviews.Content: terrific location.nice boutique hotel.rooms are very narrow and i would not recommend if you are very large.staff very helpful and accomadating.would stay again

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: StewartToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Pulitzer for a weekend in March, and I can honestly say it was one of the best overall hotel experiances I have ever had. The hotel itself and the rooms are beautifully designed, love the art deco! All staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable with tourist and restaurant information. Location of the hotel is also spot on. 5 stars to the hotel and I would definitely recomend it to anyone travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeWatson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pulitzer for 2 nights over the easter break and was extremely satisfied with my choice. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the interior of the hotel is aesthetically pleasing, clean and modern. The double room was comfortable and more than satisfactory, and the location of the hotel was very convenient during our stay. There's a good selection for breakfast and the bar area on the ground floor is nice to relax in during the evenings. I'd really recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Barcelona, especially on a first visit, as you feel at home right away and the extra you might pay here compared to other hotels in the city is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely Hotel...shame about the weather!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deborahjayne
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Hotel,stayed for 4 nights (2nd -5th April 2007) and really enjoyed our stay.The Pulitzer is in a great location for exploring Barcelona with Metro stations close by. We had a standard room which was exactly as seen on the web-site,maybe a little small for some people but we found it to be fine.Bathroom and bed-linen were very clean,comfy beds,great maid service. The only negative aspect to our stay was the weather....it rained nearly every day but was lovely in England!!!! Would recommend the Pulitzer Hotel to any-one going to Barcelona,go on book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, central location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Phil M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night, but saw enough to know that this hotel deserves all the good reviews it gets. The staff are excellent, they went out of their way to help our group with our request for service at unsociable hours (!), and reception was impeccable. I thought my bathroom was a little tired, but everything else was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cook21
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for five nights in a superior room, and as soon as we arrived we loved the decor and homely feel to the hotel. Our room was perfect for a young couple - chic and modern but also romantic at the same time. The location at the top of the ramblas couldn't have been better, and the staff (especially louis) were extremely polite and helpful. They made our stay thoroughly enjoyable, and always greeted us with a smile. I would recommend visiting a few of the restaurants in the guide given to you at the beginning of your stay - we visited 2 and they were both lovely. The bar food was also of high quality, although unfortunately we didn't get a chance to try the restaurant. I will definitely be visiting this hotel again and my boyfriend and I both agreed it is the best in Barcelona (having stayed at the hotel arts on a previous visit)!

Reviews.Title: “All that one can require”
Reviews.Author: RomanCitizen
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at this excellent hotel. The location cannot be faulted, 1 minute from Plaza Catalunya, 10 minutes from the Cathedral etc., room was clean and modern, breakfast what one would expect from this type of hotel, and most important the staff were excellent and gave the impression that they wanted to help. If I go back to Barcelunder I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Central But Not Too Central”
Reviews.Author: SPIRALALLY
Reviews.Content: Only 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas which is a very vibrant part of town. Found excellent Irish pub called "Scobies" and bar man was full of very usefull information. Excellent location within walking distance of most of the main attractions and shops. Wonderful restaurants 2 minutes walk away from hotel heading away from town. Hotel was very confortable with very attentive staff. Just 1 snag, last night it rained and we could hear the rain all night dripping onto the veranda. Alison & Peter from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “this place is FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: jdarby
Reviews.Content: The pulitzer is a cool, well designed, beautifully decorated hotel in an great location just off the Ramblas. The rooms are modern and beautifully decorated, if a little small, and the bar and communal areas lovely. The staff were fantastic in helping us source difficult to get tickets for Barcelona football club. they also went out of their way to answer any questions we had about sight seeing. I totally recommned this place if you want a not too big (impersonal) and not too small (no facilities) hotel. It's great. It's only 20 mins form the airport too.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant weekend break!”
Reviews.Author: fyffes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer on 8th March for 3 nights. Everything was thoroughly enjoyable, and of the best quality. The room was extremely comfortable, breakfast selections were plentiful and appetising, the bar had a pleasant atmosphere, and the staff were always friendly and very helpful. Each evening the reception staff recommended and booked excellent reasonably priced restaurants away from the usual 'tourist traps' . The position of the hotel was ideal - just off Placa de Catalunya, so convenient for sightseeing buses or just for an interesting stroll around. La Rambla was 3 mins walk away. There was some traffic noise outside, but this was easily shut out by the windows, and efficient air conditioning in the room meant that there was no need to sleep with them open. All in all, a brilliant weekend break at The Pulitzer which we can recommend to you.

Reviews.Title: “Makes me come back for more!”
Reviews.Author: tjicheng
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, but most of all a beautiful hotel experience! A hotel with adorable interior design, the best of breakfasts has it's absolute strongest asset in it's superb staff. So friendly, so warm, efficient and professional. I have actually never come across any of it's kind. Of course there were small defects - a leaking tap, tricky flush device and a blinking lamp in the room. But hey, free internet, unlimited amounts of Jamón Iberico for breakfast and a divine bed keeps a smile on your face. Comes with the highest of recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel – Couple of Quirky Things!”
Reviews.Author: mhcooper
Reviews.Content: Just came home from 2 weeks in Barcelona staying at 2 different hotels – both 4 star. The Hotel Pulitzer was by far the nicer hotel. I stayed there for 5 nights and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is rather modern and is located in a fantastic location. We walked the city North, South, East and West and the hotel could not have been a better starting place. If you take the subway you are 2 steps from a metro stop and the airport bus stops 2 steps away. There is also a Starbucks on the corner for those that need their coffee fix! We vacationed with friends so I can comment based on two different rooms. We were both on the 3rd floor. We were in the back and my friends in the front. As many Barcelona reviews indicate the street noise was obvious. If you are a light sleeper you might want to look for a hotel with a lot of floors and request a room high up! We had no trouble sleeping, but our friends were light sleepers. Also, the weather was unseasonably warm and the air-conditioning seems to only work in the summer. We opened up our window and were pretty comfortable. The look of the hotel is very modern and with all modern furniture you get a lot of deep cushions and it takes a while to get comfortable. The lobby and lobby bar has a lot of room to sit and relax or have a drink before and after dinner. We did not eat in the restaurant so I can not comment on the food. As for the quirky – the rooms are very comfortable – we had a queen size bed – but the room is long and narrow. On the wall at the foot of the bed is a flat screen TV that is easy to hit as you walk by it. Also, it may be a small thing, but there are no soap dishes in the bathroom so you never really know where to put the soap. Finally, the light switches are very hard to figure out. It took us 2 days just to figure out how to get the bed side table lights to stay on while the rest of the lights are turned off. In fact, our friend’s room there was some strange problem with the lighting controls as the left bed light was turned on by the switch on the right side while the right bed light was turned on by the switch when you walk in the door. All in all we loved out stay and would highly recommend the hotel – just be prepared to be surprised when you turn on the lights.

Reviews.Title: “ok, am sure there is better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: pedro_on_hols
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights including a weekend. I think that I would defintely look elsewhere if going to Barcelona again. I thought the hotel staff were friendly and the hotel location was great, however, the hotel is fraying at the edges and could do with some maintenance, my door handle fell off a few times, as did my towelrack and the powerpoints all fell out. Upon checkout I did mention to the receptionist that the air conditioning wasn't working, she said that as it was winter it wasn't connected, although the heating was. The website says that you can control the temperatue of your own room - obviously only in summer. My room was so hot that I was sleeping with the balcony doors wide open. I wasn't even staying in a room that had any daylight. Another thing, whats the point of the TV, when there was only ONE engligh channel - sky news. I know european hotels seem to be extremely tight about these things, but really..... Last thing, breakfast was pretty bad for a hotel of this standard, and on the Saturday morning, when it appeared they had had a tour group stay, they ran out of food, and took forever to restock. The website is very misleading, my room didn't have a bath and the shower didn't even have a soap holder.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well located”
Reviews.Author: cgmtraveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel! Stylish and just a few steps from Plaza Catalunya and Ramblas. Good service and breakfast. Great relation cost x benefits. I'd definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff and location!!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jenni1979
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights with another couple, we absolutely loved this hotel and had a fantastic time. The hotel design is cool and funky and the bar is a great place to meet for drinks in the evening or coffee in the morning, we felt really at home! The staff were very polite and helpful. I really cannot fault this hotel, it was perfect. The rooms aren't totally soundproof as you can hear doors shutting occasional but I think you get that with every hotel! if you really object take some earplugs and you will have no problems at all I certainly wouldn't let it put me off staying here again! Note to travellers beware of pick pockets in Barcelona especially on the tube, they're very very quick!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dawhitters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pulitzer in mid-December for one night on a EUR120 rate booked through the hotel's website. The hotel is nicely decorated, with well-designed rooms. Our room, on the street side of the hotel, was very quiet.. Be aware though, if you book a rate that is for a twin OR double room, your double will be two single beds pushed together, rather than a proper queen/king. The staff are very friendly - even the maids - and generally spoke English well. Front desk staff provided good restaurant recommendations with accompanying advice (e.g. "don't eat paella at night - you won't sleep well"). The location can't be beaten, right off Las Ramblas, but still in a relatively calm street. Only one thing really caused me concern. When we checked out, we asked a staff member to call us a taxi to the airport. He did this very efficiently, which was great. When the taxi turned up, the driver took our bags, put them in the trunk, and then went to talk to the staff member who had called him. This seemed a bit strange, since the driver already knew we were going to the airport. It looked to us as though the driver gave the staff member money, although it was done discretely. When we got to the airport, about EUR8 of "extra" charges were added to the meter (the charge normally used for tolls, etc). Not speaking Spanish well, I didn't want to argue, but something weird was going on. In total, the rate was about EUR10 more than going that other direction. I can't help but wonder if the driver pays that staff member to call him, and then passes the cost onto the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design, excellent location, but not soundproof”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed at this hotel on Jan 8 and 9, 2007. I booked this hotel via the hotel website, which is www.hotelpulitzer.es (or www.epoquehotels.com) and got a very good rate: € 125 for a twin room including breakfast, excluding taxes (7%). We highly appreciated: - the excellent location (just off Plaza Cataluña): near bus stops for Aerobus, Bus Turistic, metro/train Catalunya. In the middle of the shopping area (Exaimple / Portal del Angel), and close to all tourist attractions. - the exquisite service: high level of service in the hotel. They are really friendly and helpfull, both in reception area, as in bar and restaurant. - the design: very stylish hotel.
