Are areas are very trendy and nicely decorated. - the hotel size: small hotel, so more personal service, no crowded public areas, no buffet queuing at breakfast What we disliked: - Rooms: although the rooms were very nice and the space was well occupied (rooms are rather small -> deep, but narrow), you have all amenities: flat screen, domotica for the lighting, minibar, bathrobes, safe, desk with wifi/asdl, a lot of toiletries in the bathroom. BUT, now the down-side: the beds are rather small and uncomfortable and the walls are paper thin, so you here everything from nextdoors. Fortunately, it's a small hotel, so you don't have too much disturbance. others: - breakfast: Buffet was OK and quality of food good, but this is the smallest buffet I have had in Barcelona so far. Nevertheless, there was enough choice. Enjoy your stay at the Pulitzer!

Reviews.Title: “A liitle disappointing”
Reviews.Author: suzanneBowdon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over New Year. Great location, very stylish hotel with helpful staff. We felt the rooms could have been a little cleaner but the beds were wonderful. Breakfast was overpriced (15 euros) for the quality; whilst the fruit and bread products were very good the cooked selection was poor. Had dinner once; 3 0ut of 4 of us thought it was dreadful although the wine was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: maliv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than expected!!! In the center, close to the bigest shops and to La Rambla, with very helpful staff, we booked the romatic package through their website and we had the breakfast included (very good) and a bottle of cava for free! If you like the modern decoration, you will love it. The standard room is not so big, but if you store your clothes in the closet and put your suitcases under the bed, you really feel like home!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cameranel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Pulitzer in December 2006. It is in a fabulous location just off Placa de Catalunya therefore very convenient for the subway, tourist buses and the shops. The hotel has very modern decor in black and white, which is reflected through the foyer, bar area and dining room. The bedroom was very chic with comfortable bed and the bathroom was sumptious. All the towels were soft and white, all the accessories were included, in case you even forgot a toothbrush. I was well impressed with all that! We had breakfast in the hotel and was well impressed with the variety of food on offer. I'm not sure how much the breakfast was, as ours was included in a very good rate we had. I'm sure it would be worth it though, whatever it is. My only problem was we were on the first floor overlooking the main entrance of the hotel; deliveries started at 5.30AM to the hotel and neighbouring shops so sleep was hard to come by once I was awake. The staff were wonderful, friendly, polite, helpful but also a little cross that I didn't ask for a quieter room when I remarked about the noise when we checked out.. So if you stay here and you are a light sleeper ask for a back room! All in all though a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central, noise problem, not handicapped accessible”
Reviews.Author: anonymous1140
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located. It definitely has an internal noise problem especially on Wednesdays when the bar is heavily occupied. The noise level coming from the bar on every Wednesday is unacceptable and makes it impossible to sleep. And we were in a quiet room located of the bar! If you are over 1.50 meter asked for a non handicapped room!! (See below.) The hotel shows pictures of suites next to stating the price for normal rooms in Jacbson hotelbook so you find your normal room to be a lot smaller and without a couch. This hotel presents itself as one with rooms for the handicapped and fully handicapped accessible. Well we were in such a room and as we work with the handicapped and design rooms for them on a daily basis we can tell you it is not!!! The shower is inaccesable as the guiderail blocks the entrance. Almost impossible to click it up as it is very stiff to handle. Next to impossible as you can only operate it with one hand. Shower head no higher then 150 cm (we measured it!), so if you are non handicapped but over 1.50 meter taking a shower is not easy and washing your hair proves to be a circus act, bending over like a Chinese contorsionist. The shower door consists of three separate parts already for non handicapped almost impossible to close. And how you should do that even sideways, we do not know. No chair in the shower! The shower itself lies some 5 cm deep, which makes it inaccesible with a wheel chair and you should enter and leave it sideways. Without a lot of assitance undone. The toilethandrail is only on the left and blockes the washing basis partly in combination with a waste basket whcih you can move but will be put back by hotel personell. Behind the room door there is a steep ramp. Opening the door and passing through requires some strong assitance. Watch out not to fall as the going doing part cannot be seen as you enter (the first time). And the parquet makes it very slippery. The only mirror in the room is ritght on the ramp so unusable. Wheeling around the room with a wheel chair is impossible as there is too little room. Behind the bed only some 40-50 cm. So you cannot reach the other side of the room and the light switches located on the other side. Trying to reach them over the bed is also not such a good idea for the handicapped as the beds then slide apart on the slippery floor and you might end up between them on the floor. (Futhermore they only operate with dipswitches that require a college degree to operate.) Also entering the balcony proved to be impossible for the handicapped. So desk and safe are also unreachable. Hanging your clothes: impossible as the door cannot be opened due to the fact that the wardrobe is blocked by a chair in front of it. This makes it even very unpractical for non-handicapped. (moving the chair is no option a there is too little room and it will be put back by personell on every occassion.) We left some of our comments at the hotel and gave them permission to contact us but they never did, so obviously they do not care to make any improvements. Normally we do not post pictures but in case we make an exception to clearify our point. We wonder how they can avertise this as handicapped accessible. By the way Barcelona is only accesible for the handicapped in some places. Sometimes you need to walk down steps to reach the elevator for the handicapped....

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: dafos27
Reviews.Content: We originally booked this hotel via Clarion Hotels, but the hotel was sold before we made the trip. The new owners honored our rate without fail. The Hotel Pulitzer is on a side street off Placa Catalunya. The hotel is very clean in the lobby, restaurant, bar, and in the rooms. Although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable. There was a huge closet to store your luggage, many shelves and drawers. You can pack all your clothes away if you're here for a week or more. The bathroom was equally large with a nice large granite sink and the shower has sliding glass door. The door to the bathroom does not open on a hinge, but slides on tracks, which was not obvious (initially). Toiletries are provided such as shampoo/conditioner, shower gel, razor w/cream, hand lotion, comb, toothbrush, robes, disposable flipflops, shoe shiners, and cotton pads for makeup. Way more necessities than most hotels provide. We had a balcony with two door french doors that looked down into the street. The A/C and heat worked fine and the rooms have a safe and LCD television. The room we had was on the second floor, close to the street so the noise level was louder than normal for most hotels. In Barcelona, trash is picked up at all hours of the night, but with the doors shut and the A/C on, it was not an issue for us. If you require complete quiet, you should not get a room on the street side or near the bar area. The hotel staff was very helpful with side trip arrangements and getting our taxis. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The internet is available next door at the Hotel Regina for free. There are only two connections, so you might have to wait. The terrace on the top of the hotel was not open due to construction, but we did spend some time up there enjoying some views, but moreso the weather. Lastly, the hotel is centrally located to where all the action is. We walked to all the restaurants we ate at and it is a two minute walk to the Catalunya Metro stop which is one of the hubs of the metro system. Also, very close to Las Ramblas which is one of the main streets in Barcelona. You can't possibly go wrong with this hotel. Hope all this helps in your travels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: stewartrimkus
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel I've ever stayed in. The decor is beautiful. The location is perfect. My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and will return many times in the future. If you're into modern, stylish, elegant hotels, this is perfect for you. Great staff, great price.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaxon41
Reviews.Content: We loved this property. It has a wonderful location just off the Placa Catalunya. From our balcony we could watch the Placa. The decor was lovely -- deep browns with crisp white linens. Interesting art, a unique bath with stone sink, great water pressure, nice amenities, including scuff slippers. And the price was reasonable -- we used the Clarion Hotels site to book. We didn't use the restaurant or bar, but they looked lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: willismuir
Reviews.Content: I rate this place!; friendly and fun, great food and drink. Prices not cheapest in town but offer excellent value for money. Plenty of space, excellent english speaking staff. A great place to stay. Thabkyou.

Reviews.Title: “cool and funky”
Reviews.Author: ASheila
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Barcalona and we were unsure of the differant districts. However after getting off the 'blue bus' from the airport at placa Catelunya we were just across the square. The location is on a side street off the main square and great position to see all the city. The interior is very designer with a glass panel on the lift looking down to the bar. The rooms were clean but the bathroom could have had that extra clean as there was grime on the skirting and edges. Unfortunately our bathroom had a broken shower sliding door (as in, it wasn't there) which took away the wow factor, otherwise it is a lovely hotel to stay in. We didn't eat there at all so unable to comment on the food. But the bar staff were excellent! We also took note of a previous review and asked for recommendations for places to eat and each of the suggestions were enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Terita
Reviews.Content: Situated just off Pl Catalonya the Hotel was excellant value for money, quiet yet close to the action and made our holiday. The room was of a high standard and immaculatly clean. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful in booking tours or restaurants and freely advise on all tourist matters. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: julesfromSomerset
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the clarion pulitzer with my mother last weekend, cannot recommend it enough. The hotel was very quick to find from the placa cataluna(where the aerobus stopped). Everywhere was an easy trip on the tourist bus or on foot from here. Yes the rooms are a bit small but i did not go to Barcelona to spend my time in the room! Every thing was very clean, and the staff were all friendly and helpful. the rooftop terrace lovely in the late evening to unwind with a glass of wine. Breakfast was excellent and the breakfast waitress was lovely, she did have some awkward customers to deal with one morning but she coped with a smile on her face. We had an evening meal on the night of our arrival and that was well prepared and fresh tasting. All in all i would say a very good base for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christi_R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pulitzer Hotel for around a week at the end of August 06. I am from the US and in my mid 20s. The hotel was in a great location, just steps from the Placa Catalyuna and Las Ramblas and right near the metro stop. Since it is on a side street, the hotel was quiet. It is a perfect spot if you want to be right near the action, but not in the middle of it. It is walking distance from shopping in the Barrio Gotico and restaurants on the Paseig de Gracia. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful, and spoke English. They even helped us map out a road trip. The room was a good size, the bed was a comfortable queen (which is hard to find), and the bathroom was modern and a good size. The hotel itself is modern, and has the feel of a luxury hotel with the personality and service of a small hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona. I reserved the room through Clarion's website, and got a good rate. My only complaint about Clarion is if you book early and then need to cancel a day at the start of your trip, they will reprice your entire reservation. So if you book early, but may need to cancel a day, book two reservations on their website. We stayed at another hotel during our two week stay because the hotel was booked a few days, and all and all this was our favorite. The only thing missing was a business center with internet. However, I believe they have wireless if you bring your laptop. Barcelona is a great city, and the Pulitzer was top notch! I would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGW
Reviews.Content: Date: 08282006 till 09012006. Reviewer: Holland - Fam. Wolff. We had a marvelous 5 day stay at the Pulitzer Hotel which was offered us by our daughter on behalf of our 30st Marriage Anniversary. The hotel is located in a quiet street close to the Placa Catalunya where it all happens. Startpoint for Bus Turístic (blue and red line) and subway stations nearby. La Rambla round the corner.The hotel has a relaxed ambiance. Rooms (AC)are clean and neat with nice bathroom and TV. Rich breakfast buffet. Nice bar.The employees are all very willing and helpfull. This trip was booked with a VIP-arrangement (Taxi, Barcelona Card, Bus Turístic all for 2 days included). Wonderful formula. This is a very good start to visit the city of Barcelona. At the end of the day take a cafè americano at Bar Zurich round the corner of your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stylish & central hotel”
Reviews.Author: npm123
Reviews.Content: Unlike most city centre hotels the Pulitzer is great value for money with friendly and helpful staff and clean comfortable rooms. As said in previous reviews the rooms are on the small side but well designed and perfect for a city stay. The lounge/bar area is has a nice atmosphere and the cocktails are excellent but the bar does close at 12pm. We had breakfast included in our package and this is well worth doing as it costs 15euros per person otherwise, although the breakfast selection is good. We ate one evening in the hotel as my wife was not well. The staff went out of their way to organise a plain pasta dish just for her when they realised she was not well.( not difficult to create but it was the thought we were impressed with). The food in the restaurant for dinner was good but is not cheap compared to other restaurants in the city. One thing to be aware off is parking. We had a hire car, having driven up the coast ,and the hotel parking is in the underground public car park next to the hotel. This cost was 25 euros per day and this was a discounted rate for the hotel !! Overall we were impressed with the standard and would definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you like late 1990's minimalism style design”
Reviews.Author: Jillette
Reviews.Content: My review of the Pulitzer is probably biased by the fact that I spent the 3 nights before my stay there at the Hotel Colon, which has in my opinion the best location in central Barcelona. Yes, the Pulitzer is a triumph of design, but the location, on one of the dull streets off Catalunya is seedy at best, and the hotel lets itself down in a number of aspects. First point to note is that if you have vertigo, or just a pretty severe fear of heights, then this is NOT the hotel for you. The glass lifts had me quaking in my boots, and the waist high glass railings which look out over the ground floor bar on each floor were enough to make me feel ill. I also wondered at the sense of the waist high railings - very little to prevent the intoxicated leaping over. The rooftop terrace is nice, again once you don't have a fear of heights, however the bar never seemed to be open although the hotel literature said that it opened from 8pm. The rooms are fashionable and comfortable, although the overall black and white aesthetic gives a rather clinical lasting impression. The bathroom was also a good size, with plenty of toiletries, but the sink and shower really lets the hotel down. The sink, of a freestanding marble square style WOULD NOT DRAIN! If for example, you washed your teeth, the sink would fill up and then take twenty minutes to drain. This problem must have existed before our stay, so I'm very surprised that the hotel placed anyone in the room. The showerhead also could not be removed, which reminded me of public swimming baths. But, for those for whom alcohol is key, the bar on the ground floor is lovely (though smoking), and the strawberry daiquiris will take some beating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights over the weekend, with ten friends. The staff were friendly and helpful, all the time. The bar prices were good, and the breakfast first class. The bedrooms were compact, but had nice quite air con, letting me sleep through the hot nights. The location was fantastic, by the plaza. Would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: caza
Reviews.Content: M partner and I stayed at this hotel in July and would highly recommend to everybody. Hotel is clean, modern and airy. The staff are very friendly and will go out of their way to help you. Rooms are smaller than most hotel rooms but are airy, bright and clean and beds are comfortable. Location is perfect, just off Ramblas on a quiet street with everything near, great for shopping, restuarants etc, and you have free use of the nearby Holmes Place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gary_MO
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - just a short walk from Las Ramblas. Great rooms - stylish and immaculately clean. Absolute bargain. Book it without reservation - this is a fautless hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: raykm
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice decor but very small room and restaurant closed on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pulitzer”
Reviews.Author: llopez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect combination of cool and edgy without being intimidating. The staff is excellent, location can't be beat. Internet was next door at the Regina, health club a few blocks away. We'd stay here again in a minute. Sasha, Amanda and Aide were particulary helpful at the desk. The only down side was the early morning noise from the hotel across the street. We got used to it, but it might be bothersome for a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “hard to fault and the glass lift is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: blueaugusto
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel partly because I loved its funky decor from the website pictures, and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were friendly and courteous, though the barstaff were not too good on cocktails! Food in the restaurant was excellent, though sadly it's not open on sundays, meaning we had to resort to a limited and unimpressive room service menu. Rooms are small but tasteful with great bathrooms and showers, and I was sorely tempted to steal the wardrobe door handles as they were just what I'm looking for! The hotel has all the amenities you want - room safes, tv, great bar area, nice breakfast, newspapers, access to holmes gym with pool around the corner. I especially liked the glass lift (not so good if you're scared of heights!) and the way the rooms line the lobby which goes up to the roof - this means you can lean down from the 6th floor and shout at people in the bar! My only gripes would be the usual - not enough coat hangers (are hotels only allowed to have so many coat hangers on the premises?), no iron, crap room service menu and limited mini bar. Also the damn italian football supporters who sang and cheered all sunday nights whilst we were trying to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Pulitzer. The hotel has a modern sleek decor with a cool bar on the first floor. The staff was very helpful and very personable. It's location is a block from one end of Las Ramblas, which seemed to be where we spent most of our time. Everything really was walking distance from the hotel and Las Ramblas. Our only minor complaint is that they didn't have irons in the rooms (which seemed to be a European thing based on other countries visited with same trend). Iit took 3 days to get an iron, which was a pain having to deal with wrinkled clothes : (

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarion for 1 night in May and it was great! The rooms are very small, but nicely decorated with modern furnishings. The staff was very nice and helpful. You cannot beat the location! The hotel is located right around the corner from Las Ramblas. Wish we could have stayed longer but our cruise left the next day! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Style”
Reviews.Author: TYGC
Reviews.Content: Exceptional value - clean, modern and superb service. The staff was the BEST. Very helpful with our internet needs. Highly recommend - you won't be disappointed. Thank you Amanda for all your extra help.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed several days at the Pulitzer and really enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is as cool as the pictures on the website portray it. We asked for a quiet room and were given a room on the back, which didn't have much of a view, but was quiet. The room was on the small side, but the beds were very comfortable and the decor and design was chic and modern. Our mini-bar was on the fritz which was a pain because we wanted to store wine in it, but he hotel provided buckets of ice from the bar, which worked out fine. On the roof they have a large, confortably furnished terrrace which doesn't overlook anything, but was a nice place to take drink and put your feet up at the end of the day. My wife ate at the restaurant and said her meal was excellent. The hotel is well located and very charming - highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Swish and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was 1 minute from Plaza Catalunya (with its great frequent airport bus and tourist tour buses) and Las Ramblas for the bars and nightlife. The staff were friendly and helpful and decor looked more 'W' than the lower grade this chain has in the US. Our room was swish with crisp white bed linen, huge bath towels, robes, slippers and cool dark wood floors. We found it the perfect location and very quiet, considering how central the hotel was. And we paid less than the $240 quoted here, more like £100/$180 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern, Cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location next to las ramblas...but even more importantly, it is very sophisticated, stylish and initimate. The front desk can help you get on the guestlist for any club and also reserve any restaurant for you. Julian is very helpful, has great insider tips and recommendations. Instead of choosing a huge, impersonal hotel...try something like the pulitzer so you can get a better feel for modern barcelona and . it's a cosy and classy place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Location & Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: a_holiday_reviewer
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. You walk into a beautiful reception area and are welcomed by friendly staff who all speak excellent English. The rooms are stunning and immaculately cleaned every day, we had french windows which looked over the courtyard, the room was spacious and the design is modern and stylish. You get slippers, bath robes, an electronic safe, power shower, sky tv, everything you could need. We had breakfast in the outside courtyard which was lovely, would definitely reccommend. Evening drinks on the beautiful roof terrace was also one of my favourite things. The location is perfect, you're at the top of Las Ramblas,really central, and right next to the underground station for going further afield. Would definitely reccommend this hotel. Have a look at the photos attached. P.S An amazing restaurant and really reasonably priced is la crema canela - just of las ramblas, off a little side street from Placa Reial - beautiful food, and lovely atmosphere, so different to the big touristy restaurants in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - bad soundproofing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late March 2006. I agree with other reviews that this hotel is in an excellent location and that it is stylish. What has not been mentioned, and maybe it only affects rooms overlooking Bergara (or Vergara) Street, is the noise. We were on the first floor. The soundproofing on the balcony doors is non existant. The street and traffic noise from people going by lasts until about 4am. Then building work appeared to start close by, at least that is what it sounded like - rubble being poured down a funnel into a skip. The hotel next door looked like it was being renovated. Then there was the garbage collection. Then the street cleaners hose down the roads and pavements, then the morning traffic starts up again (except Sunday). Got about 4 hours sleep a night at best! Probably can't blame the hotel for the noise but they should put in better glazing. Other than that the hotel was great. Breakfast was filling and was a good start to the long day. The bar was relaxed and the roof terrace was nice for a rest and a view during the day or night, although the outdoor bar was not open when we were there (bring your own beer!). The Metro station is just round the corner and the bus from the Airport ( a bargain at 3.75 Euro) drops you off at the other side of Placa Catalunya Sq (outside the Cort Ingles department store). We will definitely return to Barcelona, and now that we know where everything is, will have a more relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minky007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights, for a wedding anniversary trip to Barcelona. The hotel is on a side road. It is in a fantastic location, just off Placa Catalunya. Make sure you take the open top bus from here. This is the best way to see the city and gain perspective. We arrived before our room was ready (at 1pm) but they quickly sorted this. Our room (111) was lovely. Long and narrow but didn't feel small (probably because of the high ceilings). The bathroom was also lovely with big fluffy towels! Within a few minutes of being in our room, there was a knock on the door and a bottle of Champagne, with the compliments of the hotel staff (for our anniversary). A lovely little touch! I only have a couple of negative comments for the hotel. First, the English language TV channels in the room are limited. We didn't spend very much time in the room but it would've been nice to watch something other than Sky News/CNN/MTV when we were there! Second, is that the hotel is noisy. This is due to a combination of hardwood floors throughout the hotel and open internal balconies on each floor, which made noise travel and echo throughout the building. My tip for this is to request a room as far away from the lifts as possible. I can't guarantee that this will solve the problem but may help! Barcelona is a fantastic city. Lots to see and do and great food. If you don't mind paying, go to Noti and Moo for some delicious food!!

Reviews.Title: “A chain hotel pretending to be a boutique”
Reviews.Author: KeithTalent
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again, despite a great location (v. central, just off Plaza de Catalunya) and designer (if empty) bar. Stayed 3 nights - one day there was literally no hot water at all, the next there was no cold water at all, only scalding hot. They acknowledged they are having problems - but this isn't much consolation. Rooms were very smart, if a little small. They were noisy, thanks to clunkingly heavy doors which slam constantly. Rooftop bar was good on Thursday nights when there is a DJ, but appeared to be closed otherwise (you could still sit up there on the sofas etc though). Check the status of the plumbing before you book - other guests were also left without hot and/or cold water during their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with one but”
Reviews.Author: west12
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location with very helpful staff. It is very stylish and although the rooms are small they were not claustrophobic. Breakfasts were good in a very pleasant setting. Price is reasonable for the quality. I would definitely stay again. Only one 'but', mentioned by other people - instead of nice double bed to cuddle in a romantic city, we were given two single beds pushed together. We didn't want to waste time and effort asking why and for a different room - and in the end I was sorry I didn't push the point. But that said - don't hesitate to book this hotel - you are right in the centre of all the action, close to important transport links, and with a bit of style - which is what Bareclona is all about!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From a recommendation on this site, my husband, son and I spent a week at the Pulitzer this month. It's perfectly located on a quiet street right off the Plaza Catalunya, two blocks from the start of La Rambla (main walking street) and all roads leading to other parts of town. The hotel is brand new, not yet listed in all the guide books, boutique-style, modern and friendly. Lots of dark wood, white sofas/furniture, modern art and very high ceilings. The rooms are built around an atrium with glass elevators. The rooms are very large, clean, modern, quiet and have a flat screen tv and the bathrooms are very large with all the amenities. The spacious bar/lobby area is an oasis from the hot weather - the bartenders are spirited and friendly. You have a choice to sit outside or in a lovely garden for breakfast. The breakfast is included in the room rate and offers many choices from all kinds of fruit to eggs, meats, cheeses, breads, cereals and yogurt. The front desk staff is fantastic. Everyone speaks English and are all knowledgeble and friendly. Julian, the night manager, knows all the ins and outs of Barcelona from years of experience in the hotel business in Barcelona. I highly recommend this hotel and will return; we had a great trip to Barcelona!
